hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A very warm and welcoming staff. The Hokulani is centrally located with many great restaurants nearby. The roof top pool, lounge chairs and cabanas put this venue over-the-top. Condos are very clean. Beds and living room furniture recently upgraded. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: As with every other Hilton resort I have ever visited. Hokulani is gorgeous. Right near the beach, there are shops and restaurants everywhere. The one bedroom suite that we occupied, was very beautiful. Full kitchen, three tv's (one in the mirror in the bathroom), dishwasher, it even had a rice cooker. All the amenities you need for a comfortable getaway. This place is a must

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very nice property. About a block or so from the beach. Lots of eating options nearby but we were also able to cook some small meals in the kitchen. There was a drip coffee maker and a rice cooker. Pots and pans were also good quality. We stayed for a week so cooked several of the days. Very large bathroom which probably appeals to many guests, underutilized by us as a long soak in the tub seemed less interesting than all the loveliness outside. Parking attendants were great, very efficient. $40 a day is a lot but you are in the heart of the tourist area. We did drive out most days and found it convenient to see areas other than Waikiki. But also enjoyed just walking to things nearby so probably would still stay in same area if we come back. Staff was very friendly. Some downsides. Bed was very soft. We were on the 5 th floor above the AC and near the street. Both were loud so we could not keep the patio doors open. We had asked to switch but they said they were all booked.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hotel service was outstanding. The view and the roof top “pool” were less than expected. Pool was 3 foot deep and about 5 foot wide. The staff service made up for these short comings. Cassel was especially friendly and helpful as was Sue.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stay was pleasant, easy walk to beach, restaurants, shopping! We came with our young family and there was something for everyone! Would recommend to friends and would definitely return! Small but usable kitchen for easy meals in the go!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hokulani is gorgeous. It’s clean, fresh, and has an amazing, welcoming staff. It is situated directly amongst a ton of shops and a 5 minute walk to the beach. I have zero complaints & can’t wait to go again!!!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel is perfect. Right in the centre of Waikiki Beach. 5 mins walk to the beach, across the road from shops and next to restaurants and cafes. The rooms are spacious, immaculately clean and there is a laundry on every floor. The gym and pool area are great. High quality, clean and spacious. This is an ideal location and would return

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have enjoyed many vacations with RCI. The staff employed at these resorts have always been willing to please and very helpful. However, ALL employees at the Hokulani employees were top notch. I wish I could thank each one personally. This includes the desk employees, concierge, valet and housekeeping. Kudos to them all.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is beautiful hotel right in the heart of Waikiki. The rooms are spacious and very updated. Better than the hotel, though, is the staff - they are warm & friendly. They really bring the warmth of the islands to your stay. Kudos to the Parking Attendants - the best ever!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great resort in all aspects. Staff, location and unit. Exceeded expectations. Rooftop pool with private cabanas that had TVs, fridges and lots of seating. There was also a rooftop bar available. Would go back at any time.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We really enjoyed our ten-night stay in the Hokulani Waikiki this January. The room was certainly big enough for the two of us, including a super-sized bathroom with separate closets and a separate shower and bath. The bidet-enabled water closet was also a nice touch, self-contained from the main bath. The fridge initially looked small, but it was quite than adequate for us. We were able to make our own meals for the vast majority of our meals, taking down the Waikiki vacay price tag considerably. The bed was clean and comfortable, and there was a sofa bed as well, in case of an extra guest, which we didn't need. Dishwasher was a bit noisy, but it worked well and saved us some valuable time. No need to buy detergents as these were provided, both for dishes and clothing. An on-floor laundry room came in handy to reduce the need to pack so many clothes.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent service and location. Boutique type hotel with studio suites. Very quiet and clean. Pool is a bit small, but perfect for cooling off. Quiet and low key. Service was excellent as well as the location.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Convenient location, walking distance to many shops and restaurants. The Bell Service is great, always waiting to assist guest when arriving or departing daily. Most staff is helpful and friendly only had 1 front desk worker who was rude but we did not let that ruin our trip.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The property is excellent! It is at a perfect spot to go and do things. I gave it five stars for this. We checked in on a Saturday, and stayed til the next Saturday. I am an RCI member, and on a family budget, and by the time we left from our 7 days, our bill from the resort was $305.90!! BEWARE OF THIS!! On the website for this property, RCI does tell you about the $30/day, but it still was a shock. The charge was $30/day and $9.00/day fees w/o tax. I asked what we were given for the high fees, and were told we get the use of the facilities and 2 bottles of water a day. I liked the free washer/dryer and they did supply us with laundry detergent (not softener). We didn't rent a car. We used Uber to and from the airport, which with tip, was around $33.00 each trip. I liked the resort, as it's a 15 min. walk to the largest mall, and just across the street from another large mall. Denny's was just down the street (5 minutes walk), and we mostly ate at the food court of the malls. Budget yourself around $50 a meal for 2. The Trolley system was great! It was about 5 minutes away as well, but you have to walk thru the Galleria mall to get to it. We thought the trolley was public transportation by all the flyers, but they were actually tours. We just decided where we wanted to go for the day, and hopped on the colored trolley that went by the place we wanted to go. It wasn't really all that expensive to get trolley tickets. We bought ours for the week even before we got over there. We went to Pearl Harbor by way of the trolley, as well as the palace, and the circle island stops it made. It was nice just hopping on one and seeing where it went, and just enjoying the breeze as you went places. I will not stay at this resort again! Not only did it charge a lot of points to stay here, but the fees were just too much, and I expected more from a Hilton property. I could of stayed down the walkway at the Embassy Suite and had a breakfast provided and not have to stay so long, as 7 days was too long. We did come in a day early and stayed at the Embassy Suite with points. We felt like we were in Hollywood, with the high end malls all around us (if that is your thing, but it wasn't ours). At least there were ABC stores all around to get souvenirs from, as well as snacks and sandwiches. I didn't see any grocery stores around to go and buy food items. But, then again, I didn't ask the concierge either. But, we did walk all over the place.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Once you find this place you’ll appreciate the service and location. The manager guy here is Mitch and he has like this super cool salt and pepper hair that makes you think ok this guy isn’t young but he’s young enough to have a young person hairstyle. Oh and he fluent Japanese too. So he’s doubly cool

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I stayed here by myself a few weeks ago in a very nice room with two double beds. All of the rooms I have stayed in have one or two beds, large bathroom with shower and cool tub, kitchenette with high quality kitchen appliances - cook top, small refrigerator, large ice maker, coffee pot , rice cooker, pots, pans and dishes/silverware. Staff could not have been more helpful and friendly. The hotel is very safe. In order to get the elevator you need your room key - everyone needs to use a key in order to program in the floor you are going to. There is now an Italian restaurant / wine bar on the main level that is open for dinner only. I really do love the atmosphere here! The pool deck and lounge chairs and cabanas with TVs is on the top 16th floor. There are two computers and a printer available off the lobby. There is a large safe in each room. There is also a washer and dryer on each floor.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent location in the heart of Waikiki with Yardhouse and Tiffany's within 50 feet of you. Beach is a 5 minute stroll away, as is the International Marketplace. Not your typical HGVC resort property. Very upscale and urban. You wont be able to grill a steak on an outdoor common area grill here, but you can walk to Ruth Chris instead. Small fitness center, but you are very close to Fort Derussy park.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I loved my stay here! The staff is so welcoming and friendly. Everything is sparkling clean! The location is amazing! Lots of restaurants nearby but also very easy to eat in! Can get drinks, snacks, some deli & other food at ABC's, there's a small one steps away or a bigger one about 2 blocks down to right. There were also vendors right outside to the right on Sunday night, got some fresh fruit & wonderful Chinese food there, good for a couple nights! There's also a Farmer's Market Monday, Tuesday, & Thursday 4-8 pm at the bank (left out of resort up to main road & turn left, just down a little bit), there are a bunch of vendors, lots of food options, I'd suggest the coconut rice w/mango, yum!! There's also a little cafe right around the corner (left & then left onto main street), The Gorilla in the Cafe (next to Long's/CVS) has great fresh bagels, I loved their Caprese Bagel!! Beach is super close but give the rooftop pool a try too! Gorgeous view!No need for a car, book a ride from Hawaii23, just $23 bucks from the airport! Friendly drivers!Tub is amazing, can put on tv in bathroom mirror to the music stations while you soak! Never heard any neighbors!Had to do a little work while I was here (submitting grades), they have a business center, can use their computers & even print for free. You also get a DVD rental card for the DVD rental machine (think Red Box) in the Business Center.Wonderful resort, can't wait to go back!!!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Absolutely love this property. Location is great. View is beautiful and also close to the beach. Would definitely visit again. Resort offers many activities throughout the week that was family fun ...

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Short walk to the beach, shops, lots of eateries, rooftop pool is small but perfect for the 3-foot + tall children 6 feet adults can sit down and cool off) and rooftop bar is a plus with HH and complimentary sun block.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our first trip to Hawaii and the staff made us fell right at home. The hotel staff recommended the best places to see and eat. They were also able to book several shows for us at a discounted rate. They meet all of our needs and more.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Staff here were very helpful, from housekeeping, to valet, to concierge. Everyone made you feel welcome. Wasn't sure about using valet only, but them made it seamless. Loved the eating options around the hotel.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very nice staff. Concierge especially helpful. Front desk people also helpful. Small units. $30 day resort fee which is inexcusable and doesn't get you anything a resort should provide anyway. Basic fitness center. I tried to use computer in business center. Maintenance had to be called and I never was able to use it. Good location.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The location of the property is best. It is close to everything. The rooms are beautiful and clean. The service was excellent. We used valet parking service and the valet was courteous and always on time when we requested our vehicle.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We loved the one bedroom apartment we had at the Hokulani. The room was pristine! Very clean and immaculately put together. The bed and pillows were divine, towels great and the amenities and kitchen fantastic. The welcome on arrival was lovely with a ph call 15mins after we arrived in the room to check we had everything we needed. We headed up to the pool deck which has great views and comfy loungers and cabanas and a handy bar! Definitely on our list for a revisit!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Beautiful resort, waking distance to beach and restaurant. You do not need a car. Weather was fantastic in November. Rooftop pool was clean and plenty of lounge chairs. Grocery basic within 200 yards of lower level.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location in a less crowded part of Waikiki, but still near the beach, restaurants and shopping. Located less about a block from Waikiki Beach and 3 or 4 blocks from Dukes, Hula Grill and dozens of other restaurants. The Yard House was our favorite and less than a block. The International Marketplace and many retail stores are also within walking distance. We rented a car for a day trio to the north shore and explored other parts of Oahu.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hokulani staff are the best customer service team! We stayed for our anniversary and were welcomed like Family. Michelle, Josh, and Bryan, continue to excel at personal interaction and making you feel at home. Thje room had a new couch, new TV-cable package, and the water pressure in the bathroom sinks had been greatly improved. We love staying here!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you come to Hawaii for shopping, and busy city streets, good choice (maybe rates 4 or 5); if you come to Hawaii to enjoy the serenity of the beach and beautiful scenery, not so good. On the plus side, relatively short walk to a number of good restaurants.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great room and facilities, good location and friendly services. Would love to be back if we can get the same room for affordable rates. Roof top pool and spa is very enjoyable but hoped the happy hour drinks would be more affordable.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The resort was well located, a block from Beach Walk near shops, beach front and activities. While a boutique resort, it offered amenities guests would be interested in and it's location fabulous . It was near many restaurants , public transportation , shopping centers and just a few blocks from Queen's beach and Fort Debussy waterfront and park.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel was very nice the people was very friendly. And they care about you.i feel like you are in heart of everything the stores bus line.lots of places to eat and lots of things to do.the beach are great walking distance

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Lovely room and very quiet. Just beautiful Right in the middle of Waikiki. Walking access to everything. Loved everything about this place!! Can’t wait to go back again. Family loved it!!!! Aloha!!!!!!!!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Absolutely nothing! We had a fabulous stay in room 1203 with a partial ocean view and from the minute we arrived till we left , it was superb. The staff were great- housekeeping excellent. Our room was immaculate, with a fabulous bathroom. We ate at the restaurant within the hotel a couple of times and again, the staff were great- very welcomingWe found the location to suit us down to the ground. We went almost everywhere on foot( including into Honolulu itself), mad just a short walk to the main section of Waikiki beach.Plenty of restaurants nearby, I can’t fault the hotel at all. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The location is superb with the exception of being beachfront. Loads of shops and restaurants around and easy spot for tour bus pickups.The nearest beach access leads to an almost non-existent beach but we didn't go to HI to spend time on the beach.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very nice property. On the Beachwalk district with nearby shopping and eateries. Convenient to bus routes also. No need to have a rental car as parking is expensive. Room was spacious and amenities was sufficient. Must check out view from rooftop pool.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location and an excellent staff. Rooms are nice. Concierge is very knowledgeable and will help enhance your trip. Help you to see all the island has to offer. I suggest you talk to locals as well. Our driver on our Pearl harbor trip told us the best places to eat.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Central location to eating, shopping and beach. Starting location for Hop on Hop Off trolley is a 5 min walk. Beach access also 5 min away but the beach does get crowded. Would recommend taking time to research area and decide places to visit. Trolley has multiple lines but you need a day pass. We did a pass for 3 days. Worked for us. BTW, the hotel has a good Italian restaurant attached.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hokulani is smack in the middle of the high end shopping district. For folks wanting the high end shopping experience this is the place. Walking distance to Waikiki beach, but super crowded as expected. There are plenty of other beaches outside Waikiki that are super nice and less crowded. Parking is valet only and is expensive, but goes with the territory of being in the middle of high end shops. There are no 2 bedroom rooms in the entire building, just 1 bedroom and a pull out sofa with sliding dividing doors. It may have been explained somewhere but I clearly missed it. Overall, staff were super nice and helpful, and the rooms were very clean. Enjoyed the hot tub at the top floor and the view wasn't bad either.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It was my fiancé’s first trip ever and my first to the Hawaiian Islands! The accommodations were comfortable and clean! The hotel staff was professional, courteous, and helpful. The valet attendants were quick and friendly!!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hilton Grand was clean and newly renovated. There were just enough dishes, glasses, etc. The bed was comfortable however, the sitting area to watch TV was not comfortable at all! The sofa cushions dipped in to the middle and there was little back support. Ended up with an aching back!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A very nice property, located in the Waikiki area and close enough to walk to the beach. Disappointed in that there is no self parking and you are forced to valet for an absurd charge of $40 per night.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The staff really took care of us with just about anything we asked and a whole lot more. From check in to check out, professional and compassionate. We arrived early from Japan and the staff asked if we wanted to go to the rooftop under a cabana until the room was ready. We were able to sleep for a few and enjoy the coffee social and ice water. Everything went up from there. This is a great place and the entire staff made us feel just like family. I cannot wait to come back here again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We enjoyed our stay here at Hokulani. The room was spacious, clean, beautiful large bathroom. Loved the amenities and the high-tech elevator. Staff were very friendly and accommodating as well. Would highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The main Waikiki strip is on Kalakuau Ave. Hokulani (Star-heaven) is at the west end near Trump Tower and Ritz-Carlton. Then going east, the massive Royal Hawaiian complex begins with Tiffany's and Starbucks.  The Hokulani lobby is one floor up from the street.  To access the beach, I recommend going through the Royal Hawaiian Mall, all the way past Dukes and Blue Note to turn down the public access with the surfboard storage on either side. It is about 2 blocks. Other ways are more difficult if you want to access the main part of the beach.  The hotel has a rooftop sun deck and bar, but sea views are through other hotels. Still, it is a better view than what the Ritz-C has. The rooms-suites are great! The hotel staff goes out of their way to make your experience better than just good enough.  In the room, there is room to store groceries and a small cooktop for some cooking. If that is desirable, then I recommend going from the airport to Costco / grocery store, then to the hotel. But if you are looking for affordable eating options, and you like Japanese, I recommend the Japanese Food Hall.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This Hotel Is Associated With Hilton Grand Vacations And For Any Couple Going To Waikki For Their First Time It Truly Is The Best. My Girlfriend And I Went In April To Oahu For 5 Days Staying At Hokulani And From The Second We Arrived We Truly Felt Like We Were Staying Somewhere Magical! We Had A One Bedroom Suite With A Spectacular View Overlooking The Ocean / Kalakaua Ave. We Love How This Hotel Is Truly In The Heart Of Shopping Restaurants And Not Even A 5 Minute Walk From The Beach. I Suggest This Hotel For Couples Only Because At Times You Can Hear The Hustle And Bustle Of The Attractions Around You, Even Late At Night. This Did Not Hinder Me Or My Girlfriends Sleep At All Though. We Love Hokulani And The Question Is Not Where But When We Will Return To This Amazing Hotel!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If your looking for somewhere beautiful and clean with an awesome staff and a great location - this is the place to stay! If you’re looking for a place with a nice pool, then this is not the place for you... We still give it a 5 star rating overall because the ocean is just a couple of blocks away but a nice pool would have put it over the top! Thank you to the Hokulani staff!!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hokulani room in the heart of Waikiki provided comfortable, private living space for two couples. Restaurants and shopping locations throughout the Beach Walk, Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center, and surrounding commercial space provided limitless choices and selections.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This vacation spot was well located, a short walk to the beach and right in the middle of all of the action that is Waikiki. One side of the resort faces the street, which is nice but a tiny bit noisy. The other apparently faces a wall. The rooms are newly renovated and really nice, very clean. We even used the pull out sofa and it was comfy! The kitchenette has EVERYTHING you could possibly need, and the bathrooms are very spacious. The lobby is gorgeous, with this beautiful outdoor seating area by a large fountain. However, there is no bar and the restaurant attached to the resort does not have a liquor license that extends to the patio. So, no food, no drink in that space. Not sure what you would want to do there. It's a big waste of space in my opinion. And the fountain is bigger than the roof top pool!! Nice to look at but useless.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Loved staying at this bran new hotel close to all the hip shops and restaurants and a short walk to the beach Everyone was super friendly even had free eukalaly lessons Modern furnishings and high end everything loved staying here! Will come back again soon

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location, great staff, great hotel, we love to stay here, the staff are friendly and professional, we feel like we are coming home each time we stay here, looking to book again for trip number 6 to Waikiki and trip number 3 staying at the Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We brought our daughter, SIL & our 4 grandkids with us to Oahu, & the 8 of us spent time together at the Wyndham timeshare across the st for 5 nights. The last 2 nights my husband & I came over to the Hokulani & the room with beautiful & the entire sttaff was very helpful & made us feel so special. We'd love to return! Very conveniently located too.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great Resort centrally located in the heart of Waikiki. 1 block from the beach. Suite was excellent - clean and looks to be newly renovated, if not it has been well maintained. Staff is excellent and the best service compared to other hotel/resort. Great value if you don't have to have a resort/hotel by the beach.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our first time stating at HOKULANI and it will not be our last. I love not only the room and location but the staff was the best of any HGVC we have visited. The location is right next to Royal Hawaiian Center which has some of the best resturants in Waikiki. And is an easy walk to many others.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The staff are so friendly and helpful. We love coming to stay. You are walking distance from most major Waikiki activities including beach day. Rooms are decently sized and has all the amenities you need, beds are super comfortable and the views are awesome from the rooftop pool/lounge.
user_name:
Sandy D
Kula, Hawaii, United States

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: While not oceanfront, this vacation club facility is nicely located for access to the beach, shopping, and dining. The accomodations exceeded expectations. They are clean, roomy, and well appointed. The staff is friendly and accomodating.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The unit was spotless, ultra modern and beautifully decorated in a minimalist style. It had everything we needed. It was in a great location a few minutes from Waikiki beach, shops and major hotels.Staff were very friendly and helpful. This was a great spot to come home to after a busy day sightseeing.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Everything was exceptional but this is not our idea of a resort. The rooftop pool is really a plunge. But we knew that when it was all we could get through RCI. The staff was very nice and helpful. Location was perfect for being in the mix of everything.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Just spent 3 relaxing days at the Hokulani Waikiki. The location was perfect, walking distance to restaurants and shopping, as well as a short walk to the beach. The room was clean and well maintained, the staff friendly and courteous. We had a room with a view on the high floor, so we did not hear any of the street noises. The hotel was a sea of calm when compared to the hustle and bustle right outside its doors. It was a perfect vacation for us, will definitely be back.Best way to travel between the hotel and airport is via Charley's Taxi $29 one way.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We spent a week here and really enjoyed it. It is a 5 minute walk to a good beach with rentals of lounges, beach umbrellas and boards, etc. It is really close to good restaurants. Our room was on a high floor with a small balcony you could stand on and look at but not really lounge on. The only pool and spa are on a wind sheltered roof with nice lounges and a bar and cabanas on a first come first serve basis. It is not brilliant but works. We had a sitting area with a table and two chairs and a couch (hideabed). Large bathroom with huge shower and also a tube and separate water closet. Free DVDs to check out and a restaurant right off the second floor lounge that had really good food. Staff was nice all around.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: So convenient. 7-11, longs drugs, ABC store right downstairs. Just as close are a handful of highly rated restaurants (nakamura ramen, ginza tonkotsu, bills, tommy Bahamas, Henry’s place). A block and a half away is the shuttle stop for the pink line that takes you to the zoo, aquarium and more shopping. HUI (car sharing) is directly accessible from this hotel, saving us hundreds from car rental + parking. We were able to rent the car for a run to Target/Walmart (ala moana), honouma bay, and even the dole plantation.The hotel itself was modern and clean. Staff was extremely helpful and nice. 2 bottles of water magically appear in our room each day. We had our room cleaned on Tuesday and it was immaculate! 2 large LCDs, and even a tv in the mirror of the bathroom. The bidet kept our tushies warm was a nice touch.It was such a nice stay.. we had the best time here.If traveling via RCI, there is an additional $40/day (hotel fees) that was not mentioned anywhere.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: a few blocks from the beach, and right on the shopping strip....you will find plenty of restaurants, and shops to keep you occupied. Rent a car at the mall half a mile away.....or stay in your room all day. It's a combination of Japanese style and modern architecture. The Service was outstanding. We would request things and they were the most prompt we have ever encountered. The WELCOME at the front desk was the best I have ever received anywhere. Thorough and enthusiastic. I was so impressed.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our family had a wonderful trip. The hotel was beautiful. The location was very near the beach. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a nice family getaway!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent Hilton property to stay in. Location is superb. Staff and amenities are comparable to the ritz Carlton. Staff was friendly and attentive to our needs. All staff was kind a courteous from the front desk down to the maintenance workers. All respectful and courteous

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Best location and literally can walk outside go down escalator to shops and eateries! Beach is only 4 blocks from hotel located on the Waikiki beach walk. Will definitely use this location again when in Ohau!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The location, the room, the staff, everything was fabulous!! We had allergy restrictions and the staff were so helpful in making sure that my daughter was comfortable, all the way down to making sure our room had a new toaster. Counting the days until our next visit.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great place to stay. Love the view from the rooftop pool. The room was very nice with a great floor plan. Easy walk to many restaurants and attractions. Definitely visit Diamond Head and Pearl Harbor while on the island.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I don't reccomend to stay this hotel.When I check in, front staff never explain hot water heater is under repair. At night, when I took shower, almost cold water came from shower head.I complain to front desk, one of the male staff said that currently many guests using shower and please wait 1 hour and you may get hot water. I said I cannot accept such a unprofessional explanation and ask why this kind of case is happening. After my question, suddenly he said that Hilton already notify all guests that hot water hearter is under maintenance which front staff NEVER explained before. Additionally he said each floor elevator lobby, there is notice from hotel for hot water heater maintenance. I checked my floor, there is no notice.I was so dissapinted response from front desk staff and Hilton treatment. Who is expecting getting cold shower staying Hilton hotel in Honolulu ?They charged approx 500USD/night and I was so dissapinted. Thank you very much for Hilton's special treatment for us providing cold shower.I never use Hilton anymore.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Incredible destination and accommodation from this location. This is my first and my wife's 2nd time to Hawai'i, and I have to say this is the most beautiful Island I have been too to date. I don't travel much, so I know there are even more qorld locations I will eventually say this about, but I currently live in Southern California, and Hawai'i takes the cake as far as scenery in my opinion. The locals are all extremely friendly from our experiences on Oahu, and so much to do as faras hiking and water activities. Definitely recommend a 5 night stay at the least.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I'm very happy with our stay here! We usually stay in the village but this was a nice change of pace. It being more east of the village actually put you in the heart of it all. If I was a younger man I would have loved exploring the night life in the area, which is all walkable by the way.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Love the people there, extremely helpful and friendly. Definitely will book for my future trip. Although we just spend one night at Hilton, the experience was amazing. Very patient servicers and extremely helpful .

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I love the locations, so close to the beach, shopping and wonderful eating places. We enjoy Ruth Chris and PF Chang, which were so close. .Easy walking distance to everything that interest us.The pool is on the 16th floor overlooking the city and mountain side.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hokulani Waikiki was located within a block of the beach, and was a very easy walk. It was also close to shopping at the Royal Hawaiian Center. Service within the resort was very friendly and helpful, sharing much Aloha! We would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Everything at Hokulani was first class. Location,staff, and service within proximity of everything this is our go to in Waikiki. It’s a must see I would recommend this location to anyone. Go see for yourselves

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great new, modern fantastic place to stay in Hawaii! If you like luxury, amenities and everything else in your hotel room, this is The place to stay!!! Love the Hilton. This hotel is the best and newest in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Hokulani Waikiki for a few days over Super bowl weekend. I have nothing negative to say about this resort. The location is excellent, the rooms are clean and beautiful and overall the resort just has an adult sexy feel to it. I will definitely be returning for future stays.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our first stay at this facility. We were treated very well by the entire staff. Our room was well appointed and the location enabled us to avoid renting a car as there were many great restaurants within walking distance as well as shopping.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Almost everything is fantastic about this resort- the staff (especially Front Desk & Concierge), its location in Waikiki, the very well equipped units, etc.Resort fees are very expensive at $40+ per day (including taxes).Not a real swimming pool though only a child's wading pool. But a good hot tub Jacuzzi.Top of the line Precor equipment in the small Fitness Centre.Waikiki Beach is about a 10-15 minute walk away.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed in room 1210 from Jan 28th through Feb 1st and only have positive things to say about the property. It’s in a pretty busy area in Honolulu so, all the very outgoing people will have a wonderful time. There’s literally a mall right next to the property. There’s an Italian restaurant inside the hotel and plenty of other restaurants around the property itself. We didn’t go to the pool or use other hotel services throughout our stay. The weather was pretty crappy the whole stay but luckily the property has umbrellas for guests but in a limited fashion.
user_name:
YungTPS
West New York, New Jersey

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The first time we had a free week. Obviously, this was more expensive in extra fees. A VERY nice place to stay. It was a little loud for us small town people. We liked being right in the middle of busy Honolulu and the beach was a short walk.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The service was great, the employees were so very nice and helpful. The room is beautiful and clean. The location of the hotel is perfect being in the heart of Waikiki. If I had to try to come up with a negative, the bed was a little lumpy but it didn’t stop me from getting a good nights rest. We will be back.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hokulani has the friendliest staff ever! Although you have to pay for parking, the valet service was fast and prompt. The room was clean and has the best Internet connectivity. No passwords needed! The beach is just about 5-10 minutes walk. We truly enjoyed our stay at Hokulani!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We took our 20+ year old sons on a one week vacation as their Christmas present. Was a fabulous family vacation (especially as they had their own room!) The resort has a rooftop lanai with a bar/pool/jacuzzi, lots of lounges and 6 cabanas that all had couches/chairs/table/fridge and a tv! It was covered so really nice place for a break. The free laundry facilities on each floor made for much lighter travel packing - a real plus! The rooms are large and really nice. The resort doesn't have all the fluff and stuff of the larger resorts which was perfect for us as we are seasoned travelers. Perfect location, great staff and one of the best family vacations ever!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Location location location and numerous other guests mentioned the location is great if you love to be in the middle of all the action, restaurant, shopping, and walking distance to the famous beach. The room we stayed in was excellent and the free laundry detergent and facilities was a real added surprise bonus. The view from the rooftop is great and relaxing. Although the pool is not suitable to swim as at first i thought it was a lap pool the hot tub makes up for this especially if you want just to sit back and relax with a mocktail haha. To top everything off the staff are some of the friendliest we have come across. Remember everyone's taste and expectations are different but I would have no hesitation in recommending this property to our family and friends. Mahalo nui loa and alooooha and God be with you until we meet again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My family and I stay here almost every time we come to Oahu. We love the staff and the friendliness. They are amazing! The location is great and there are tons of places to eat and shop super close by. We love walking around the area and we feel so safe. We will definitely be back again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Most everything was awesome, the staff, the hotel (resort), the rooms, the location, the roof top cabanas and pool area, all great. We really enjoyed our 2 week stay at the Hilton Hokulani. Loads and loads of shopping close by, the beach is only 1 and a bit blocks away. We thought parking fee was too high, but we were able to find parking elsewhere. This resort is hard to book in RCI, it is not available very often, if you see it book with confidence.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The closest beaches were the best. Valet parking was very efficient and saved us time and energy. All staff were friendly, informative and helpful. The room made us feel very spoiled. Rice cooker was definitely a must as everyone in Hawaii eats rice. The dvd card was an awesome bonus. Close to stores that had island ambiance and goods.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: From the first moment we arrived to the last minute before departure - the staff was OUTSTANDING!! Every single one!! Great location in the heart of Waikiki. Views from the rooms themselves are disappointing - no ocean views here. But the rooftop makes up for it - the views from here are beautiful. The cabanas are comfortable, equipped with a television. Lounge chairs to enjoy the views and sun. Pool is refreshing but pay attention - not your regular description of a pool. Ample warmed towels. Poolside bar. The rooms are very nice, everything you need supplied. The sofa bed does not have a comfortable mattress but they did their best to give it more padding. The complimentary laundry was a bonus. A comfortable space for two couples. Not located on the beach but a short distance away. I would not recommend this "condo" for a family with children due to the lack of activities for their age group but would definitely recommend for adults.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This place is on Lewer's St, right in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but is quiet and relaxing with a rooftop pool and bar. The rooms are modern and spacious with a full kitchen. The staff was helpful in suggesting local places to eat and things to do. You can walk out the door and head to the beach or shop, eat and bar-hop!
user_name:
Mary Beth W
Island of Hawaii, Hawaii

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We didn't want to stay at one of the large Hilton locations and appreciated the intimacy of this small location that is packed with nice amenities and warm, friendly staff. It is also within walking distance to the beach and many restaurants and shopping locations.
user_name:
Lilia R
Sandia Park, United States

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This all-suites hotel is nicely located in Waikiki, within walking distance to the beach, restaurants and many attractions in Honolulu. The entrance to the hotel is actually on Lewers, which is a relatively quiet street across from Starbucks and PF Changs, which makes it very convenient. Staff was extremely helpful, building was built in 2010 and well maintained, and has an excellent rooftop "plunging pool" and hot tub area with cabanas/bar and a view of the beaches. Very nice!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The check in was very easy. The rooms were clean and nicely equiped. The staff are very friendly. I enjoyed my stay. The ice maker stopped working and it was repaired within an hour by removing the system and reinstallung a new one. Great service.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This resort was fabulous. Perfect location. Located very close to the beaches and the shopping. We walked down to the International Marketplace for dinner. That mall has been beautifully remodeled. Units are small but very functional. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a great stay at Hokulani Waikiki. Our room was amazing with a huge seperate bath tub, a rain shower with good water pressure, a separate loungeroom and a great mini kitchen area. Unfortunately the room was not soundproofed and could be a little noisy in the morning. The onsite laundry was great and free of charge!! We enjoyed the rooftop pool and bar. We used the valet service which was extremely convenient however very expensive at $40/night and the valet staff were very hit and miss with their service. The hotel is in an excellent location, close to shops, restaurants and the beach.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Outstanding stay at Hilton Hokulani. Staff made guest feel welcomed and appreciated. Rooms were modern and beautiful. Facilities were in excellent state of repair. Fair to mention however, parking fees at this facility cost more than our car rental for the week.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We just spent a month in the Hawaiian Islands. Three weeks in Maui and one week in Oahu. Our last week we stayed at the Hokulani Waikiki and were pleasantly surprised. Never having stayed at a Hilton Grand Vacation Resort we did not know what to expect but assumed it would be a very nice property. Our expectations were met. We had a two room suite. Living, dining and cooking facilities in one of the rooms and bedroom and bathroom in the other portion of the suite. Could completely separate the rooms by closing the sliding doors. Pool on the roof was fun and provided decent view of Waikiki. Had snacks and movie on Wednesday night by the pool. Beach in front of Outrigger Reef was very short walk away. Countless number of happy hours within minutes of resort. We even walked to the Ala Moana shopping center. It took us about 25 minute to get there. Very convenient location. Suite was adequate sized and very clean. Bathroom quite large with tub and separate walk in shower. Elevator service was great. Cannot say enough about the wonderful staff. They were friendly and helpful. We definitely want to stay here again and highly recommend it to others.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This property is right in the center of Waikiki and you are surrounded by food, entertainment, shopping, etc. The hotel has modern amenities and a small, but full kitchen. The staff is welcoming and always nearby if you need assistance.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: if at Hawaii, this is not the location you want to stay at. Period. Also, doors and curtains don't shut off properly, makes it a very noisy room. Rooms are tiny too, to be called a suit! Hawaiian service was very good! Staff was nice.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My husband and I celebrated our wedding anniversary. We had an amzing time on the island. Hilton as always was a class act. my only complaint was the noise coming from the street was a bit much in the evening. This is not the fault of Hilton as we know there was a strike ongoing at another hotel. The rooftop pool was small to be located at a vacation property. Overall we had a lovely time and very comfortable stay, almost like home.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We really enjoyed the accommodations at the Hokulani Resort - especially the rooftop cabana and bar and movie night! Rooms are beautiful; staff is courteous, and the location was great.The resort was close to all kinds of great restaurants and shops as well as the beach.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great staff, great location. They took great care of me. I am generally critical of hotel/timeshare locations but, I couldn’t find anything to pick at. The rooms are keep clean and comfortable. The staff that I spoke with were extremely polite and happy..

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel was great for us. My wife and I travelling with our 1yo and 3yo. Having the kitchenette was great, as well as the separate bedroom for naps. Massive bathroom with shower and stand alone bath was great. Even the dining chair cushions were wipe clean (luckily!) : ) Small rooftop pool was also great for us - just 3ft deep. The whole rooftop area was lovely. Also free to use laundry facilities on each floor was a bonus, especially with toddlers! All the staff were super friendly and helpful and the location couldn’t have been better - right in the heart of all the action and well less than 10min walk to the beach. (On a side note we used Hawaii23 for our airport transportation and they were great and provided 2 car seats for the kids at no extra cost)
user_name:
Matt S
Auckland Central, New Zealand

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I will always come back to this hotel once I’m in Oahu, Hawaii. Staff are extremely courteous especially the Asian bell man. I forgot his name but he’s so helpful and knowledgeable!!!i will comeback here again maybe next year!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great resort in the heart of the high end shopping district. Located near Wakikki beach. Great resturants in walking distance. Handicapped accessable. Roof top pool with cabanas. Movies shown at the pool on Monday night with free popcorn and food. Staff is friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed for 1 week as a time-share exchange, and I have to say it was my best one on the Island of Oahu. I fell in love with the tub and how the water shot down from the ceiling like a water hose! The large bathroom mirror had a darker tint which I thought was only for night time make up application, but then I saw a white remote by the towels, I clicked it and the TV went on inside my mirror! I took a long bathe nd watched The Mummy. The livingroom pillows were soft linen and batting you could sleep on them. We utilized the full kitchen and cooked steaks and pasta and drank red wine for a fraction of the cost of Waikiki dining! A/C kept us cool, and it cooled our goose down comforters and pillow so you slept with crisp bedding all night. I came home went to Macy's and sprung for the a goose down bedding for our home. The valet service was superior, though it was 40 a night, we used it quite a bit, since we went back and forth to feed our cats, fish and birds everyday plus daily excursions. We watched Moana at the roof top deck covered in a bath sheets on a lovely lounge chairs. If we got there early enough there were private lanai's on the opposite side of the wading pool, with your own personal t.v. screens and sofa's! The staff became like family by the end of our stay, we knew them all by first name. I was a perfect get-away for my husband and I, and we live 30 minutes from this location. No doubt we will be back!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My husband and I celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary here with his brother and his wife. We had a ball! The staff met you at the curb side and assisted with your bags. Once you go up the escalator to the main entrance, there's a torch reception before the lobby. The landscaping was perfect! The staff was welcoming! The room was excellent! There's a kitchen that was complete with glass door refrigerator, glass stove top, hot water spout for tea or coffee. Everything you need to cook with or microwave was accessible. The living room/ dining room was fabulous! There was a plug that has every attachment for multiple phone, pad, accessory style. There is a PlayStation 4 with free games located in the lobby. Also the dvd's were also free. There was a balcony access from the living room across to the bedroom. The bedroom had a king bed. The lighting was very modern and contemporary. There is a safe for your valuables in the dresser. There's a TV in the bedroom. The bathroom was an event! The shower had an overhead raindrop fixture as well as a hand held shower head with a glass door entry. The free standing bathtub has a waterfall feature from the ceiling. There was a heated seat on the commode with a bidet! There was a vanity station. Just lovely! Now if all of that wasn't enough, how about a TV in the bathroom mirror? Just fabulous!Do yourself a favor and book now! Right now! You will not be disappointed! There's no need to rent a car. Everything is in walking distance! Its beautiful! There's a rooftop cabana, bar, pool and hot tub. There are events daily. Go! Enjoy! I wish I could give more stars!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I give FIVE rating to the place itself but only ONE for its parking regulation. They also raise the valet parking from $35 to $40 when we checked in so there goes the savings... We paid $40/day for the rental car plus $40/day for the valet parking so a whooping $80/day if you have a car!!! We will think twice next time we check in this place and probably AVOID this place if we will drive a rental car in the future... Anyway besides all those expenses, the location of this vacation condo is great!. Also, their staff-Glenda- made us fell at home away from home and offset some of those frustrations in parking details... We thank her and some of the staff for their concern and ready to help attitude towars their guests. Our view is the back of Bank of Hawaii so there is not much to tell...)-: Finally, the rooms were beautiful...

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: great location, great service, great rooms. parking is a little expansive. had a great stay. everything within walking distance. beaches close great restaurants in area. left car at hotel and walk all over.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our family stayed in a one bedroom suite for 9 nights. I cannot day enough about the service received by this hotel, especially by Brian. We saw him all hours of the day from the early morning to the late evening. He and many others made sure we were wellInformed about the hurricane updates. The staff worked tirelessly throughout a very stressful situation, even remaining there when Waikiki was literally shut down and they probably had their own homes and families to tend to.The location is fantastic, better than the Hilton Hawaiian Village where we normally stay. The guys at the valet always had the car ready for us with a smile, despite me going back and forth several times a day.The rooftop pool is small but beautiful and the space is relaxing. I like that the cabana’s were complimentary and the furniture comfortable to lounge and watch tv. The bartender there also was personable.Housekeeping was detailed and our room was cleaned twice during our stay. We appreciated having the laundry room available for use.The room itself was modern and spacious for us to share. We were a family of four and liked the separation of the room from the living room to the bedroom. The bathroom was just gorgeous. We normally stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village a few times a year. The grounds and beachfront, outdoor pools are larger, which would make it a better stay for families with children. Everything else other than that makes the Hokulani a step above. The boutique feel with amazing service where they get to know their guests is appreciated. The location with many restaurants and shops step away make this property a premier stay.Thank you to the staff at Hokulani. Despite the hurricane scare, we had a wonderful time and look forward to returning soon.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: What a fantastic place to stay, we cannot recommend this hotel enough, the Hotel Concierge where the most helpful we have ever come across in our travels..Brian who met us on our arrival was just awesome, we cannot praise him enough for being so professional and helpful every time we spoke with him and he even printed out the bus routes for us to pearl harbour, everyone in the hotel we met was also extremely professional and kind, i would also like to mention the young lady on the night desk who remember my paper and name every night we returned back to the hotel, i.m afraid i lost her name when i returned home our dates were June 23 and room 1401 was lovely as we had a view of the Pink Palace and the Sea, which made our stay..The Hotel and Suite is without question the of best we have ever stayed in Waikiki and we have stayed in most of the 5* ones, its faultless...A must visit. Thank You all at the HOKULANI for our stay and making my husbands 60th birthday one to remember.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our honeymoon was truly heavenly thanks to the wonderful service and amenities provided by the Hokulani and their wonderful staff. The efforts of the staff created an atmosphere that made me feel like a queen. I will definitely return.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Enjoyed our stay very much. We immediately started feeling relaxed as soon as we stepped into the lobby. And considering how crowded, busy, and noisy Kalakaua can be, our room’s sliding doors easily blocked out the noise. We were comfortable and enjoyed every minute of our stay.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: As a couple, this hotel is the best as all rooms are timeshare meaning size is 56 sqm with small kitchen including a dishwasher, separate bedroom, living room and a beautiful / spacious bathroom. At most of the floor you have a washer/ dryer . Rooftop: nice jacuzzi, small but very small swimming pool, nice to chill out at night and few people. Cabana are nice and free to useLocation: near DFS on the main Avenue, so it is noisier than Hawaiian village. But you are near the restaurants and bars, really nice . 5min walk from the beach Advice: when you book, ask for rooms facing diamond head as the opposite you will face the bank of Hawaii wallStaff: coming from Asia, I am usually disappointed by the service in Hawaii but in this hotel , the staff provide the best service and always try to accommodate your requeststI think having over 80% Japanese is helping tooSo for those who wants a nice size studio with amenities located in the waikiki actions, 5 min walk to the beach.this is the placeFor those who prefer to be on the beach with a more resort feeling , this is not the place and should go to the Hawaiian villageA great place to stay

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hokulani is a wonderful property in an excellent location in Waikiki. Close to walk to the beach, restaurants, and shops. The rooms are fully stocked with everything you need to have a comfortable stay. I love the kitchen and appliances. It's a very relaxing property.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our family of 3 spent a week in one of the one bedroom suites.Our room had two queen beds, so we simply shared the room with our 10 year old son, avoiding the need to set up the sofa bed every night.We found that our in-room facilities suited us perfectly. The space is used really well, and the kitchenette is equipped with just the right things. We were able to cook breakfast (pancakes, toast, poached eggs) comfortably and even make delicious smoothies using the blender. There was a laundry on our floor, that we used twice.The location of the building suited us very well, as it is within easy walking distance of everything you might need.The rooftop pool, jacuzzi, cabanas and bar came in very handy on the day we arrived, when we just wanted to relax while we waited for our check-in time.Throughout our stay, the staff were all delightful and keen to help.We have previously stayed at Hilton Hawaiian Village. Although we liked it, we did feel a bit isolated from the buzz of Waikiki, not having a car. Staying here this time gave us the best of both worlds.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Please be aware that is is more of a business area as it is in the Waikiki district. The pool is around 25 feet long and is only 3 feet deep which is just for leasure not for family fun. The beach is close but would recommend to walk over to the Hilton Village as the water and area is cleaner.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It's part of the Hilton grand vacation club. We wanted to book beach front hotels but they were not available and the agent recommended this newer hotel to us. It's in very good location, close to shopping and restaurant. Very clean. But the swimming pool is too small and not warm. I wouldn't have chosen this hotel if I have to pay the market price.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The staff was very helpful with all of our needs. Great location near all Waikiki hot spots. Very clean and spacious rooms. Close to restaurants and markets. Plenty of room for a family vacation in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The resort was extremely clean, and the service was top notch. The location is perfect in the heart of Waikiki so you don’t have to look far for activities outside of the resort. The resort is quiet and doesn’t have the hustle of the larger properties. It doesn’t have a large pool, but I loved the rooftop cabanas and bar. The Concierge, Bartenders, Front Desk and Housekeeper for my floor were outstanding!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: As a Rookie, I really didn't know what to expect... so from what I read, pictures and some videos, etc. my expectations were not met. I am not sure if I built it up in my head before I arrived or if I really didn't get what I think what it should have been. Bottom line: It was ok.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Disclaimer: This stay was a gift from a friend, using their timeshare. Thus this review is written not knowing the true cost of the room. Generally my reviews are based on value. So I would expect more from a place that charges more and that perceived value is reflected in my reviews.The facility was nice. You take an escalator from the street which leads you into the lobby. They have Bell Service at the street level to help you with your bags.Parking is valet only and expensive even by Honolulu standards. I believe I was quoted $40 per night. I found somewhere else to park. Check-in was quick, smooth and efficient. Staff was polite and helpful.The elevators I have a level of security I have not seen before. You scan your room card, there is a display asking you which floor wish to go to. After you have entered the floor number the display tells you which elevator to get in. Once inside, there are no buttons. The elevator takes you to your desired floor and you have no other choice. However, once inside the hotel you can move freely between floors without a security card. Just enter the desired floor on the console and it will indicate which elevator to take.The rooms were spacious. I stayed in a corner room on a low floor. Windows were large. There was a small lanai. A small amount of road noise could be heard due to the low floor, and above you could occasionally hear footsteps. But overall relatively quiet. There is a living room / kitchenette. The kitchenette had a built-in two-burner hot plate, hotel size refrigerator, and a separate reasonably sized freezer. The sink included a garbage disposal and there was a small dishwasher. There were cabinets with cookware and dishes. Additionally there was a toaster, blender, rice cooker and coffee maker. Complimentary coffee was Hawaiian Paradise brand (claims to be 100% Ka'u coffee). Additionally there was a small couch which could pull out into a bed, a coffee table, a small dining room table with two chairs and an entertainment / storage console. There was a large flat screen TV mounted in the living room (another mounted in the bedroom, and another built into the mirror of the bathroom) complete with a PlayStation/DVD player. DVD movies could be checked out from a Redbox type of machine with a card provided at check-in. The floors were nice Hardwood covered by an area rug.The bedroom was also large. Queen with a queen size bed standard in tables, lamps, telephone and a smaller TV mounted to the wall. There was a small dresser.The bathroom was quite large with two closets, very large mirror, lots of counter space, dual sinks, separate stand-alone tub, glass shower enclosure and large enclosed toilet area with the heated seat and Toto Washlet. The bathtub is somewhat unique as it fills from the ceiling. Amenities were standard hotel type amenities. Above-average for quality (Peter Thomas Roth).The entire room had lots of natural light. Overall quite comfortable.Several floors have complimentary laundry, the machines appeared to be of good quality and in working order. There was a small gym on the floor I stayed on. It had treadmills and free weights.A highlight of this facility was the rooftop lounge. There is a lap pool (only 3 feet 0.9 meters deep), small hot tub, moderate sized deck, several covered Cabanas with tables, couch and TV period a small snack shop / bar. On Monday nights they offer movie night with free pupus (I did not indulge, so I cannot comment). But the highlight is the view. There is an excellent view overlooking Waikiki with nice views of the ocean. A very nice place to relax.Overall, a nice, comfortable property in a very desirable part of Waikiki. The rooms are set up well and the property contains amenities to make this an excellent place to stay both for the short and long-term.I attached some pictures from the rooftop lounge.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I have a timeshare here and loved that it was close to the main attractions of Waikiki. It's also not crazily busy as other hotels might be, so staff are able to give you the prompt service you desire. The staff are very friendly and helpful. My single room was lovely -- there's also a TV in the bathroom.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: we found the hotel room very nice; however, the staff never met any of our requests. We were told one thing when buying vacation and another when we arrived. Do not let them upgrade your room without knowing what type of bed you are getting. They will not make any changes.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: As a local, loved the up to date Hawaiiana Design. The one bedroom is innovatively designed to maximize space. The large bathroom felt luxurious. Kitchenette was great. Usually stay in the Village, but this is closer to the strip. We will definitely return for another staycation.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My family and I was impressed with the modern design of the hotel room and lobby area. We stayed in the one bedroom premium which contained a kitchenette, large bathroom that had a soaking tub and shower. I was very impressed with the cleanliness of our room. We loved the pool cabana's which contained a flat screen television and small fridge. There is no extra cost to use the cabana's which was equipped with a flat screen television, small fridge and a safe. Hotel staff from the valet and front desk are friendly and helpful. We defiantly will be staying at the Hokulani Waikiki Hilton again in the near future.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Really, nice. First it is modern and up to date. The staff is friendly and accommodating. Our room was clean and quiet. Best of all, the location in the heart of Waikiki can't be beat. Literally right outside the door of the hotel are numerous dining and shopping options from low cost to high end. Sundry items are available at the ABC store a few steps away. It is a short walk to the beach and to other hotels for adult beverages and entertainment. Don't expect an ocean view though if that matters to you. Overall, an excellent place to stay in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Located in the heart of Waikiki, the Hokulani is our favorite place to stay in Hawaii. The staff are friendly, helpful, and make you feel at home. The roof pool and cabanas are clean and an important part of why we always stay at the Hokulani!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for a week with a timeshare exchange. Very nice place; very helpful staff. Rooms are modern and nicely appointed. Convenient to beach and dining options. Rooftop bar and pool were really nice. We’d definitely return.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We recently stayed 6 nights here. Our first family trip overseas with our 2 children and our experience at the Hokulani was amazing from the moment we entered. We had a very early flight so our room was not quite ready but Cassel got us in the room by midday. Cassel helped made our whole experience of Hawaii amazing. He even went out of his way to help my husband out with an local sim card. The hotel was beautiful. The roof top pool and spa over looking the main strip just gorgeous. Spotlessly clean. Would come back again and again!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was our fourth trip to Hawaii and our most enjoyable. The room was great. It was designed beautifully. A home feeling yet very functional. The bathroom was fantastic with the walk in shower and TV. Plenty of closet and draw space. Good location(about a block and a half from the beach. The staff was incredible. 5 star in every way. Definitely recommend this location.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a very pleasant stay at the Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations. Our room was wonderful, everything we could need for a week's stay. The amenities were so nice, clean and the pool was warm and delightful. We would recommend this location very highly!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Don't get me wrong, the suites are beautiful and you get what you pay for, but what sets this resort apart from others is the staff. They go above and beyond to be sure your stay is an incredible one. It was well worth the expense!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My husband & I don't always like "cities" but this was really a surprise. The hotel is not right on the beach but that is an easy walk. Wonderful views from the rooftop which has a bar (with awesome bartenders), hot tub, pool, cabanas and lots of loungers. The unit reminds me of a high end European efficiancy, compact, complete and lovely. The lobby is beautifu. The staff and service top notch. I agree with the review that says for couples more than families although we saw some children there. We used our points through RCI and hope to do so again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Special gem in Waikiki! The rooms are simply amazing. It made our family trip so comfortable and at ease. To top it off, their staff - housekeeping, bell, valet, and concierge -- showed us exceptional customer service. Mahalo to you guys! Aloha all the way!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great for couples. Not family oriented. Lacks amenities for children traveling with family. Resort clean and staff accommodating. Biggest issue was we were there with our grand children and resort had small pool not designed for kids and no extra aminitiam for children.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hotel has a wonderful location as it is near to beaches, Waikiki Aquarium, Ala Moana Shopping Center and many fun place either by day or night. Various buses are also nearby so you don’t have to rent a car.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It was our first time at the Hilton Hokulani but our 12th visit to Waikiki so we had high expectations given our previous positive experiences at other hotels. We were not disappointed. Friendly helpful staff and a room design that fit our needs perfectly. Everything you need for light dining is included. No stove or laundry in room but everything else was first rate. Free laundry facilities on every floor. And located in the heart of the high-end shop and steps from the beach. We will return.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Perfect Room - Nice One Bedroom .... Perfect Bathroom .... Shower (water falls from the ceiling) and the Shower is nice and BIG. Kitchen has a two burner stovetop **NO OVEN**. Refrigerator.. Microwave .. dishes for four. Blender..toaster...rice cooker... balcony not so much but there is one just very small.Outside the room you are steps away from shopping and a short walk to the beach.Would definitely stay again.Aloha for now.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My third stay at the Hokulani - once again it was brilliant. Nothing is ever an issue. The staff are wonderful, location is perfect. Able to do catch up on some washing prior to coming home which is great for when you get home no dirty clothes. I will be back hopefully very soon.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hokulani Hilton is located at the end of the Waikiki Beachwalk and is within walking distance of the beach, shopping, and dining. Hilton has renovated the property into sleek and contemporary residences. These reviews were helpful in locating the entrance to the hotel since it is tucked inside the Beachwalk Strip. There is a valet on street level (which is for loading and unloading only) on Lewers Ave. not on Kalakaua and you take the escalator up to check in. The rooms are nice and perfectly sized for a property in the city. The ceilings are NOT low, as indicated in an earlier review. I realize that review was posted 3 years ago, but I seriously doubt they’ve raised the ceilings since then. That said, if you are a very tall person (6’4”+), the shower may seem low. Nice TVs in both living area and bedroom. The bed is really comfortable, the bathroom is huge. The ToTo Toilet with washlet is a plus. The rooms are nicely appointed and clean. The kitchen is more of an area than a room, but we’re on vacation, so a refrigerator and coffee maker are all we require. A note to those people who complain about the size: this is a city property. Just a teeny bit of research would tell you that the property consists of only one bedroom units, which should indicate that this not a family resort. If you have procreated sufficiently that you have outgrown a one bedroom unit, might I suggest Hilton Hawaiian Village or Disney Aulani? I say this to get laughs but if you do have children 6 to 13, your kids would be happier (and therefore you would be happier) at HHV. As another reviewer mentioned, staying at Hokulani does not allow you pool privilege at HHV. The staff at reception, the cleaning staff and the valet crew were all very friendly and helpful. The valet was most accommodating, as was reception (I frequently needed more coffee, which they happily provided). This is a valet only parking property, which carries an additional daily fee for parking if you have a car.  We are HGVC members and, as such, have stayed at a number of Hilton properties. We would recommend this property to vacationers who are adults with no more than one child or 2 very young children and who are not looking to cook their own meals. With so many dining options available within walking distance, just enjoy! Suggestions for improvement: add a disinfecting cleaner in the gym. We bought our own, but it is good practice to have a cleaner in a gym. The lobby has a fantastic sitting area off to the side of reception, but it is not used much. A nice little wine bar at night would be a way to make good use of this space and give guests a place to unwind at the end of the day.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hokulani Waikiki has an outstanding location, right on the beach walk, We asked for a quiet room, and were first put on the top floor on the main street. Every few minutes it seemed like sirens went by all night long. We asked to move, and did so after two nights. Still on the top floor, we were moved to the other end. Unfortunately, the AC or something on the roof was unbearably loud. I'm guessing lower floors might be less noisy (away from the main street. Forgetting noise, the rooms are kind of small. There is no kitchen, but a kitchenette. Okay, we knew that ahead of time. If you want a kitchen, go to the Hilton Grand Vacation suites at Hawaiian Village. Unfortunately, the Hawaiian Village does not have the great location that the Hokulani has, So if you are a sound sleeper and don't mind a slightly small suite, this might be perfect. Immediately outside are dozens of places to eat. There are non-stop places on the second floor to the end of the next block. In addition, the restaurants are somewhat inexpensive, if you get there for happy hour. There is a good hamberger place next door, and a Japanese restaurant nearby. Note, this is not on the beach, but the beach is not far away, The pool on the roof is a plunge pool, not really for swimming.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: In the heart of Waikiki, 2 blocks from beach, 2 blocks from bus stops, surrounded by shopping, 5 minutes from International Market and right on the Beachwalk. The staff were great, easy to talk to, answered every question, and pointed us in the right direction. The unit is fully equipped (except for an oven) which really is not needed on Holiday.
