The roof top bar was over-priced and the bartender smokes and does not always show up, but there are lots of lounge chairs and seating areas with cover from rain and with TVs.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is my first visit to this Condo property part of the Hilton Grand Vacation timeshare. I’m very impressed so far. The exterior of the building was nothing special as we were driving up, but the interior is lovely as is the room. The staff here is outstanding and helpful. The location is excellent within easy walking distance to the beach, but the improvement over other condos nearby is the location with respect to restaurants and night life. I’ll come back hereI tried rating the hotel on the categories below, but the buttons were not working. I’d give excellents on all categories

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the Hokulani for the second time in February. This hotel is the BEST place we have ever stayed. Each employee goes out of their way to be helpful and courteous. THe location is great...very close to many restaurants from Subway and Denneys to Ruth’s Chris and Yardhouse. The beach is a five to ten minute walk. The Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center and T Galleria are just across the street. Many very high end shops. There is an ABC store right next door for any necessities you may have forgotten and The Cheeseburger Beachwalk is just out the front door. The rooms are like small apartments and have a full kitchen, very large bathroom, bedroom and living room. Anything you need, all you have to do is ask. Enjoy your time in Paradise!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is by far one of the best timeshares we’ve ever stayed in. While not on the beach it’s only a 5 minute walk and it is in the midst of high end shopping & endless restaurants.The one bedroom was quite spacious with balcony. Bathroom had waterfall shower & tv in the mirror. Free dvds & PS 3 games, laundry on each floor with laundry soap provided , free wifi, in room safe. There’s a rooftop bar, pool & hot tub but pool is not for swimming- just cooling off.Brendan, the concierge is most helpful as is Brian at the front desk. Don’t worry about getting a car - easy enough to get around by bus and avoid the traffic. We’ll be back!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Last week, we spent three nights at this lovely, well-located hotel.  We enjoyed our suite and the amenities it contains, including a large bath with both a glass-lined shower stall and a modern free-standing tub.The kitchenette is the most complete we've ever seen in a hotel… with a slide-out pantry cabinet stocked with glassware, toaster, rice cooker, etc; an actual dishwasher; and for the expert chef who just *has* to cook in this restaurant-rich area, there's even a large knife block equipped with a full set of chef's knives!Another not-to-be-missed feature is the toilet with option for a heated seat and assorted methods of cleaning your you-know-what.  There's also a very-welcome laundry on each floor with machines that don't require quarters or tokens and a complimentary packet of laundry soap provided under the kitchenette sink.  Also important here is the sense of security that comes from the unusual elevator, where your electronic key allows you to select a floor before you enter the elevator but does not allow you to change that selection once you're inside. At first, this seemed weird, but now we understand it's a safety feature that keeps visitors from meandering along floors where they have no business meandering.  My only beef is with the so-called "resort fee."On top of our $400 per night charge, it seemed rather absurd to pay an extra $30 per night in "resort fees," which gave us—woohoo!!!— 2 bottles of water per day, and that was it. We didn't even lay eyes on the rooftop pool, and if there were other "resort amenities" available that we could have used, I have no idea what they were.This is a downtown hotel, and a very nice one, but it's not on the beach. You can't see the ocean even from the 8th floor. It looks down on a super-busy street and the roof of a shopping mall. In no way that I can see is it a "resort" worth tacking $90 onto a $1200 bill.  Four-and-a-half stars. I'd call it a five if it weren't for that stupid, worthless "resort fee."

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I stayed here for 10 nights with my husband and two kids age 6 & 7. The room was spacious enough for the 4 of us with a little kitchenette for us to make breakfast. They have sliding doors to separate the bedroom from the living room which is great when I had to put the kids to sleep. The bathrooms were modern and heavenly; soaker tub and tv on the mirror with heated toilet seats! Hotel staff was all very helpful and friendly, but our favorite person was Arnel the rooftop bartender! He was outstanding and knew exactly what we wanted everytime! Thank you for making our stay so comfortable and helping us make such great memories! Can't wait to be back! The cabanas were so comfortable, just enough shade and breeze for those hot days; not to mention the rooftop showers!Everything was walking distance; I highly recommend this property and already booked our trip for next year! Can't wait to be back!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a truly lovely hotel, geared towards adults. The room plan was perfect and high quality. The only thing that was missing was a magnifying mirror for applying makeup - and that is it! There is a great roof top deck with large cabanas with couches, refrigerators and TVs that can be used for free! Top quality property, excellent service (thanks Brian!). Will return if I am ever back in HNL.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The room was very spacious. There was both a bathtub and shower in the on-suite. The pool was a little small but cabanas next to the pool was nice and comfortable. There were refrigerators in the cabanas but the one we were in The refrigerator did not work. And the bar was closed ‘due to unforeseen circumstances’ a few days during our stay.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My husband and I recently spent 9 nights at Hokulani. Each room is like an apartment including a good size kitchenette (with fridge, ice-making machine, hot plate, dishwasher and all necessary cutlery, plates etc) with a super large and spacious bathroom (tv in the mirror!), and lounge area. The room is great for long term stays because you do really feel at home and all the amenities are provided including four beach towels each day. The staff are great and friendly, from check in to valet. No complaints at all. A big thank you to Brian for his professionalism and warmth during our stay. When we were not happy with our initial room on level three we were moved to a room with more privacy on level 7. He really went out of his way to ensure we were happy and I am grateful! Another positive is that there are free laundry facilities on each floor and this makes life so easy! A definite plus. The negatives are that this hotel charges a resort fee when (in my view) it should not. This hotel is not a resort, there is one small pool on the top floor and that’s about it. I really thought it was a bit exorbitant for Hilton to charge a resort fee for this hotel type. There is one bar but I never saw anyone there and could probably be a better use for that space.Also, there are no views per se. If you want sweeping views of Waikiki beach this is not the hotel for you. If you want modern, clean and spacious facilities to make you feel at home then Hokulani is a great option. I would stay again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at the Hokulani. The staff at this facility is extrodinary. The quiet ambiance and the great amenities were wonderful. I look forward to the opportunity to vacation there again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I cannot say enough great things about this hotel. We were travelling as a family of 4, 2 adults a toddler and baby. The unit was perfect. I called ahead and requested a pack and play, which was in the room at check-in. Our flight arrived a little early so we got to the hotel a bit early, the room wasn't quite ready but we were able to leave our bags with valet while we stopped by the grocery store to stock up on stuff. The person checking us in kept us updated via text on when our room was ready. The room had a kitchenette: stovetop with 2 burners, small sink, dishwasher, icemaker, small (not mini) fridge, microwave, plates and utensils. The bathroom had separate shower and tub with the overhead rain shower and tv in the mirror. What was most helpful to us was the separate room and living area where there was a wall that separated the two; it was needed to put down the kids and for families travelling with baby or young kids, adults are not forced to go to bed early or hang out in the bathroom while kiddies are sleeping. I love how centrally located the hotel was and surprised at not having to deal with as much waikiki traffic. The only 2 bummers were: no option for self parking, only valet (but I get the efficiency and space it could save) and no pool (but it got us to go to beaches daily).

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel has excellent very modern facilities, with a tv within your bathroom mirror, washrooms with seat warmers and washers, bathroom rain showers, just excellent! The staff were friendly and helpful. The roof top pool with private cabanas and tvs were very enjoyable together with the hot tub and gorgeous views of the city and beach.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I would totally recommend booking your stay here. Lots of things to do within walking distance. Bus stops close by as well. (very safe and cheap) the city was always awake loved it!!! Rooms were amazing, Japanese style. I could of lived in the bathroom, loved the soaker tub. All high end!!!!!! Staff was great! Only downside no free hotel trolley, no microwave or oven in room, rooftop bar and pool close early. Pool are more geared for adults than kids. Great place to stay! Great area! Wish I was back there right now.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is the 3rd or 4th time we’ve stayed here and we love it. Besides being very convenient to restaurants and stores the employees are wonderful and friendly. The rooms are great for a couple although there is also a sofa bed. Some rooms have 2 beds. We love how quiet the hotel is even when it’s full. We enjoy the pool on the top floor and the lounges and cabanas. It’s impressive that many of the staff have been here since it opened. That says a great deal about this hotel.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Love staying at the Hokulani! Third year in a row for us. So central to many great restaurants, one block to the beach, or if you feel like staying put...a fantastic rooftop deck to soak in the rays and have a drink at the bar.The staff are truly exceptional. The front office with Gen Mgr Robert, Mitch and Yoko in admin, the lobby with Cassel, Bryan, Michael, Josh and Gee, the rooftop bar with Arnel and Jake...they all make you feel at home and are so quick in addressing any questions posed to them. The suites are all one bedrooms with a very subtle modern feel. The windows are all triple pane so you can not hear street noise. We are already planning our return in 2018.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had fun, the stuff is responsive, and friendly, the room is a little small, we would hope it can be bigger for a family of four. It’s clean and easy to get around location. I would recommend this place for people want to shop.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Resort was perfect location. Bathroom and kitchen amenities were perfect. Arnel the bartender was super fun. Would definitely stay here again. The pool was closed during are stay but the beach was not far and the cabanas were available which had a great layout with tv and fridges.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We staid in the Hokulani hotel for 8 night. The hotel in general is ok clean and safe, situated in a good road near the shops and some restaurants. Is 5-10 min walk to the beach. The hotel in general is ok but is over priced they provide just 2 little bottles of water in general and that include in ur tax. Not sure if I will chose to stay again there as I think is better hotels around.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Location is central luxury Row. Walking distance to Waikiki Beach and Restaurants. So convenience.Hotel rooms are modern and elegant. We appreciated high pressure shower from top of ceiling. Japanese high tech toilet and watch CNN at bathroom. Amenities are sophisticated and cleaned. Hotel staffs are so accommodated and knowledge of technologies to Waikiki attractions. We do not want leave Hokulani Waikiki. Mahalo and We will be back!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The staff were amazing - extremely friendly and accommodating. The location was great - short walk to beach but close to all amenities. Would have liked an oven for more in room cooking options, but other than that - perfect

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent customer service and convenient location. Cassel and front desk were very helpful and accommodating!Kitchen and laundry facilities convenient. Great location to shops. A few blocks to beach access.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We loved our stay at the Hokulani due in part to the wonderful staff but also to the central location in Waikiki and our extremely comfortable room. The Hokulani is not on the beach, but it's so close (only two blocks) it's easy to get there, and the hotel has a plunge pool and great sundeck that's quite nice for relaxing.Our 4-room suite on the 11th floor was quiet, tastefully decorated, roomy, and extremely comfortable. The kitchenette has microwave, icemaker, glass-door fridge, dishwasher, coffeemaker, toaster, 2-burner range top, and all the dishes, pans, and utensils you could need. The sitting area was furnished with couch, table and 2 chairs, coffee table, dresser, big closet with ironing board and iron, and a large TV; the bath was generous with two sinks and lots of counter space, separate shower and tub, separate toilet with Japanese bidet, lighted mirror with integrated TV, hair dryer, and some toiletries; the bedroom had a cozy king bed with lots of pillows, 2 night stands, dresser and huge closet. The A/C and lighting were perfect. Just off the sitting and bedroom were sliding glass doors to the balcony overlooking the Lewers Street beachwalk.Along the beachwalk are scores of high and low-end restaurants and shops and across the street is the Royal Hawaiian Center with shopping and parking. Sheraton's Alioha Landing is there also, where many tour buses pick up their passengers. Try to go see the Magic of Polynesia show at the Holiday Inn Beachcomber just down Kalakaua a couple of blocks. It's phenomenal.We loved the vibe along the beachwalk in Waikiki and enjoyed the Hokulani; we would return in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location! My friends and I are in our late 20's Stayed here for Halloween and the strip was steps away, Right on Waikiki beach walk close to shops, bars and restaurants. It was a great getaway and so easy to get around, the pool is small but is perfect for relaxing and sun tanning and the view of the ocean is great. Overall great hotel!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Clean and has everything you need in the room! We stayed for leisure so lots of places within walking distance including drug stores, food and shopping and the beach is a few blocks away but an easy walk!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: All one bedrooms with kitchen but no oven only cook top. Valet parking only. Good location for walking around Waikiki. Just across the street from the royal Hawaiian Shopping center that has a fantastic food court. The Beach is only a short walk. It has a rooftop pool and bar. The pool is only a little over 3 feet deep. There is a hot tub with jets. Great views from the rooftop. You can see the Hilton fireworks from the free cabanas on the roof. Staff is great. The entrance to the hotel is a little weird because checkin is on the second floor up an escalator. The hotel is a part of the shops on Lewers street. We stayed 12 nights and had room servicing 3 times. Do it your self free laundry is on each floor. We will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location! Near excellent shopping, beach, shows. Staff is excellent. Good fitness room and pool is OK but not very deep. Also near rental cars; used speedyshuttle from airport to hotel-recommend!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is an apartment style hotel with kitchens and laundry access but not daily room servicing. It is very close to Waikiki Beach but not on beachfront, so it is not as expensive as the beach front properties. It is conveniently located in the middle of Waikiki shops and restaurants. It would suit families with younger children very well. It is not a hotel for those who are wiling to pay for direct beach access and daily room servicing etc.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Go every 2 years and always have a great time. Staff very friendly. Enjoy every minute of the time. Loved the pool area and the room was fantastic. Also the location is right close to Waikiki shopping and beach.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a true hidden gem that should be looked at when searching for hotels in Honolulu. Very clean and quiet in the midst of busy Waikiki. Hotel staff is prompt, welcoming and very helpful and professional. And, the location is second to none. Walk to the beach, to a load of restaurants and plenty of amazing shops! Will stay again...not soon enough!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We just got back from a week at the Hokulani and had such a wonderful time. HGVC properties are always great, but this one was particularly fantastic. The location is perfect. I'd been a bit disappointed when I booked, to not get a beachfront hotel, but it didn't matter one bit. The Hokulani is so centrally located to shops, restaurants, the beach, and the Sheraton's bus depot (where many tour companies pick up), I honestly found it better than a beachfront resort. The room was very comfortable; my husband and I were in a one bedroom suite and it was plenty of room. Small touches like the alarm clock nightlight that comes on for just enough time to get situated in bed were delightful; I really enjoyed the bathroom mirror lights; the rain shower and standalone tub were both great. Having the kitchen was a great way for us to save a little money by making breakfast in the mornings. The staff was all SO friendly and helpful, they greeted us with leis when we arrived and always said aloha and went out of their way to grab your towels (and get you fresh ones) when you returned from the beach. We spent less time at the rooftop pool than I thought we would; it was lovely but only 3 feet deep and we just ended up wanting to be at the beach. The DVDnow system was so nice to have free, current movie rentals in the evenings.The only "negatives," if I can even call them that, would be that the laundry area is common (usually at HGVC it's in the room) - but this really didn't matter to me much - and that the coffee pot is some proprietary pod system, and when you've used the two pods they give you, you have to pay to get more. That seemed a little silly for us being there a week, but if that's the "worst" of it, I'll take it :)We will definitely return to the Hokulani!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Love the location and amenities; very modern facility. Staff very accommodating and always with a smile on their faces. Also enjoyed watching the free rental video. Will definitely be using this hotel all the time.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Always a great stay! Everything is within walking distance, beach, food, shopping! The staff is very knowledgeable and helpful! It is also near to Ala Moana shopping center. We would highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel located center of Waikiki.Very convenient to go to somewhere at Waikiki by foot.Bills and Tommy Bahama are the back of hotel.We stayed 5 nights. It is very recommendable for family when you stay long due to condominium style.There is rooftop bar and pool.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our visit to Waikiki was a last minute change from Cabo due to the hurricanes and earthquake in Mexico. This was located in the perfect spot with excellent restaurants and shops right outside the front door. Just a short walk to the beach and beautiful rooms.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This property is a gem and ideally located to fully enjoy the area. The staff is the friendliest around, especially, Angela and Cassel. The environment is one of ease and comfort. We were greeted warmly upon arrival and every morning thereafter. This boutique style property lends itself to a more quiet and less crowded experience, while still being steps from so much. The rooftop pool and bar is a great place to relax in the later afternoon and offers great viewing for the amazing sunsets. The room itself had plenty of space and was set up very well for ease and function. We were very happy with our accommodations and our stay.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a premier room which is higher floor facing the Lewers St with slight Ocean View. Quiet double glazed Windows. Washer and dryer on every floor. Rooms are large and very comfortable. Bathroom is massive. Fully functioning kitchen, dishwasher. Although I never used it as great restaurants around. Pool is crap. Knee high and tiny. I went in for 2 minutes and that was it. Upside wonderful beach a few steps away. We will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A lovely hotel, with an excellent staff with outstanding aloha spirit. The rooms were beautifully appointed with delightful surprise features, such as a television embedded within the bathroom mirror. The Sky Deck is a wonderful place to hang out, with an ocean view, a small pool, large seating areas and a great bar. You are in the heart of Waikiki but you feel like you are in a non city paradise while in the hotel. We will return.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Loved this well located smaller hotel to start our vacation in Hawaii. Close to the strip and Waikiki Beach but quieter than the big hotel chains. Staff and rooms were excellent. Would definitely recommend and stay here again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is not what you would expect for a vacation property. We are Gold Members and had a room facing a brick wall with noisy delivery early in the morning. I can not imagine where a lower category room would be!Small but nice room does not easily accommodate more than a couple. The roof top pool is a joke more for soaking your feet; definitely not for swimming or family fun.The parking is Valet only and quite costly so be aware.Fantastic front desk staff but almost useless conciere who probably spoke better Japanese than English. I was better off reviewing activities on the internet.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Location, location, location, coupled with a modern and sleek hotel room and accommodations makes this one of my favorite places to staycation! You are in the heart of Waikiki, making it super easy to walk to the many restaurants, stores and beaches throughout Waikiki. The bathroom in your hotel room is to die for, with its Toto toilet, amazing rain shower, TV in the mirror, and tub with water coming down from the ceiling.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A great location, very nice spacious accommodation, comfortable with really good bathrooms. The only problem with this hotel is that it lacks facilities. Although there are plenty of restaurants in the vicinity it's poor not to be able to get breakfast at a hotel. The pool area is small with little shade, if you're there on a Monday the managers reception is held there, my advice is to avoid this event!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My family and I (3 adults, 4 teens) were booked here using HGVC Bonus Points because the Hawaiian Village was sold out. I was skeptical at first, but this was perfect for the 1st four days of our trip. The rooms were ample size, clean, modern and my kids loved the t.v.embedded in the bathroom mirror and the bidet toilet. We had 2 rooms (unfortunately on opposite ends of the hallway). The staff were friendly and generous. Brian made sure we had champagne to celebrate our anniversary and cookies for my daughter's birthday. This is right in the thick of all the stores and restaurants on Kalakaua Ave, so it was perfect for my teens to walk around. Parking your car is not cheap, but we knew that going in. Valet always had our car ready to go-we just had to call down for it. My husband enjoyed using the small wading pool to cool off after a long day of sightseeing. The only negative was that the rooftop bar was closed on Tues/Thurs.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Loved the location and clean modern finishing at this property. The street noise on the back side was louder then expected but that is the price you pay to be in the heart of this area. Walking to shops and dinner was easy and full of choices. The beach is only just 5 min from the front door and very beautiful sand and water.
user_name:
Gregory W
North TOnawanda, United States

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: after much searching, and with decision made, our stay @ Hokulani was exceptional. easy checkin & out, helpful staff, modern fitout and room amenities, cleaned daily, well located on Cnr Kalakaua & Lewers St - restaurants on doorstop & ample shopping + rooftop pool, mostly quiet and under-utilised. Definitely stay here again! We loved our beds, each with 4 pillows and the bath with 2 sinks, shower & seperate bath & toilet.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I booked this hotel since it was in a central location within walking distance from Waikiki beach. Rooms we spacious and had kitchenette facilities so that we could have a break from constant takeaway for breakfast/lunch/dinner.Our room was clean and we were very happy with it. Unfortunately we had the view that consisted largely of concrete from the building next door however we had a nice view of the ocean when we sat on the lounge.The bathroom is HUGE and has a TV in the mirror while unnecessary that was pretty cool. I loved having so much space and dual sinks.The bed was super comfortable and I slept very well here with minimal noise from other guests.The pool area is pretty however the pool itself is a lot smaller than it looks in the pictures. Almost pointless although I suppose it's a good area to dip and cool down. Still, it's lucky the hotel is only a few minutes walk to the beach. On our first night, and on at least one other occasion throughout our stay, the pool area was closed for a private function. I was really disappointed by this as it would have been refreshing after a long flight.We also found that the pool bar and the restaurant downstairs were often closed and the hours were very restricted on days of opening. There was no actual food available at the pool. When looking to order from the restaurant we found we didn't even have the ability to charge back to our room.When we first arrived, we spoke to one of the concierge staff who was extremely unhelpful. We mentioned that and a few little problems with our room (including the tap not functioning correctly and the ice machine not working) and the hotel manager kindly credited $50 to our room, a gesture that we did appreciate.Unfortunately our experiences with concierge staff did not improve, I found I ended up having to research online and book my own tours without any advice/local knowledge that I would expect.We got our welcome lei and tote the day after we arrived, not quite the same.Given the lack of features of the hotel and the lack of knowledge and attitude of staff, I really resented having to pay for the resort fee. Essentially feels like we got 2 really expensive bottles of water every day. This hotel while nice, is NOT a resort and in my opinion cannot justify the price it is charging for this.This hotel really does have the potential to bump up to a review of 5 with a few adjustments.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Wow! What's not to love. Right in Waikiki, near shopping and Starbucks! Beautiful beach views from rooftop pool and rooms. BEST service of any Hilton (and any hotel) we've stayed in ever. Susan and Cassel knew our names and greeted us by names each morning and were genuinely interested in how our days went or what we had planned. The pool is small but the best kept secret - never too crowded. Even the ladies cleaning each morning were cheerful and greeted us every time we saw them. When we come back to Waikiki, we are definitely staying here and hope to see Susan (who never seems to have a day off). This turned our vacation into so much more - almost like family! #BestService #GreatLocation #LoveHawaii

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for one week.It is located in the heart of all activities, restaurants, and shopping malls. It's basically a couple steps away from everything. Theres a very nice rest. right outside the hotel, Cheeseburger. We ate both breakfast and dinner there. There's also a Starbucks directly in front and Dennys at the end of the street.Thankfully, we had a street view stayed in rooms 801 & 802 one facing the street and the other facing the back which is basically concrete. The hotel staff is very professional and friendly. Not one employee was unfriendly. It's not the most fanciest hotel but serves its purpose. The pool on the 16th floor is basically just there for you to sit in definitely not conducive for swimming because it's very shallow and small. In addition, there is also a jacuzzi with comfortable cabanas.The hotel offered housekeeping one time during our stay because it's timeshare a bit weird but it's hotel policy. Upon arrival room was very clean. However, there is 2 washers and 2 dryers on each floor. On the 3rd floor there is a gym available. Front desk assisted quite nicely and help was given immediately when requested.The beach is an 8 minute walk. Vallet parking is $38 per night. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are currently at the Hokulani. It is the best location for shops and restaurants (but it's not on the beach.) Restaurants right at the front, the main shopping strip is a few meters away. Aloha Landing is a 2 minute walk. (That's where a lot of the bus tours pick up) The staff are friendly and helpful. There is a small lap pool on the roof top with a bar that closes early but the cabana's up there have a small bar fridge to bring your own drinks and a TV if you are like my husband and like to watch sports while having a beer and relaxing. The rooms are spotless - beautiful bathrooms and small galley kitchen but I think it's for 2 adults and not really families unless your kids are toddlers. If you unpack your luggage and then stack all the suitcases into one you might fit a small family. We didn't get a room with a view but honestly it didn't matter. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great place for family vacation. It's close to the beach but not an incredibly crowded spot. It's in an ideal area, where you have a lot of access to stores, so you don't have to worry about running out of something. However, everything in this area is pretty expensive.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Cassel, Susan ,and Marin kept me updated on when my room would be available. They were the best and are very friendly.The valet was ready and prompt to when i got there and brought my bags up to my room and gave my a little tour of the room! The room was more then what i could have asked for the check in was fast. My whole stay ,if i could just sum it up in one word, i would have to say ALOHA every one was so helpful.Also the bartender sure does make some excellent drinks by the pool

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: What's not to love, I stayed here after a business trip in Honolulu and being a Hilton owner it was fantastic. We only stayed here a few days, the room has everything you could possibly need dishwasher, stove, refrigerator, freezer, ice maker, microwave, dishes, glasses, wine opener, laundry on every floor. It would be easy to spend a month or more in this hotel. And the time I stayed there the downstairs was lightly used, lots of seating down there but no one ever seemed to be in it, that was early May. It's in a great location to a close walk to the beach, a few breakfast places right nearby, food everywhere around you lots of shopping, it's a great location.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: we are very sadisfied and the workers vere very nice,helpfull,corteus,very accomodeting,very clean room and amenety nice shower and bathroom,nice tv in the room and mirrow tv in the bathroom,nice view from the balcony

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Room: Sufficient room for a company of 2 people. Amenities are standard items alined with Hilton hotels. Maximum room temperature is limited to 25.5 degree C. Hospitality: All staff are very kind and heartfelt. Nothing to point out. Venue: It is located in the centre of Waikiki so every place is in walk distance, DFS, Royal Hawaian Center, public beach, International Market Place and Beach Walk Waikiki (0 min by walk!). Ala Moana Shopping Center can be reached by Waikiki toroly.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel was amazing. Great location right in the middle of everything. Staff was super accommodating and helpful with anything we needed. They even gave us champagne for our anniversary! So pleased with this hotel.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel was in a very good position,price was good for Hawaii,staff were amazing one street back from the beach ,lots of restaurants,shopping.we had an apartment which was very comfortable,would highly recommend this hotel .

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Facilities were very good and well maintained, clean and convenient to activities. However, no amenities, basically just an apartment. No restaurant or bar. Pool is just a wading pool for children. Did have a hot tub. Parking was VERY expensive. Staff very accommodating and friendly.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel staff was super friendly and welcoming. The facility is nice and this property is central to the main Waikiki area. Outside of the smaller swimming pool for my kids needs, this place was fantastic. Super vacation. Loved it.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had 3 rooms for 7 people and were very happy with the staff and the accommodations. One of our rooms had a terrible view, and the staff was able to change the room for us. Definitely try to stay on the side that looks over Lewers St. Good food and shopping all around and about 5 -7 minute walk to the beach.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I had a great stay at this property in June 2017. I come to Oahu every two years for work and have previously stayed at doubletree and embassy suites, both good properties. The Hokulani as a grand vacation property is very much like an upscale residential building. I found it to be significantly quieter than tradition hotel properties with lots of nice little amenities such as washer dryer on every floor; much upgraded bathrooms with double sink, oversized shower with mural, large separate soaking tub and TV embedded in the bathroom mirror. I stayed in room 1101. Let me say here this property is not ocean front and is somewhat back from the beach. 1101 - and I assume all higher 01 tier units - had a very good view of the ocean (not too distant) as well as the fireworks from the Hawaiian village on the weekend. The view for the other units on this side of the building will be partially or fully blocked by a large building next door to this one. What I most enjoyed about the Hokulani was the fact the suites have very close to a full kitchen. I was able to make eggs on the stove top and there was a small fridge, a freezer and dishwasher. All Dishes and pots and pans are provided.Internet speed was blazing fast (I was able to download movies) and free for diamond members. I found the bed to be very comfortable. The A/C worked great and I could make the room very cold if I desired (which I did not). The shower had one of those rainfall shower heads which I often find to be very weak but this one had good water pressure.The employees were amazing - always consistently friendly (calling me by name) and knowledgeable. The valet folks were insanely fast-the car was always waiting for me by the time I got to the lobby. Roderick in valet stands out. I would often be getting my car at 2 am and had no wait. I spoke with many of the front desk folks and they too were consistently friendly and knowledgeable.Two things - other reviewers are right about the beautiful roof deck and lounge but the pool is no more than a lap pool which was fine with me. The other - be aware the hotel does not serve breakfast but that was also expected as most grand vacation properties do not. I cooked my breakfast in the suite kitchen; there is a 24 hour denny's one block away. Neither of these was a problem for me.That's my take-hope its helpful. Thanks for the great stay. This is definitely my new accommodation when I am in Oahu.Oh, valet parking is 38 per day in and out and you can call the valet from your room to have the car waiting for you.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Loved our stay. Very spacious room and massive bathroom. Great for a family. Excellent location walking distance to the beach. The pool is a lot smaller than we thought based on the image of the property. Only got to use it once as the next time we tried to use it it was booked out for an event.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Nice spacious units with kitchen facilities, friendly helpful staff, great location. We paid a bit more for room on 15th floor with sea view. Rooftop bar with small pool. Managers welcome function Mondays.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We were amazed at the size of our apartment - a generous living area, good sized bedroom, huge bathroom with bath and large shower and lots of storage and wardrobe space. The kitchenette was also well equipped with everything you need to provide your own meals (except the food of course) and a dishwasher and icemaker. The apartment was also very bright but with good blockout drapes. We thoroughly enjoyed our week here and probably saved ourselves several $$$ by doing our own breakfasts and the occasional meal. Staff were friendly and extremely helpful. Furthermore, its just a short walk to the beach in one direction and shopping is right next door. We would definitely return here.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This boutique property is away from the hustle and bustle of the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Bring earplugs if your sensitive to street noise since it's off Kalakaua, especially after the nightlife establishments close. With the noise managed, this place is quaint and relaxing with its rooftop pool. Our second time at this property. The spacious --07 suites have a great layout. Entries to the bathroom both from the bedroom and living room.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Used the Hokulani as a 3-day staycation over a birthday weekend. Conveniently located in Waikiki. Not on the beach, but a short walk. Facility is very modern, clean and well kept. In 1 bedroom Premiere. Very nice free standing soaking tub with hot water, 3 tvs, excellent AC, large capacity ice maker, excellent bedding, dependable in room wi-fi. Lots of restaurants surrounding Hokulani. Room was quiet despite celebrations on the street. $38 nightly parking fee. Curb side car pick up was convenient. Pool/bar in relaxing rooftop atmosphere.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: our hotel room was absolutely beautiful!! we had a room facing kalakaua ave and it was beautiful, a little noisy on a Friday night but not bad! the room was filled with many amnemities! when we told the front desk we were on our honeymoon, they sent up complimentary champagne to us!however, the hotel has a pool bar but is only open noon-6 pm. so if you are planning to do activities throughout the day, there is no time to spend there. also, there is only one restaurant inside the hotel, but has very strange and not guest friendly hours.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hotel and staff were outstanding...! The location is centrally located to be able toWalk anywhere in Waikiki..! RooftopPool Area and cabanas were wonderful..! I would definitely return here..! The only negative that I found was that it's costs $38 to park at the hotel as a Hilton Grand Vacation Club member but the central location of the Hokulani deemed a rental car unnecessary to walk about town..! We rented a car one day to drive to the other side of the island and returned the cat that evening..!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Enjoy the stay .The only problem we had was dryer wasn't hot enough clothes took longer to dry.we was on the 10 floor. Our room was great and great customers Service room clean customer service was great very polite
user_name:
Martha J
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is my 4th visit to Hawaii and this hotel was absolutely perfect! The location is so central, literally one minute walk from the main Waikiki strip. The rooms were large, modern and tidy, enough to accommodate 5 of us for a girls 30th trip. The front desk staff, particularly Josh were lovely and accommodating and the dip pool on the roof was lovely for cooling off if you don't feel like a 5 min walk to the beach.I love this hotel and I will be booking my 5th visit at this hotel shortly!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Loved everything about this hotel but particularly the great service! The highlight of our stay was the staff who were without fail very friendly from the moment we arrived until we left.Arrived very early in the morning after a longish flight from Australia. Despite being about 6hrs early for check in the reception staff could not have been more helpful in finding us a room that allowed early check in.Room was great: spacious, with a separate kitchenette for when we didn't feel like eating out (didn't cook but bought takeout a few times) and a small lounge area. Also loved the fact there was a free, immaculate guest laundry on each floor.The pool area on the top floor was fun. Never crowded and great views. Not meant for serious swimmers but good for cooling off and relaxing.Location was great. Very centrally located, within walking distance of beach and very close to dining options and shopping, but still quiet.Would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a quiet but centrally located hotel with friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Property was beautiful from lobby to room and view to rooftop pool! Loved the location. We enjoyed being able to walk to beach, restaurants and shopping. Staff are so friendly and helpful. Can't wait to come back!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a boutique hotel in the middle of downtown Waikiki, an urban setting. It is close to everything, even the beach. It is a fun, vibrant area to stay in and the service at the hotel is impeccable. The hotel is well-designed and beautiful.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This place was great. The room was amazing. The bathroom was incredible and large, it had a small but well equipped kitchen. The hotel itself is situated right in the middle of restaurants, shops and is only a short walk to the beach.The staff were excellent and very helpful. The rooms were maintained daily to a high standard and a nice touch was when we returned from a day out the cleaners had arranged out shoes neatly by the front door.This place would be great for both couples and families.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have stayed in multiple HGVC properties in Hawaii. Although Hokulani rooms are smaller than other properties, but they are designed perfectly. We are always so impressed wth the design of the kitchen and entire unit . The only thing that could be improved is the venting in the kitchen. We do cook there and it works out almost perfectly. You won't find a better location than Hokulani.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed at the Hokulani in late March of 2017 for a week. This is a timeshare property and I wouldn't really call it a resort but more of a hotel. We booked a suite and it was large, comfortable and quiet. The room was upgraded nicely and the only complaint I had with the room is that it was an alley view. In fact, I think it would've been difficult to get a much worse view. The hotel does attempt to get you to stop by and discuss the possibility of a timeshare tour at one of their other properties, but it isn't hard-sell. Also, since it's a timeshare property, you don't have daily service (although I think we got it every day as far as I could tell.) The pool is on the rooftop and is tiny. The view is nice, however, and it was never really crowded. I kind of liked it up there. Just don't expect something kid friendly and inviting. There wasn't always someone on bar duty up there either, so you were sort of on your own for drinks later in the afternoon. Parking your car costs a small fortune, but service at the hotel was excellent. Having stayed at most of the Hilton properties in Waikiki, I'd probably avoid this hotel in the future. You can, in general, stay less expensively elsewhere and the timeshare component of this hotel is more of a nuisance than an advantage.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hotel is located at a crossing near DFS, if you stay at lower floor it might be noisy if you open the windowAsk for top floorThe hotel is not ideal for families as the pool on the roof is small and 5 -10 min walk from the beach. We use it since the last 3 yearsBut it is perfect if like us you like to go out at night as all the good restaurants and bars are within walking distanceValet is compulsory and cost 38usd per day/ a bit on the expensive side but service was excellent Rooms are all one bedroom around 65 sqm with modern facilities, smaller than lagoon tower but much more modern.I will definitely stay again next year!!If you go to Hilton hotels please make sure to study well on what you want Hawaiian village is crowded but with many pools and near the beachHokulani is for couple looking for a great location with modern amenities

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is beautiful. The accommodations provide the amenities of home with the lush feeling of being in a well kept hotel. This is an excellent location in Waikiki Beach, close to a variety of of restaurants and shops.
user_name:
Donna D
Los Angeles, United States

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Most amazing hotel and staff, room was fantastic, location was unbeatable, we enjoyed the rooftop pool and loved everything about our trip. We would definitely stay here again. Staff were truly wonderful!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is positioned very well; it's very close to shops and only a few blocks walk to the beach. The room facilities are absolutely fabulous, as is the staff... nothing was too much trouble for them and their response time was incredibly speedy. There is a spa on the roof-top which is lovely. Be warned that the pool is really not much of a pool. It's very shallow, has a divider in the middle, and fits very few people. It was a bit annoying that car-parking is $38USD daily, and the only option is valet. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. It's BEAUTIFUL!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel was amazing and enjoyable to my family. The staff were professional and courteous to all my concern that came up. The pool and jacuzzi was intimate and private to entertain guest. My wife enjoyed the yoga class that was provided for her during our stay. The hotel is in the middle of everything and good restaurants

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is the fifth time I've been to Waikiki and my first time at this hotel. The previous reviewer said its a seven minute walk to the beach...not sure how slooooooow this person was walking but it's more like a three minute walk to the end of the street!Service was amazing! All so courteous and friendly and will anything they can to help. Housekeeping EXCELLENT this place is absolutely spotless. I mean every corner, nook and cranny is clean. Thank you for that much appreciated!The apartment is very comfortable. Sofa bed in the lounge area to spread out if you want to watch movies and relax (movies can be rented for free at the lobby from DVD machine). The beds are AMAZING! I've had ten hour non stop sleeps! The roof top pool area is very nice and relaxing. The lounges up there see comfortable and many a snooze was had! The view of the ocean and the whole pool area looks our onto it. The pool is long and thin and only waist high but does the recon to cool you down. I visited the fitness centre every day and while it only has four machines I was ever the only person in there and I only need one machine! It too was spotless. The hotel is close to everything, completely central. The apartment has s kitchenette and a HUGE bathroom, also super clean.I love this place and would definitely come back.Thank you for having us!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It's 18 years since we last vacationed in Honolulu. Last time our hotel,room was tiny with no view and little natural light. This time we discovered Hilton have apartments right in Waikiki. I think Holulani is a refurbished Outrigger Hotel. It is very smart with 24 hour reception and stylish apartments. With a separate lounge andrew well equipped kitchen we have felt very relaxed and comfortable when not out and about. The hotel has no full time restaurant but Arnel does serve great Mai Ta'i's on the pool deck. The neighbours though are shops and restaurants including the ubiquitous ABC convenience stores and PF Chang's Yummy restaurant. We also love Taormina Italian.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The resort was great...only a 7min walk to Waikiki beach. Lots of restaurants around the resort & plenty of shopping. Don't need to rent a car unless you want to visit certain spots around the island. Most excursions can be free also if you have time to sit through presentations that ppl offer you on the street. It would be good to visit the north shore if you're trying to swim because Waikiki has little to no sand with jagged rocks about 3 feet in. Hope you enjoy like we did!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The staff is nice and professional. The room lay-out is great. The location of the resort is excellent, right at the center of Waikiki with many restaurants, department stores, and is closed to the beach. Parking fee per day is a high and you have to use valet. However, the parking attendant staff is courteous.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great stay at the Hokulani. Great location in the middle of Waikiki but quiet once you are in the lobby or the roof top or your room. Staff there is super friendly and always willing to help . From the bellmen to the front desk staff or the Valet for the car - all were great!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is located in a place like Ginza in Japan, which is extremely convenient in terms of location. In addition the inside of the hotel is very beautiful, things in the room are also easy to use and it is appreciated for the Japanese.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had gone to Waikiki hoping to find a place near to a lot of things and still quiet inside. Hokulani did not disappoint us. It is a smaller of Hilton (Grand Vacation Club) property (compare to Hilton Hawaiian Village a couple of miles away) and has smaller swimming pool and onsite restaurants but tht is very well compensated by its location.In walking distance, so many things to do specially you like to walk The staff is very helpful and polite, Swimming pool on the top deck is very nice, quiet and scenic (we just lay in water and not serous swimmers) . It is a sort of narrow pool but just right for us. If you are driving, a couple of things: There is only Valet on site parking and might be considered expensive at $37/day buy there is no other nearby place to park. We did not mind this. Secondly, again if you are driving, their valet station is pretty much on a busy street where you drop the car. It is a bit concerning from safety perspective. I hope they address this.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed at the Hokulani on a recent trip to the Islands. As HGVC members, we prefer this property to the Hilton Hawaiian Village. It seems more geared to couples, though we did see some smaller families as well.The rooms are decorated with a contemporary vibe and are well appointed. We stayed in a one bedroom plus and loved the double entrance to the large bathroom. The shower has a rain shower fixture which may not be for everyone, but there is also a separate hand held shower head you can use also. The Toto washlet has convinced us we need a Japanese toilet and will get one during our next remodel!Staff is super friendly and location is convenient. Parking is valet only, I think. It's pricey but in line with the other resorts in Waikiki. In and out privileges are included.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have just returned from a 10 night stay here celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. Location is terrific, step out of the foyer and you are on Beach Walk surrounded by shopping and eating options, and not too far from the beach. Our first five nights were in a room on the ninth floor looking towards Honolulu, with the second five nights in a higher apartment with a view of the Royal Hawaiian and ocean. Both rooms were corner suites, very clean and a good size for a couple with large bathroom and good size living and sleeping areas. Kitchen a bonus too. Both rooms had plusses. Apartment looking towards Honolulu a little quieter re road noise, while room facing the beach had a fantastic view. While we felt that the apartments appealed to those travelling without children, we did notice a few families with young ones. The rooftop bar/pool was a great spot to rest after being out and about. The pool is really just for cooling off, not resort style. One of the best parts of our stay was the staff. From our initial booking request, to Housekeeping, Concierge and Reception. No request was too much and all were fantastic. A special shout out goes to Blane - the Front Office Manager, Marin and Susan on Reception, Conrad on the Concierge and Arnel running the bar. We felt well looked after by everyone. Everyone was so friendly, we were sad to leave. Highly recommend !

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We booked part of our Hawaiian vacation here due to availability issues at our main hotel. As HGVC owners we were so impressed. It's right in the heart of Waikiki easy walking to many restaurants and shops. Quick walk to the beach but we actually preferred the excellent roof top pool, hot tub and even cabanas! And did I mention a full service bar? The best part was that all during our stay we had this space virtually to ourselves. The rooms are decent size, not huge, but nice size living room, bedroom and huge bathroom with an awesome waterfall shower separate tub and dual sinks. Kitchen area was small but very functional. I'd say the design is best suited for couples or +1 vs large families but it was plenty of space for us - and elegantly designed and furnished. Note Washer dryer on each floor vs in room. Nice thing is they are full size vs apt size as in most places.The best part(and something we've come to expect at HGVC properties) was the staff. They couldn't have been nicer and more helpful. Especially on our last day agreed to give us a little extra time to check out and multiple options to store our luggage. Valet parking is required due to location of hotel but it's actually a positive. Not a lot of places to easily park in Waikiki. And these guys had the car sitting there by the time we stepped off the elevator EVERY time! People who are not only good at their jobs but actually want to make sure your visit to paradise is perfect. Excellent location, beautiful accommodations and service-oriented staff...what more could we ask for?

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: There were three generations of females on our trip. It was my birthday and my three daughters and two grand daughters were there to experience an exciting and adventurous trip to Oahu with our hotel in the heart of Waikiki Beach.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hokulani Waikiki is one of the best guest rooms we have had with HGV. The resort is very high-tech and we always felt safe there. The staff was amazing and extremely accommodating. We were very well taken care of and everyone was so friendly! It is an easy walk to restaurants and shops.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our room was very comfortable and clean,as well as in a convenient location with partial ocean views. The staff is spot on, very friendly and accommodating. Free movie rentals and fully stocked kitchen. Parking is expensive if you have a car.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a wonderful, quiet adults oriented urban resort in the heart of Waikiki. Great location for all activities - 1 block from the beach, fantastic shopping, and excellent launching point for day trips to anywhere on the island. We especially liked being able to cook-in and not have to rely on restaurant food for every meal. The rooftop pool is refreshing and a great place to hang morning, noon and night. The resort is classy and clean, and the staff is top-notch!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Several excellent chain restaurants are across the street, including Starbucks, Ruth Chris and PF Chang. The beach is two blocks away with easy access. Easy walk to see all of Waikiki Beach. Lots of excellent shopping too.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location easy to walk around. Lots of shopping if that's what you like. Easy to get to restaurants as they are right out of the entrance which is awesome. Love the rooftop pool and hot tub we spent a few nights up there!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The best location. It's convenient for access. It's convenient for shopping. It's convenient for a meal. It's also convenient for activity. A beach is close range. Recommendation is the walking which is a round trip to Diamond Head.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The trip to Hawaii was a great one but the experience provided by Hilton Hokulani Waikiki was very memorable. The resort property is beautiful and very well secured. The staff went above and beyond to make our experience great.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Huge bathroom with great shower and also a tub with the water falling from the ceiling! The first bidet/toilet we've ever experienced. Awesome! Just the right equipment - microwave and instant hot water - my favorite. Plus. Next door to an ABC store which sells a lot of basics - wine, cereal, milk, juice, sandwiches. Around the corner from a drugstore. Across the street from PF Chang and Starbucks. A few steps down from the Lobby are Ruth's Chris and a nice cheeseburger place. The beach is two blocks away and an easy walk.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is our second stay at the Hokulani. Great staff! Very nice rooms with either a king sized bed or two double beds, a nice kitchen with refrigerator, large ice maker, microwave, cook top, dishwasher, dishes, pots and pans, etc. There is a nice sitting area with large TV, sofa bed, glass table and chairs and wonderful large bathroom with tub (water comes out of the ceiling) and large shower. Great location!! There is a hot tub and 3ft deep long pool on the top floor along with nice cabanas (with sofas and TV) and a bar. Very relaxing place to stay. We like that it is quiet even though you are right in the middle of the action. The elevators are key activated and security is important in the hotel. Each room has a safe in a large bottom drawer of the dresser. There is a food bar available but only on certain days. Walk out the door of the hotel and there are numerous restaurants!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the Hokulani for three nights prior to our cruise of the four islands in Hawaii. We had an awesome stay! Everyone associated with the hotel is VERY friendly! We were greeted with leis upon our check-in. The bell staff will also be glad to hold your luggage if you arrive prior to check-in time. We had a 1 bedroom+, which consisted of a full kitchen, bedroom, a huge bathroom with a rain shower head, 3 tv's, and a balcony. Although we did not have much of a view, the room itself was lovely. There are 2 concierges on duty each day to help you with any tours or transportation you may need. There is a rooftop pool area, which is beautiful overlooking the city at night. This hotel is in very close proximity to lots of high end shopping, restaurants, cafes, and right across the street from the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center. The Rock a Hula show is in that complex, and is definitely worth your time to attend. There is an ABC store next door, and a Cheeseburger Beachwalk right outside the front entrance. There is also a Denny's that we ate breakfast at less than a block away. Waikiki beach is a short 5 minute walk from the hotel. We did not have a rental car while staying at the hotel, and did not find that to be a problem at all. The area seemed very safe. There are rental car agencies within walking distance is you are interested in renting a car for a day trip. There is free laundry on each floor which was wonderful. There are also free DVDs available to guests. The hotel is very secure. A key is required to get into the elevators, and into all fitness, laundry, etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone heading to Honolulu!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We spent a great week in Honolulu (Waikiki), and we thoroughly enjoyed the Hilton Grand Vacation Resort - Hokulani Waikiki. The hotel staff are friendly and efficient. The rooms are large and clean. The hotel is located near the beach, restaurants, and many shops.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: With traveling with a three years old, we were looking for a small kitchen and with two beds. This hotel provides exactly what we need. I was battling between this hotel and Embassy Suites next door. We stayed here for six nights in a two beds bedroom with kitchenette and appliances. We had a rental car so we dropped it off at the front, which was charging $38 per day unlimited access to the car. We found it very convenience to have the car ready for us when we called them before we left our room. The check in process was smooth and easy. The staff explained all the charge and hotel detail to us. Our room was on 14th floor which had a nice ocean view. We were able to see the firework on Friday night as well. The room is large enough for three of us. It was clean and tidy. We loved the two water bottles each day and movie rental. We went up to the roof to check out the pool area but we did not use it. This hotel is convenient located and great access to restaurants, malls and the beaches. We had a great time here. The only cons were the noise/music that we had at mid night. It annoyed me as I can't sleep. I guess it was just being in downtown. Another thing was they were trying to sell me timeshare. Overall, we enjoy your stay.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location in the center of Waikiki Beach. Easy walking to trolly stops and shopping. One block to the beach. Many dining options.in the area. A list of restaurants in the area would have been welcome.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Cons:Internet was spotty, DVD skipped, rooftop bar was never open. Pros:Lovely room, friendly staff, great location, clean hotel overall. Also, the rooftop pool, hot tub and views were very nice. This boutique hotel offered an intimate feel.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Rooms good for 2 people but to0 crowded for 4 people. Sunn deck ok but miss a real swimming pool. Location very convenient for restaurants and shopping. Both ABC Store and Long drug store are within steps for for snacks or drinks.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights and were pleasantly surprised at how chic and modern this place is. As two adults on vacation, we were glad this place was not specifically kid friendly (hello... rooftop plunge pool and bar!) to have a romantic time away. There are more than enough mega resorts with huge pools in the area and where kids can run around and scream their heads off and touching everything; this is perfectly chill and mellow place. Tons of restaurant and drinking options downstairs and in the up and coming lux area with the Trump hotel around the corner and the Ritz Carlton coming up. Lots of shopping just outside of the street.Valet was expensive at $38 but I loved the option of either dropping it off with the valet curbside or just driving it into the parking below to the elevator and the valet parking it themselves. Loved the parking below option without having to drag all your stuff through a hotel lobby.Room was stylish, modern, and very clean. We had more than enough of the basics-towels for the bathroom, pool, kitchen utensils and coffee pods to last our entire stay without buying more. Will stay here again if we can!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel is a luxury hotel that is maintained very well and the staff is super friendly and helpful. It's located at the corner of Lewers and Kalakaua across from PF Changs and Starbucks so is walking distance to shopping and restaurants of Waikiki. The furnishings are very modern with huge rooms and the bathrooms are spectacular and spacious. The toilets have the traditional Japanese style heated seats.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had three rooms for one week with our extended family over the New Year holiday. The soundproofing is wonderful. Although it's in the middle of the high-end shopping district and much construction is happening, you don't hear a thing in the room. The laundry facilities are on the floor and shared, but of high quality. There is a roof top pool with large, comfortable cabanas with big screen TVs at no extra charge. There is a bar up there that closes at 6 pm, which isn't terribly convenient. The ambience is very Japanese. The security is excellent. The parking is onsite and expensive, but the valet is always available and accommodating. (We were always coming in and out with our large group.)

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our family of 4 stayed at the Hokulani Waikiki in January for 4 nights. The one bedroom apartment was big enough with 2 double beds and also a double sofa bed. After 2 weeks of staying in normal hotels we enjoyed the kitchen facilities....The bathroom was sensational, with a huge bath and huge shower. Great to just have room.Location a street back from the beach was fine for us, as was the small pool as we spent all time either at the beach or touring the rest of the island. If a big pool is what we are looking for maybe not for you.Staff provided great service and always made us feel welcome.We would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hokulani is part of the Hilton Grand Vacations time share collection. My husband and i stayed here for 5 days in a one-bedroom unit. They only have one bedroom units. The units are supposed to sleep 4. They have dishes and utensils for 4 people, but the table is only about 36" wide and there are only two chairs, which means the third and fourth persons would have to eat sitting on the sofa. The rooms are gorgeous. There is a kitchenette with a coffee maker, freezer, glass door refrigerator, mini-dishwasher, and microwave. There is no oven. The bathroom has two sinks, and the toilet has a bidet unit attached to it. The living room and bedroom is separated by a wall with flat screen TVs mounted on both sides of the wall with sliding doors on each side of the wall. There is a manager's reception on Monday nights with appetizers. There is a business center available with computers and a printer in it. The Hokulani is the middle of Waikiki and great for anyone who wants to be in the midst of all the action. Unfortunately, it is valet parking only, and the valet parking is expensive. It was $38/night when we were there. The entire staff is incredibly friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I was presenting at a conference at the Hilton Grand Vacation (Hilton Hawaiian Village) and they were all sold out so I ended up here and I am so, so glad I did! This hotel is much more sophisticated and much better if you are a business or adult traveler. The Hawaiin Village is like "disney land" it is a huge property with a very fake look to it. This hotel is a stand alone property and very sophisticated. Everything about my stay was wonderful! The staff was terrific, my suite (!) was gorgeous and the location was great. It is located kind of on its own cul-de-sac of stores/restaurants which makes it easy to run out and grab something but you are minutes away from from the main shopping of Waikiki. The beach is also about 5-7 min stroll away. If you are looking for a big resort pool this property does not have that though it does have a very nicely appointed roof top pool that is perfect for a short afternoon respite. But if you plan to hang out at the pool all day this may not be the spot for you. But you are in Hawaii go to the beach! And also leave Waikiki there is so much more of amazing Oahu to visit!!!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights just a few weeks ago. It was booked as part of our HGVC, and we booked it last minute so I was so happy we had anything in Honolulu at all. The staff are great-Angela at the front desk was full of aloha spirit when we checked in. She and I share the same first name and you would have thought we were long-lost sisters the way she greeted me. Definitely the best way to start a trip after traveling for nearly 12 hours. Mahalo Angela! The location is great if you like nightlife, shopping, excitement, etc. It's directly next to the Royal Hawaiian Center which has a great food court, also next to a Long's Drugs and a whole bunch of other shops. The beach is about a block away, which is found through a pathway by the Halekulani hotel. The design of the room is great, basically a studio which has been cleverly divided with sliding doors. The bathroom is huge, and yes, the toilet is awesome. My only issue with this hotel, like the others have mentioned is that the pool is really like a one person lap pool, but not deep enough to swim in. There are also cabanas hooked up with tv's, so you can have some shade when it gets too hot on the roof top. The valet is expensive, $39 a day, I believe. However, you do get in and out privileges, and the guys at valet are super nice and helpful. Overall, it's a great hotel for couples, young and young at heart. For families, I would suggest the Hilton Hawaiian Village. If given the opportunity to stay here again, I wouldn't hesitate to visit again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A perfect spot to relax in a modern, efficient, clean environment. The rooftop cabanas and bar offer a wonderful escape from the hub bub of Waikiki. The surrounding restaurants and shops are upscale and welcoming. Each concierge offered a wealth of information and possibilities to explore the island.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the Hokulani for 4 nights while in Waikiki. We are not Hilton Grand Vacation club members, and we didn't notice any difference in the service. The service was consistently amazing from all of the staff- front desk, concierge, housekeeping, and the gentleman at the rooftop bar. Very friendly and responsive.The suites are impressive! The kitchenette has everything you need-So nice to have washer/dryer on the same floor.The bathroom is so much better than other hotels- spacious, functional, and beautiful.We walked to the beach through the Sheraton- fastest walk to get to the sand.Easy access to shops and restaurants.We highly recommend this hotel-

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The staff at this HGVC property is terrific!!! The Front Desk, Bellman/Valet and Concierge staff were just fantastic. Although this property is in downtown Waikiki the room was very quiet for sleeping. I would stay here again and I would recommend this HGVC location for a short stay in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Because this property is not on the Hilton Hawaiian Village proper, families with children will miss the many pools and beach that they would find at the Village. However, if you want a clean and conveniently located condo, this is the place. There is a pool and fitness center; however, they are on the small side. But walking in Waikiki is very convenient. I'm not sure if you could use the facilities at the Village, if you stayed here since we did not venture that way.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Beautiful hotel and great staff!! Location is perfect for sight seeing and shopping. Valet access at Lewers Street. Staff is so accommodating and very helpful. Good point for walking access to the shopping amenities and beach.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hokulani is a relatively new timeshare. We were told it used to be an Outrigger hotel and that each unit used to be two hotel rooms. We had a one bedroom Plus unit which was nicely decorated but still felt cramped for just two people. The mattress was too soft for my liking and gave me a backache so I didn't sleep well.There is a small kitchenette and a large bathroom. Our room, 511, was quiet which we preferred. From the balcony (only deep enough to stand, not sit), we could see the 75th Pearl Harbor Anniversary parade. That was an unexpected plus.However, unlike most timeshares, this one wasn't really suited for resort type relaxation. It is located in the middle of the Waikiki shopping and restaurant area. The beach is a short walk away. The rooftop pool is so small that it's basically for sitting in and cooling off. You can't swim laps even if you wanted to. There are a very limited set of organized activities but we did enjoy the ukelele lesson and Manager's reception. If you are coming to Hawaii primarily for shopping, the location works well. The staff is very friendly and the hotel is modern. The free WiFi was fast enough to stream Netflix.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We spent four nights here on our first trip to Hawaii a week and a half ago. This place is wonderful! First the staff: Josh at check in and Daniel and Kenzil, I remember by name because they were so helpful and friendly! They remembered us by name each time we saw them. All staff were helpful and nice. The room was great! The bed was so comfortable! No sore backs in the morning! The shower was awesome too! The location is great with an ABC store right next to the hotel to get some grocery items. Multiple restaurants and shopping. Couple of blocks to the beach. The rooftop is a great place to relax! I do wish the pool was bigger. And I wish they had a washer /dryer in the room rather than down the hall, but at least it was available!
