Elizabethton, Tennessee, United States

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is in the heart of Waikiki and minutes away from Diamond Head and Manoa Falls. The valet parking was convient and fast. There multiple shops and restaurants in the area. Great customer service.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location, excellent staff, and very nice rooms. The Hilton Hokulani is our new go to hotel in Waikiki. We will be staying at this location during our future visits! Beach is a block away. It could use a nice restaurant inside though.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: In Hawaiian Hokulani means heavenly star and it lives up to its name. This is an amazing boutique hotel in the heart of Waikiki. The hotel is nicely situated a short walking distance from world class attractions, restaurants and shopping but the real star of the hotel is the staff. They display the genuine spirit of 'Aloha' from the very moment they meet you and treat you like visiting Ohana (family). Every morning when I would go down to the lobby for a morning newspaper I was greeted by name and asked if there was anything I needed or that would make our stay better. Josh was simply outstanding and even after we checked out rushed to my wives aide when our airport transportation arrived and helped her load her heavy luggage. Every evening when we returned tired from our days adventure and loaded down with "treasure" Paul (who I learned was working a second job to supplement his teaching income) would have us drive the car as close to the elevator as possible and then wait to take care of the car after we were completely unloaded. It was these acts of kindness as well as numerous others by the entire staff that make this a very special place and someplace we can not wait to return to.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Everything about this hotel is luxury. We only wish we could have stayed longer!! The bathroom is a dream come true (we had a TV in the mirror!) and roof top bar and lounge area is fantastic. Location is perfect for shopping and restaurants. Simply brilliant! Mahalo Hilton!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Josh and Angela and all the Hokulani staff provided great customer service during our local stay-cation. We look forward to staying there in the future. We were able to get a fantastic room with a view of the Waikiki strip and the ocean.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We happened to have a chance to stay this hotel as an invitation.The room is equipped with full kitchen, wide living room and separated bed room and spacious bath room. The location is also perfect, center of Waikiki.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Birthday trip and was not the best trip We wanted an ocean view.. the welcome was nonexistent. The room smelled funny and it was too hot. The stay at this hotel was not the best and the pool was a joke

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: One of the best resorts we have ever stayed at in the last 20 years. The service and quality of the resort is second to none, regardless of the price! The resort pool on the roof is a night experience every person should have at least once in their life. Highly recommend with no reservation.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This will be my new place the next I visit Oahu. Have been staying at the Hawaiian Village every time I visit Oahu and Hokulani provides a totally different perspective of an HGVC hotels. Totally awesome, from the furnishings, the layout, the staff. I guess their target clients are Japanese, nothing is wrong ẃith that. Just love it because I missed those Japanese hotéls during my business trips there in Japan änd Okinawa. Japanese bath tubs are different compared to the European or American bath tubs. And of course their bidét, not as elaborate like the ones in Japan but it is close. So check it out for yourself.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at this wonderful condominium during a recent visit to Honolulu in September. We were blown away by the many helpful technological features in the building and in our unit specifically. My husband loved the TV that was part of the bathroom mirror and I liked the elevators that were programmed for you specifically each time you used them. The unit was clean, nicely decorated, and had a great view of the city. The location was very convenient for catching a city bus or walking to the beach or many good places to eat or shop. One of the most outstanding features was the staff. Every person we had contact with was extremely helpful and friendly and made us feel very welcome and important. No request was too small or inconvenient. We really enjoyed our time staying there and would highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hokulani is a great addition to the HGVC. This was the first time I stayed here--usually stay at the property right at the Hilton Hawaiian. The staff were amazing and very attentive. the room was GREAT. I LOVED the bathroom--the soaking tub was super cool. Nice amenities. Beds comfortable. My only complaint was that the living room furniture was not the quality I'm used to at HGVC properties. This minor detail wouldn't keep me from staying here again tho. Loved the location--right next to good dining and shopping.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hotel staff was excellent. Because it's a small hotel they give much more personal attention than we have ever received at a larger hotel. Josh, in particular was excellent. He went above and beyond to accommodate our needs.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed there a week as a hotel guest. while others might own timeshares. As a regular guest, we got daily housekeeping, others may not. We had a premier king bed suite. I really like the hotel and plan on staying there again in the future. Hotel personnel provide great service. Very secure, you need key to access the elevators to go up, but no key is required to go to the lobby or basement garage. If you can manage your luggage, I suggest you park (valet only) in the basement garage and carry you own luggage to the lobby (via elevator). Entrance is on Kalakaua.Each floor has 2 free washers and 2 dryers. There is also a trash chute in the laundry room. Under the kitchen sink there is a small (single washload) package of laundry soap, but you can request additional packages. Room has 2 closets, so lots of hanging space. One closet in the bedroom and one in the living room. There is also an ironing board, iron, plastic laundry basket and a dust pan and broom in the closest.There is a dresser in the bedroom, but there are also 2 drawers in the living where the TV is located. These drawers are a little tricky to open, the "handle" is on the ends of the drawer. The bedroom dresser also has a safe in 1 bottom drawer. A TV in the bedroom and another in the living room. Also a DVD player and video game unit in the living room, free wifi. Sliding doors thru-out.Kitchen is compact, with all the items you would need to prepare simple meals. There is a blender, toaster, rice cooker, etc. Paper towels are also on the counter. There is Tassimo coffee unit with coffee accessories. The refrigerator is built in under the counter (larger than a dorm room frig). The freezer is also built in with an automatic ice maker. There is no ice maker on the floors. Kitchen has an electric range and microwave oven.Bathroom is very spacious with lots of counter space and 2 sinks. Toilet room has a separate door and is equipped with a Japanese electronic seat with water controls, etc. Shower (rain) type is very large with a separate shower wand attachment. I couldn't figure how to turn the wand off, but if you turn off the water and turn it back on, the wand goes off and normal shower resumes. The bath tub is large, and as others have mentioned the water comes out of the ceiling.Rooftop plunge pool is suited just for sitting and relaxing, maybe with a drink. You really can't swim in it. There are 6 cabanas each with a large TV, sofa, 2 chairs and a round table. Canvas top provides shade, but if it is somewhat raining, you will get wet.Hotel lobby is roomy enough. Restrooms are behind the front desk glass wall. Note that the front desk has a luggage scale. The business center is off in a side room where they also have a DVD rental machine. I saw a number of guest using the DVD rental service.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great and wonderful. My family wants to go back someday. The location is perfect. Shopping, beach, and eating places are within reach. Total experience was awesome. Will be more than glad to recommend Hilton in Hawaii or any other location. I am a very proud owner.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The excellent: The rooms are modern and new. Location on Lewers St very convenient. The sangria from the poolside bar was one of the best I've have. The service was superb.The opportunities: Parking valet only, no real "front" entrance. Pool very small. Restaurant really doesn't serve much and there's no store (probably because of all of the ABC stores and restaurants close by)The good definitely outweigh all and I would definitely stay here next time I want to stay in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Love the location, staff and hotel. Close to shopping, shops, and I discovered the great Longs/cvs next door. Staff was friendly and very accommodating to requests and questions asked. Valet. Service was always prompt and friendly

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A great location as most of everything are within easy walking distance - beach, shops, restaurants, church & landmarks. We are military and Fort DeRussey and Hale Koa were just around the corner. Some of the rooms actually have a nice view of the water. Staff makes you feel very welcome.

Bremerton, United States

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent city property with plenty of night life around. If you are looking for a beach property this is not it, try looking over at the Hilton Hawaiian Village property. Rooms were fantastic with all amenities provided. Maid service only came once during our stay. But could easily get fresh towels if we asked. The kids loved the free movie rentals in the lobby. Pool cabanas were relaxing, but the swimming pool is quiet small. Overall a great property that was quiet and relaxing.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I had a great experience being that this is my third time staying at this hotel. I've stayed at multiple hotels in Waikiki and the other Hilton Hotels at the Hawaiian Village but nothing comes close to this hotels customer service. The lobby staff to the valet to the concierge are very, very friendly and have the Aloha spirit. I recommend this hotel to everyone as it is actually a hidden gem that offers what everyone would like to see coming to Oahu, Hawaii.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: You will have an amazing stay. The service and most accommodations are great. I would recommend that anyone stay at this location while in Honolulu. You are close to everything and they give you discounts to the restaurants nearby.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We spent three nights at the Hokulani Waikiki and enjoyed every minute of it. The hotel is located close to beaches and shopping and a one-bedroom (the kind of room we stayed in) has a kitchen with a fridge, two burner plates and small freezer (this came in very handy - we froze bottles of water to take on a Diamond Head hike). We honestly didn't spend that much time in the hotel but it had a large and welcoming lobby area and our one-bedroom was spacious and very clean with a pull out couch in the living room. Staff were very helpful with tips for places to eat and estimates on how long it would take to walk to tourist attractions or whether we needed to go by car instead. It was a five minute walk to the nearest beach. Tip: pick a higher floor (11 and up) to reduce the sounds of Honolulu traffic. Would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent time at Hokulani Hotel... perfect location, great service and the best accommodation. In the heart of Waikiki Business Center close to so many stores, restaurants. and the beach of course!! Walking distance to everything that you need to make your vacation unforgettable.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: What a great hidden gem in the middle of busy Waikiki! We were pleasantly surprised with the quality and the facilities at Hokulani! Definitely will plan on visiting again... if we can get reservations!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great hotel. Hilton Grand Vacation is a very poor dishonest company. Booked a two bedroom suite. Was given a one bedroom hotel room. My son was on leave and he couldn't stay with us. Cost me 1500 dollars to get another room elsewhere. Hilton offered me 170 dollars for my 1500 cost. Dishonest!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Enjoyed our stay at the Hokulani. Took our sons to Hawaii for their graduation and the room was perfect for all four of us. Love the new age amenities like the tv in the bathroom mirror. Appreciate having internet service as well as games and DVDs to check out.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We enjoyed awesome accommodations with very friendly and attentive staff. The concierge service was very helpful and would have steered us to excellent excursions had we not already booked our excursions in advance through TripAdvisor. They made recommendations about local grocery shopping (we ate in two of three meals per day), restaurants (we did try out a couple of the local restaurants -find and use coupons in coupon books), local transportation, and beaches.

review_body: This is a Hilton timeshare hotel that is first class. Open lobby, high tech room features (in room wifi, DVD player, toilet bidet seat, instant hot water). hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We recently stayed for 3 days at this hotel.. Found everything to be excellent .. Loved the spirit of aloha that was shown to us., Looking forward to our next stay!! Loved the decor and how lovely the hotel looked.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The location is the best. The room is beautiful, too. Facilities are the latest. The security is all right, too. I want to stay again. I want you to increase the pool. I want you to reduce a parking rate.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent service from staff. The room we stayed in was clean, luxurious and well appointed. Couldn't fault our stay. We only stayed for two nights, but I am staying for five when I return in August. Loved it!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Loved the view, room amenities, helpful staff, and location of the hotel. Would love to stay here again! Made our vacation a very happy and fun one. Close to all kinds of stores you can easily walk to.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at this hotel after a week on the big island. Accommodations were perfect. The decor was modern and elegant. Rooms were comfortable, clean and quiet. The bathroom was amazing with rain head shower and beautiful free standing tub.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very near to central Waikiki,very comfortable and convenient. its located next to Royal Hawaiian shopping mole,grocerlies stores and drug store are also near with 24 hours open. We will go again. Concierge Mr.Conrad is very funny with humor but gentle.thanks to him,we enjoyed so much while staying.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Convienently located near great shopping, restaurants, and a 5 min walk to the beach! Amazing views from the roof top pool with relaxing cabanas. Comfortable rooms with upgraded features. Overall great experience!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very nice place to stay. We are just like more quiet space. Pool was too small, breakfast amenities were lacking in the cafe. Pool closed early, pool bar closed at 6. No other bar available other than outside hotel.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The people were fine, but Josh stood out. Not sure if he is the bell captain, valet or just the go to guy for all things Hokulani. He was very helpful, when we got there at 10 AM our room was not ready we changed ourselves and the kids, Josh made sure we had access to our luggage and was very nice throughout our stay. We asked for a high room, basicly got 3rd floor, not high at all! Now the bad part, there is a street musician who starts playing at 10PM and plays until 2 AM with an amplifier!! After 3 days I went down to the front desk at midnight and the front desk person said "yes we know" butwecannot do a anything. I said call the police since there is a 10PM noise curfew. called the Waikiki substation and they said they will send someone and he suggested I call 911. I did that and did not hear the noise maker again that night. I have four nights left and believe me I will call 911each time he starts. And notify the front desk.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Walking distance to all shopping center!Quick response when you need them. Wifi great access and fast internet. Laundry when you need them. I love the bidet in bathroom feels like you in Japan. Friendly folks! . Great area for shopping and restaurants.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at Hokulani as a deal through Hilton. I am typically a stickler about hotel cleanliness so I was pleasantly surprised by how well kept the hotel and rooms were. We stayed in the one bedroom with our kids on the pullout couch. They did say that it was uncomfortable and I can attest to feeling the springs (so probably only have kids sleep on it). Room service was done once during our 5 day stay which would have been fine but they only gave us 4 bathroom towels for the 4 of us. I even requested more from the maid when she cleaned it and left her a tip and she still only replaced the 4. The rooftop pool is also a bit of a joke. It is more like 3ft of water to cool you off. Because of this, we spent all of the days over at Hawaiian Village where our friends were staying and used their pool. In short, if you want a pool do not stay here. If you plan to only use the beach, this place was fantastic!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed at the Hokulani to enjoy the 4th of July fireworks and it was fabulous. Staff and accommodations made the stay most enjoyable. This hotel is centrally located in Waikiki which made for easy shopping, dining, and overall touring easy.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hotel location was very conveinet for shopping etc. It was a little bit noisy out side in the mid night. Pool size was small, but it was on 16th floor and very good view. Room was enough size for two people.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Newer vacation spot so close to food, shopping, and everything Waikiki! Loved it! Great service, clean, friendly, accommodating! The only thing I can say that would be on the negative side is this: the pool is just a 3 foot deep " get your feet wet " kind of pool. It still feels great after walking all day thru the shops!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Level to call the police in the middle of the night the noise of the street performers. But the front gave me comfortably immediately run. In the room what was a cheap lower floors of the price in the room bass of the motor is from early morning. This is not a complaint and understanding with the United States quality. That give up.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I love staying at the Hokulani Waikiki! 3rd time here. Very clean and the staff is so friendly! Love the pool and bar at the rooftop. Location is very convenient as it is surrounded with restaurants and shopping.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We just loved our stay and were blown away by the room features. The kitchen area was gorgeous -- the bathroom was fit for royalty! Large with a waterfall bathtub, a separate beautiful shower, a tv embedded in the mirror, and a ToTo toilet. If you don't know about it, look it up!!!! Superb location....beautiful rooftop area and private cabanas -- we cannot wait to return!!!Free huge modern washers and dryers were on each floor, and many floors had washers/dryers that were handicapped accessible.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is in the best location in Waikiki. It's in the center of everything and it's a safe, clean beautifully modern hotel. Hands down one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in.... Staff are amazing and the surrounding food choices are all awesome too.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The location is fantastic, the workers were nice, and the room was clean. That is the only positive thing I can say. My opinion is likely tainted because I am used to the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the Hokulani does not compare. There was no flower lei, no tropical plants or trees by the pool, tiny pool, tiny lanai. Tiny, tiny, tiny pool - even smaller than it looks in the pictures. No furniture on the lanai, sparse and uncomfortable furniture in the living room. One of the two beds was really in bad shape, tiling a lot. No hospitality room for use after checkout to refresh in the event you wanted to use the pool after checkout. We always have a late flight home so this was sorely missed. We will not stay here again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was out first visit to our timeshare at the Hokulani. The apartment was quite chic and useful, clearly adapted for Japanese tastes. The refrigerator and dishwasher are small, but sufficed for our needs,and there were adequate dishes, pots and pans and a rice cooker and blender. Sheets and towels were changed once only, the third day and at that time amenities were replenished. I found the bathroom amenities quite substandard, not the level I would expect. One of the faucets leaked around the base and we were told it could NOT be fixed and we would have to wrap a towel around it for our entire visit. Our room looked out onto a wall and the balcony was tiny. No point in sitting out on it anyway as there was nothing to see but that huge wall. Service for the most part was excellent with a couple of quite glaring exceptions. The first was that my guest checked in before I did so when I the owner arrived I was not offered any information, lei, or anything but a room key. The second was upon check out when I told the desk person and the bell hop that I would be waiting in the lobby for Speedi Shuttle, but after an hour nobody came for me.Nobody checked on me either.I went down to the bell hop and he told me the shuttle driver had gone upstairs to look for me. i knew this was not possible as I was waiting right at the top of the escalator. To their credit, the hotel provided me with Charley's Taxi and when I returned the service from which I booked Speedi Shuttle investigated the GPS and discovered Speedi lied about picking me up and had never arrived at all, so my money for that was refunded. The other whine is that the rooftop cabanas were closed for an entire afternoon for "cleaning" which posed problems for us as my entire family was visiting us. I thought these cabanas were to be cleaned at night when guests were not using them. On the other hand, the hotel did have the fairly standard cocktail reception- with no cocktails just nice wraps and snacks as it couldn't be held on the roof, a bingo game, and that was fairly fun. One nice thing is that when the hallway was smelling a whole lot from garlic, shrimp and other cooking, housekeeping sprayed a very pleasant coconut spray that eliminated the malevolent odors and was also, amazingly, very nice. It smelled like summer! I also really liked the laundry facilities! The rooms are small and clearly the resort is NOT for children. It is not very near the beach, is surrounded by high level shopping and restaurants, and lots of traffic. That is not a criticism on my part, as I knew that when I went there and that is what I wanted anyway.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I stayed at the Hokulani Waikiki for 7 nights and absolutely loved it. The room design was unique and had everything we needed. It was clean and very modern. The pictures show exactly how the room looked, which is not always the case. The staff was very nice and offered us complimentary umbrellas on the days it rained. A few features I liked were the TV in the bathroom mirror, the soaking tub which is filled from a hole (water spout) in the ceiling and the two sliding doors that separate the bedroom from the living room area. I also loved the kitchen area and all the space saving features. It carried everything that units with full kitchen offer, only in sleek modern way. I definitely plan to stay here on my visit to Waikiki.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel was centrally located in the heart of Waikiki. It was walking distance to shops, restaurants, and the beach. The room was beautifully decorated and very chic. Would definitely stay there again.

Miami, United States

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very satisfied with my stayed thank you everyone at the hotel, valet parking was excellent, clean rooms with kitchen microwave laundry, very close to the beach. Centrical to all shops right in the middle of Waikiki

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I recently stayed here for 5 nights and wish it was longer. Excellent location amongst all that Waikiki beach has to offer. Rooms were modern and very comfortable. Rain shower was lovely & bath was great, even if I couldn't work out where the water came from, it came from the roof! TV in the bathroom was very indulgent.I would definitely stay here again and cannot recommend highly enough.Quiet hotel with rooftop pool, yes the pool is not big but it's enough to cool off and chill out on the lounge chairs and to enjoy a Mai Tai!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We spent 8 nights here this year after previously stay at the Kalia Tower, Lagoon Tower and the Grand Waikikian. The Hokulani is new and nicely design but the limited kitchenette and crowded living areas leaves a lot to be desired. The other HGVC one bedrooms in Waikiki are much more spacious and better fit for two/three or even four adults. There is really no way to have three adults in an Hokulani unit and be comfortable. We had our four year old grandson with us and it was crowded enough. The bathroom in the unit is larger than the bedroom and as large as the living room that included a small L shape kitchenette, very strange. The "plunge" pool at the rooftop is meant for adults to dip their feet, but toddlers and young kids had a good time in the six by forty feet pool that was only 3 feet deep. Service at the Hokulani was very good. Location is excellent for those that want to be in the heart of Waikiki access to shopping and restaurants. If it was just two of us, I would be willing to stay there again but would not consider it again if we had a grandchild with us.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We absolutely loved the Hokulani! After spending two weeks at various other hotels on the big island and Oahu, this was a quiet and luxurious change. The hotel is ideally suited to couples and is located on the corner of the two main streets in the Waikiki area, Kalakaua Ave with its high end boutiques, restaurants and beach front hotels and Lewers St with more restaurants and beach walk shops. 2 minutes walk to the beach (max) and an ABC store directly underneath the hotel.This is not a beach side hotel and the view is (mostly) of the surrounding Waikiki area not of the ocean. This was not a consideration for us but if a great view or being on the beach is your thing, the Hokulani isnt your place. I do think however that the benefits of this hotel far outweigh its non beach location and compared to the beach side hotels and the space you would get, this is by far better value for money.The rooms were large and well laid out. The bathrooms were massive (TV in the mirror!) the small kitchen was well equipped. This is a condo hotel so dont expect a mini bar or room service but considering you can buy what ever you desire downstairs, this is not missed. The highlight for us was the roof top pool and cabanas. The pool is small but perfect if you just want to just relax and cool down. Little kids would love it but older kids would probably be bored.The cabanas are free on a first come first served basis and include a large day bed, chairs and a table, TV, Fridge and safe. We spent many an afternoon lazing in the sun, drink in hand admiring the view. If you dont get a cabana or want to sit in the sun, there are plenty of other options including loungers and sofa seating. The poolside bar is only open for a few hours a day and offers limited options but is fine for a cold drink. BYO lunch from ABC is a cheap and easy alternative to eating out everyday.We spent time up there almost every day and there was never more than a handful of people up there at any time.The staff were super friendly and helpful. We had an issue with a running toilet and they came up straight away to fix it. We booked with points rented from a HGVC member that we found on-line so got a great rate. If the Hokulani is within your budget, you will not be disappointed.This is our new go to hotel when visiting Hawaii.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Room was clean and overall great experience. We didn't have to rent a car, everything you need is in walking distance. The beach is an easy 3 minutes walk and restaurants all along the lobby floor. Didn't get a rental car coz valet parking (all that's avail) is $35/day...didn't need it anyway.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Modern and trendy boutique hotel.Great rooms and facilities with lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Great city views from the rooftop and a cosy bar by the pool. Ideal for couples.Happy to recommend.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A Touch of Japan in Honolulu. This old run down hotel was totally refurbished into an uber modern small upscale resort that exceeded our expectations. All of the appliances and furnishings were of the highest quality and comfort. The staff was friendly and very efficient. There was a rooftop pool get together sponsored by the management with drinks and snacks that was out of the ordinary. The guests were made up of about 75% Japanese tourists and the staff catered to them pretty much exclusively.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Enjoyed my stay at the Hokulani. The staff was very friendly and helpful. No need for a vehicle if staying here but we rented one for a few days to explore the rest of Oahu. The rooftop pool is small but has wonderful views and plenty of sun if you want to tan.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This wonderfully located hotel (opposite the Royal Hawaiian Centre) provided the most comfortable accomodation replete with kitchen facilities , 2 double beds and a very large bathroom with walk in shower; beds were very comfortable . Reception was always helpful , smiling and courteous , particularly the very charming Angela who checked us in and Cantell (?). The Hotel exudes a quiet elegance which adds to its sophistication. Highly recommended if you aspire to roomy comfortable accomodation away from the busy noisy beach area .

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location and facility. Smaller than most resorts but quaint. Staff very helpful and friendly when needed. Roof top pool was quiet and relaxing. Plunge pool was refreshing. Had a bartender at the rooftop pool for most of the day.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Service, Location and Room are Very Good.We want to stay next time.We will suggest to stay my friends.My family liked this hotel.The staff of this hotel was very friendly.Manager events to be held in the evening of every Monday was very fun.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It was our first time at the Hokulani in Waikiki where we stayed there for three nights. First off, we arrived early at the front desk and the friendly staff allowed us an early check-in, which was really appreciated. Our unit was high in the floor and I enjoyed every detail of it. It is compact, urban-style and no space is wasted with a modern touch everywhere. The bathroom was gigantic with a built-in TV screen in the large mirror above the sinks. The shower was awesome! Location-location-location is a must for the Hokulani which is in the heart of the bustling Waikiki. The largest ABC store in Honolulu is just down the street and the Yard House is within the same block with my favorite draft beers and vegan dishes. A couple of really nice galleries and other boutiques compliment the area. The beach is also 5 minutes walk and you'll find other great places to go out at night around the corner. There is a pool on the roof top, which was big enough to get wet but I think the view, comfortable lounge chairs, the bar and the hot tub are more of interest. The checkout process was also very smooth, though, I am not really fund of the Hawaiian state tax! It was very easy to be picked up by our shuttle right in front and go back to the airport. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Overpriced for the quality of room you receive. Had to wait at check in far too long ... Pool is tiny with the bar closing at 6 PM so you have to leave the facility if you want to relax ... Avoid this hotel most certainly with far more accommodating facilities for the price in the area

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We spent a week at the Hokulani HGVC property, and found it to be excellent in almost all respects.The property address is on Kalakaua Ave., but the actual entrance is on Lewers St. In addition, the lobby is on the second floor, reached by escalator from the street level. If you're traveling with small children and/or lots of luggage, bear this in mind. After you take the escalator up, you enter the lobby and go down two or three steps; there is a handicapped ramp, but it isn't conspicuous.That aside, checkin was pretty quick and easy. Front desk staff are friendly. Security is fairly tight: the elevators require you to scan your room key and enter your destination floor. It's a little strange, but you get used to not pushing any buttons once you get into the elevator, and the elevators are relatively quick.We had room 503, a 1BR. It has a two-burner cooktop, plus refrigerator, microwave, and dishwasher. The furnishings are pretty new and modern, and the Japanese influence seems to be strong -- lots of sliding panels and various ways of maximizing a small space.The bed is comfortable, and the room is quiet. It has no view to speak of, but that is actually an advantage in terms of quiet, because Waikiki is a hopping place.The bathroom has a shower stall and bathtub, but prepare yourself for a shock, because the water for the bathtub comes out of a hole in the ceiling. My wife got a big surprise the first time she ran a bath.We didn't really use many of the amenities, aside from the business center and the rooftop pool and bar. The pool is ridiculously small -- I could almost touch both sides by stretching my arms out. There is also relatively little shade on the roof; there are umbrellas, but the staff cautioned me that the wind can kick up suddenly, which means placing them near the edge can be risky.The bar was pleasant, though you have to specify a call brand. I ordered a gin and tonic without specifying, and what I got wasn't very good. Arnel, one of the bartenders, was very pleasant, and was a fount of information on what to do and where to go in Waikiki and other places on the island.If you have a car, it's going to be expensive to park. Valet parking is your only choice at the property, and that's $35 per day. For that you get the convenience of being able to call downstairs and have your car brought out whenever you need it.Bottom line: it's a great location, and the property is very clean and in good condition, with friendly and helpful staff. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location great service was on level 5 wished was higher so when windows open didn't have all the street noise. Windows closed no noise at all. Clean rooms pool was available till late which was great

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The room is compact, but facilities is fantastic. Especially pool on the top is great. Beach bet is cofortable and we can see Diamondhead, PinkPalace, and Waikiki Beach! And easy to access to Beach Walk,DFS and lots of shops, so it is very convinient. Although the room capacity is 4, I recommend staying 2 people.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Just steps away from great shopping and dining in Waikiki, this location is comfortable and convenient. I especially like the double sliding glass doors that provide a huge opening onto the balcony and having Starbucks right across the street helped keep me awake for early morning calls back to the office on the mainland.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel was awesome! My husband and I went for our dream vacation in Hawaii and we couldn't have asked for a nicer room. It had everything we needed, the concierge helped us get around, the staff were super friendly! This is right in the heart of Waikiki and made it so easy for us to walk everywhere we wanted to go. Will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Really deserves 4.5 stars but that option wasn't available. If you're traveling to Hawaii there is a very good chance you will be passing through Honolulu, and most of the better hotels are located in Waikiki. Among the Hilton properties, this is by far the nicest, with beautiful, extremely clean rooms. Facilities are somewhat limited but the rooftop pool and bar were surprisingly nice. The lobby was peaceful and welcoming which is quite nice considering the hustle and bustle of Waikiki's main drag right outside the door. The beach is within easy walking distance. Staff ranged from excellent to truly outstanding. As for location, the Hokulani is far better situated to the main Waikiki sights in my opinion than are the hotels in the main Hilton complex.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We've been to Waikiki a number of times, and the Hokulani rates as one of the best hotels we've stayed at. The staff are super friendly, and having arrived early in the morning after a long flight, Angela on reception ensured we had a room ready well ahead of the guaranteed check-in time. The rooms and amenities are modern and perfect for a family of four. Great connectivity and the PS3 was the perfect distraction for our boy. hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hokulani is awesome! From the perfectly clean, fully stocked room to the Toto washlet toilet, every single detail was perfection! I will definitely stay there again and I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone lucky enough to travel to this area!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights. Everyone at the front desk were wonderful and helpful. Some of the concierge was clueless. Guys at the valet were always awesome. hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The resort has a fantastic location which is one of its top attributes. Room was average size but well appointed. Great staff. We stayed on the 15th floor with a magnificent view of the ocean, diamondhead, and the city. You're close to all the action. It's not a huge resort, however, like the Hilton Waikiki Village. The rooftop cabanas were free which was a nice surprise. Overall, we lover our stay.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our room was on the 15'th floor. It was luxurious. The staff was all friendly and helpful. We used the spash pool, jacuzzi, cabana, and the rooftop sunning area. We did wish that they had a larger pool, and they were building a hotel nearby and we were awoken by construction noise in the morning. We also had a car for a few days and they only had valet parking which we felt the cost was high, and was an additional fee. We also thought that the couch was a bit uncomfortable to sit on.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Wonderful service. Modern, clean, up-to-date technology, gorgeous one bedroom apartments. Fabulous bathrooms! In the center of Waikiki. The hotel staff was remarkably helpful and they went out of their way to be pleasant. This location was incredibly well placed for beach access, restaurant availability, shopping proximity, and tour pick-up.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Hokulani Waikiki for 4 nights in February. It was a partial work trip for my husband and vacation for me. We were lucky enough to be able to use Hilton Rewards points to book this stay. Hotel was wonderful. Room was very nice, spacious. Bathroom, shower area very spacious as well. You have a freezer, microwave. two top burner, fridge sink and stocked kitchen which was very nice. Unfortunately due to late booking we were only able to get two full size beds instead of a king as we had requested, but this wasn't a huge deal. The beds were VERY comfortable, no complaints there. The only things I did not like were no cleaning services, if staying under 5 nights, so you had to call for more towels and all the towels, wash clothes, etc stayed in the room as no housekeeping comes to pick them up. Other then that, great hotel room, great location. I would certainly return and would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have never had such a great vacation. From beginning to end. We going to return. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The Bar tender Arnel even helped me book a Anniversary Dinner for my wife and me. The bell staff and front end group are top notch.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My wife and I stayed four nights at the Hokulani to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary. This is the newest addition to the collection of Hilton Towers in Waikiki. It’s on one of the most convenient streets on the west end of Waikiki. Coffee shops, pubs, restaurants, shopping areas, and the beach are but a few steps away from the hotel. Hokulani enjoys the best location of all the company's properties in Waikiki. Friendly staff. Concierge is very engaging, knowledgeable, and eager to help. We certainly appreciated the secure elevator system, a free state-of-the-art laundry room on every floor, the well-equipped fitness center, the rooftop sunning deck and spa with a bar, and all the other resort amenities. We enjoyed our suite on the 12th floor that had a commanding view of Kalakaua Blvd in the heart of Waikiki. Sandy beaches are a few blocks’s walk away…that is, if you don’t get sidetracked by the surrounding shops, restaurants, bars, and such. Stay focused and enjoy your stay in Waikiki. The resort offers valet parking at a cost. But are several several alternative parking lots and garages nearby for a reasonable price. Highly recommended. I’ve stayed in many of the hotels in Waikiki over the years and this is clearly the best for the money.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel location is the best. Easy to do everything in waikiki. The hotel is quite new and the room and all facilities are very nice. We enjoyed a lot having a spa pool after a day of activities. The view from the roof pool/spa is also awesome.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hokulani Waikiki has a good location. There are some shopping center, restaurant and coffee shop. And there are excellent staff, quick response and action. We had no trouble on our vacation. Room is very clean and modern style. We can live by using smart and casual goods, it's cool !

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My husband and I went here. We really enjoyed the hotel. It is right in a strip of restaurants and little shops and very close to the beach. There is lots of action at night around here and the rooms are spacious and clean with their own balconies. There is a two element burner, microwave, fridge, freezer and sink. The rooms has a pull out couch and the washroom was huge. The elevators ask you to punch the floor number in on the outside and use your key. I like that feature although I noticed other reviews some people were troubled by it. Concierge was very helpful and I did the yoga they offered two mornings a week.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is so good location to go anywhere by foot or by Torolley for shopping and sight seeing, also very closed to the beach. I strongly recommend to choose this hotel not only solo but friend, family and couples.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at this Hilton vacation hotel which had easy in and out valet parking, in room kitchen with stove fridge freezer and dishwasher. We swung by Costco our second day and stocked up on essentials so we could make most of our meals. The front desk staff and concierge were all fantastic and we would go back in a second.Great way to spend Christmas

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hokulani by Hilton hotel is about half a mile from the other Hiltons in the "Village" complex. It seems to be completely soundproof, and has model accommodation with 1 bedroom suites. The bathrooms and the kitchenette are beautifully designed and maintained. I have no hesitation in recommending the Hokulani to the traveller who likes to sleep in a quiet room, even in Waikiki. The location of the hotel is also very convenient, in that it is on the intersection of Kalakaua Ave, the main drag, and Lewers St. There are restaurants and snack shops all around it, with PF Chang's and two Italian restaurants within a couple of minutes walking distance. The best rooms are on the floors above No. 12, none of which were available during my visit. From there, as from the rooftop swimming pool, there are good views of Waikiki Beach and Diamond Head.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is one of if not the nicest resorts in Honolulu. This trip was for my wife and teenage child and is was comfortable for all of us and providing entertainment and shopping from the minute you stepped outside of the building. Minutes to the beach. I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

If you don't like heights, you cannot use them. I expected that for $30/day we would be able to use the resort accommodations at the nearby Hilton Hawaiian Village and was super disappointed at these sub-standard resort features.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Fantastic all suite hotel in the center of Waikiki. Loved the property, beautiful rooms with kitchenette and huge bathrooms. Very spacious, modern furnishings. Great location, walking distance to best restaurants and shopping. Very friendly staff and accommodating. The only thing that could improve is the service in the rooftop bar. I realize this is a timeshare property, but a little service could go a long way. If offered, I'm sure many more drinks would have been bought. Also, it's only open from 2 pm, and closed on Tuesdays and Thursday's. The rooftop cabanas are fantastic, so much so that we never even felt the need to venture to the beach. The pool is just fine for adults wanting to cool off, not so much for kids wanting to play. Too many kids made it difficult to use the pool and hot tub. However, it was Christmas week so many families were there. I'm sure it's quieter other times of the year.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations

However one area that I think is a bit excessive parking charges for features on the rental car.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Went on a girl's trip for a wedding in April and stayed here by having purchased a timeshare presentation. So worth the purchase! The hotel lobby staff, very friendly and helpful. Due to time zone difference, it was nice to go work out at 4am or be in the media center undisturbed. Hotel room was large and perfect. Pullout couch a bit bumpy but king bed was fantastic. The bathroom was the best part of the room!! Separate large tub from huge free-standing shower, with a separate WC (you have to try the bidet settings on the toilet!!). It was easy for 3 friends to all use the bathroom at the same time. Elevator to either shop level or street level. Not one complaint i'd have of this place. I would love to stay here again!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hokulani is in one of the best locations along the main promenade. It is a modern hotel with the convenience of home amenities such as a kitchen. It is close to the beach as well. Great value. We traveled as two couples and really enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Looking forward to our second trip here next week. Staying for the week before Christmas, going to Maui for a week and then returning for another week at the Hokulani. We are owners and came last January when the Hokulani was ending its first year. Read everyone's reviews here to see how it has been doing. Morning yoga on the roof is a great idea for that outdoor space. The roof is magical at night, with a great view of the lights of Waikiki - you can soak in the jacuzzi and see the view. Hoping to find that the high end bathrooms now have more than one towel rack now, one of the suggestions we made in writing to the manager last time. With no daily maid service or linen change, just twice a week per the usual timeshare routine, it is important to be able to hang beach, bath towels and hand laundry to dry. Whoever designed these elegant, Japanese style rooms (which we love) without any way to do that got that part wrong.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Fantastic location on the corner of Kalakaua and Lewers for this boutique style Hilton timeshare. You're just steps away in the mecca of grand scale shopping of well known brand named retailers to high end designers. The 1 bedroom accomodations are beautifully equipped with a small frig, 2 burner stove top, and microwave. The coffee maker is a disappointment as it only use Tassimo pods. A few pods are provided, but, costly to purchase. A regular coffee maker would be a better option especially shops like the ABC stores promote the Hawaiian coffees.The bathroom is beautifully appointed with a tv screen built into the mirror across from the free standing tub. What luxury!Self service laundry is located on each floor.Lap pool and hot tub on the 16th with partial view of Waikiki Beach. Cabanas free on availability. Every Monday, a happy hour for guests with music on pool deck.Staff are friendly, helpful. This is a great hotel.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Location of hotel could not be better. Many shops and restaurants nearby and a five minute walk to the beach. Facility and staff were excellent with very good security. Roof top pool for doing laps only but, a great place to sun bath with great views. ( Of the city)

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a fantastic small (for Hilton) hotel, Japanese-style and design, great use of space, clean, convenient location, and the most friendly staff anywhere. Right in the center of Waikiki and walking distance to beach, shopping, restaurants, and bars. Will return ASAP.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Our week at Waikiki was great at the Hokalani.  Our front deck lady Yoko was fantastic and went out of her way to help the whole week.  Bran was also very good to us. Yoko and bran were both easy to understand. ‎   The concierge desk was OK,but I think it would have been  better if we were Japanese. Most of the people working and staying at the Hokalani  were Japanese. ‎  We got a bit spoiled last April  with our last concierge at the Kalia tower at the Hilton village. Our conceige Chris  was amazing. Probably sets the standard for his type of job.   I think most Japanese were there shopping for Christmas from what we heard.‎ Had some rain every day, but still warm an comfortable. Used the bus system this time. Worked out great, drivers were more then happy to help how to get to the right place. Cost $2.50 to get to your stop, and the last transfer last for 3 hours. Or it will cost you $2.50 again. The is also a 4 day pass for $35. Or month long for $60. We still managed to do a lot of walking with all the shops and restaurants around us. If you venture  out for food,get to "uncle Bo's " restaurant. It's a favorite of the locals, and with good reason. Another one we enjoyed,  if you like Chinese food is "Fook Yuen ". Best Chinese food I've every had. Chat up the locals, they know the best places to eat.  Usually half the cost of the tourist trap places. ‎ Did the diamond head walk, big wave Dave canoe experience and bunch other things. Some of the tour prices have gone up quite a bit since our last time in oahu a year ago.‎   If you are looking for shopping and restaurants, or just being in the hub of the action. The Hokalani and it's staff will fit the bill.‎

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The location and quality of accommodations are fantastic. Walking distance to shops, restaurant, beach, and public transportation. For vacation of business this is a great place to enjoy Waikiki Beach

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel is located at the center of Waikiki and perfect in terms of facility and services however because of the location parking fee is extremely high. I wouldn't probably stay this hotel as I prefer to have a car during my stay.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We spent a week in this hotel and definitely two staff members made a difference....#1 SUSAN who was very attentive to our needs upon arrival and during our stay and the STAR of our trip was a guy named BRIAN who the last day went above and beyond of what it is excellent customer service. He booked a taxi for us to the airport, checked on YELP for another taxi service, allowed us to use the facilities while the midnight flight was done and it was just such a pleasure to deal with him.The hotel is very clean, modern, has a great gym and it is in the most central place for restaurants and shopping, great people at the valet parking which costs $35 a day but worth it...this hotel is my number one while in Waikiki. Thank you management and staff for making my stay GREAT.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a wonderful property. Great location. Short walk to the Famous Waikiki beach. All the shops and restaurants are steps from the front door. Brand new remodel. Beautiful. Wonderful staff, they were there to help. Complimentary washer and dryer and soap were a blessing. ( one on each floor) Definitely would recommend.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I was searching for a room week of November 9th in Honolulu to find there were very few hotels available. There was a large convention in town. Hotel prices were sky high. As I booked a hotel via Orbitz this round, they could not confirm the booking. Hotel I was originally looking at had filled up while I placed my booking. However, an Orbitz reservationist called back and offered the Hokulani Waikiki for the same price. I was quite surprised at how luxurious this Hilton Grand Vacation hotel was. Real nice spacious suite that was likely going for double what I paid. Though located off busy streets (above main shopping streets), the suite was quiet to get a good nights sleep. Valet parking only ($35) and a mandatory resort surcharge ($30). (They get you coming or going with additional fees). If going to the beach, just a short walk down Lewers Street. Hotel surrounded by many great restaurants.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: this hotel is on waikiki beach walk where many shops and restaurants are. We can walk to royal hawaiian center just 30 seconds! In the room, there are very new facilities, especially in the bathroom. We were surprised that we can watch TV on mirror.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I will definitely stay at the Hokulani again. The accommodations were excellent and the staff were great, very friendly and extremely helpful. The location was great, close to the beach, shopping and lots of restaurants. I would highly recommend it.

Great View from room and roof top pool .Bar service person was excellent in all ways. ,small but very cozy pool, was able to stay at pool for 7 hours after checkout, due to late flight!!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Everything was very nice. I wish the rooftop bar was ever open. It would be nice to relax with a tropical cocktail. Rooftop Pool was clean and nice, just very small. Enough to get wet, close quarters with others, weird mid-pool divider... but otherwise very nice.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: A great first impression: great service upon check in and an awesome room. Staff were super friendly and helpful. Very modern and clean, with excellent facilities.We stayed here for our last night in Honolulu and loved how it was near to all the shops and restaurants. The room was so lovely we didn't want to leave the room at all!Recommended if great facilities and a great room with great service matters more than ocean views with poorer service and older rooms!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I have owned with HGVC for years and I have found that with all the properties I have stayed this has been the most Warm and at Home feel to date. Love the bathroom tub and sliding doors, thick curtains kept the light from waking me and I didn't mind at all about the none beach views. I will return for sure. Mahalo

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel is located approximately 5+ blocks from the beach and while promoting itself as a RESORT facility, it is not that. You will be charged a $30.00 per day fee RESORT FEE which is a cunning way of adding an unwarranted fee to your room. As an honor member this is an insult as they charge you for unlimited internet and water, things which are included in your Honors membership. The hotel is equipped with a 3M deep pool on the roof, a small exercise room, no parking other than valet and no where to off load your baggage if you are parking elsewhere. Valet parking is $32 per day. There is a snack bar in the lobby with a concentration on Japanese cuisine. Several restaurants are located on the block with the best value being the ABC store next to Denny's as a strip steak, potatoes and a vegetable is 10.00, This proves to be the best option for most travelers and is a mere 3 minute walk.The rooms are very nice and the hotel is very quiet and peaceful. Had it not been for the intentional deception calling the property a resort facility, I would have rated it much higher. Unfortunately management is bent on deception and not caring for loyalty.Room views may be disappointing as you will not see the beach from this location.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed here for a couple of nights. Hotel is in the middle of Waikiki beaches and shopping centers. Car was is valet parking. Suite is spacious and full with luxe stuff you do not recognize easily. Like sliding doors, TV in mirror of bathroom (!), and even going to the bathroom at night a very soft light pops up - enough to see were to walk but soft enough not to irritate. Highly recommended. (A bit expensive)

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hotel is located in Waikiki. very close to Duty Free shop and any other Brand shop beside of Kalakaua Ave. Hotel is fully renovated, all facilitiies is new and modern. Kitchen has enough space, but washing machine is not in your room, have to go other floor. My two years old kid is enjoyed playing at pool. probably good to stay a couple of days for mainly shopping.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hokulani is a great place to stay in Honolulu. It is a quick one block walk to the beach and is right in the middle of fabulous shopping. The staff is very attentive and will take care of anything you request. Because it is a smaller hotel, you feel as if you are the only guest staying there, very quite and friendly.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Kind staffs, Clean rooms, I enjoyed during my stay. But only one disappointment is washing machines. It is placed not in each room but each floor. So I must repeat to go to the laundry space until finding vacant washing machine.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Enjoyed this small boutique hotel in the middle of all the Waikiki action. The rooms are smaller than typical timeshare rooms but very well equipped. In fact, we very much enjoyed the technological touches this hotel provides (TV embedded on bathroom mirror, Japanese toilets, etc.) The plunge pool is very tiny but my daughter enjoyed it nonetheless. There are plenty of loungers and chairs at the pool deck and free use of cabanas with TV, fridge, safe and couch. The bar (and the downstairs restaurant) had spotty hours though. I could never figure out when they were open. They offered a free yoga class one morning and that was nice.The best part is, of course, the location. It was a nice contrast to a more laid-back setting after spending a week at Kauai. Lots of eating options nearby. Will not hesitate to return to this property and recommend to friends as well.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This experience greatly exceeded all of our expectations. Celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary. HGV really knows the meaning of hospitality!!! Resort staff were very helpful and extremely courteous. The resort is completely breath taking and is equipped with the latest technology.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The facility and staff were excellent. The building was very clean and up to date, and the staff was professional and courteous. The location of the building was within walking distance to the shopping, restaurants, and beaches.The pool area was quiet and a great place to relax. The complimentary cabana's were wonderful and a beautiful place to have a snack, enjoy a glass of wine or just relax.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great stay if you are in Waikiki. Loved the modern style of suite and utility of kitchen and suite set-up. Very modern and fresh. Nice to have a bit of extra room to relax and eat a snack. Location was excellent - great location to walk the Waikiki strip, get a late dinner or just go next door to Cheeseburger (Boardwalk). We had a great stay and would stay again when we go to Oahu. Lots of fun. Service was extremely professional and available.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Agree with most other positive comments here. Central location and modern stylish comfort.Thoughtful TV in the bathroom mirror. I was lucky to be chauffeured by someone else's car so didn't struggle with the valet. Coffee machine a nice touch but charge for capsules after you use up a couple of complimentary ones.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights and even though the hotel room is spacious, bathroom brilliant the staff knowledge and willingness to assist was average. Don't get a room on the corner of the hotel. Very noisy from traffic below and restaurants across the road.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great service, good rooms. Nice modern features. Needs to have a pool and is not in front of the ocean, wish is 300 yds. away. All the shopping and restauranting that you will ever need, but still missing those key ingredients. Nice features in the rooms. Had to manipulate (should not have been necessary) in order to get a room with a better view.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you have small kids and are looking for a big pool and kids club, this hotel is NOT for you. We love this hotel for its modern design and its proximity to surf locations on Waikiki and the mall. We traveled with two 15 year old boys and the location was perfect for them to walk on their own to surf rentals and surf a non-rocky beach. With the mall across the street, they could run to the food court whenever they were hungry. My husband and I also enjoy the location because it is so close to the nightlife and many great restaurants. If you like the hustle and bustle of being in the city, this location is for you. If you are looking for more seclusion and resort style amenities (big pool, kids club, everything you need on one site), then you'll be better off at the Hilton Hawaiian Villages.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at Hokulani because of its location and our previous good experiences at Hilton Grand vacation properties. This one lived up to all expectations, with helpful, friendly staff and great facilities. The rooms, especially the bathrooms, are fantastically comfortable. It is also only a short walk to the shopping district, a host of restaurants and beach. Only issue was the air conditioning, which was a little loud and uneven.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Do not wait　ｇreat elevator and very safety. There is a Wash machine in the restroom. Hotel staffs speak Japanese very well. Going on the roof of the pool and feel the Hawaiian breeze .I slept in a nice bed.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hotel was great and had no complaints. I would not stay at any other hotel in Hawaii. The staff was excellent and tended to my wife and I needs. The room was very high tech and blew us away on arrival. The soaking tub with the waterfall faucet was a very nice feature.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We had a wonderful experience at the hotel for our family vacation. The room (1 bedroom suite) was very comfortable and seemed brand new. The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. The pool/Jacuzzi area on the roof was beautiful with incredible 16th story views of the ocean and Honolulu cityscape. The cabanas in the pool area (equipped with a refrigerator, a flat screen TV, and a safe) were like an extension of our room. The only minor downside is that the rooftop pool is quite small and shallow, not sufficiently large to permit lap swimming. Of course, the ocean off Waikiki is only a 10 minute walk away and affords plenty of swimming opportunity. Outstanding property and staff.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is perfect for anyone! There are so many activities, restaurants, and of course the beach! Yet it is quiet and private. Tremendous staff! I would highly recommend. The restaurants were my favorite.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We thought that this hotel was excellent overall, loved the high tech finishes and gorgeous cabana. However, the pool was too small and quite disappointing. We had to make other arrangements and go elsewhere for water activities.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I absolutely loved this place!It is located right smack dab in the middle of everything .Transportation , shopping, restaurants and even spas for the massage minded of us.It is almost hidden from the public. Off of the street. Yet the rooms are phenomenally constructed to fulfill all of your lounging needs.The corner rooms overlook the streets and the other Hotels in the area and this alone is a beautiful sight to behold.You are not on the beach, however it does not take a tremendous effort to get there.The amenities in the Hokulani are nice for its patrons.There is no need for a large pool so why have one where you don't need it.That room could be better spread out and used as living space. As I explained before, everything you could want is in the immediate vicinity .I'm looking forward to my return to Honolulu for the distinct pleasure of staying here again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: While not immediately on the beach it is but a 90 second stroll to get to Waikiki and Gray's Beach. The hotel is very modern and the accommodations are excellent. Staff are exceedingly friendly and helpful. The rooftop pool is not large but feature a number of private cabanas with very comfortable seating. Great views.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We started our 31st anniversary holiday with 6 nights at the Hokulani Waikiki and it truly set the tone for an amazing time in Hawaii.From the moment we arrived the staff where courteous and bent over backwards by assisting us with an early check in.The amenities and the quality of the room have yet to be beaten by any where else that we have stayed.With the hotel being on the newly redeveloped Lewers Street and only a couple of minutes walk to the beach it is centrally positioned to some absolutely amazing restaurants.I cannot speak highly enough of the friendly staff and would recommend it to anyone.Bear in mind that it is situated in the middle of time share ally and be prepared for the sales pitch, but when you get past that it is an amazing place to call home for a few nights.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you would like a Pool this is not the place. The extremely small so called pool is useless. Would not be an issue if you had access to the pools at the Hawaiian Village just a few blocks away, but you do NOT. The Hot tube is fine but only one. The pool area not the pool is the best part. There are covered semi-private areas with a TV/DVD table and seating. These are awesome and we enjoyed hanging out in the evening there and watching a show. One down side is they kick everyone out at 10pm. Should be open until at least midnight. You are on the roof in the city, not like you can disturb anyone. Bottom line if we had access to the village pools I would give the an excellent rating. If you do not need a pool then I would go for it. Great location. Also remember $35 a night for parking.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This Hotel is right in the center of the action. Close to everything! Shopping, beach and great restaurants! Staff is so friendly and VERY helpful. The rooms are so nice and the bed super comfortable.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The designer suites can't hide fact that space is a premium, and staying 3 nights or more will be a mistake. It's just too cramped for a young family of four. Adjust your expectations about a Hawaiian family vacation, as this Hilton Grand Vacations property aims for chic and urban contemporary. No welcome lei here. And if you can get passed this, sure you can enjoy everything on Kalakaua Avenue and Lewers Street. We had a partial ocean view in the distance, but the lanai is too small to enjoy. WiFi was ok. The staff is friendly, and evenings on the rooftop is relaxing. Valet parking only, so look for the guys under an umbrella on Lewers Street. There are no visible Hokulani signs as you drive by. Ugh. But maybe I saw one high up, next to the Quicksilver sign. Maybe chic means hidden. Too many maybe's to enjoy. The lobby is on the second floor of the Beach Walk shopping complex.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It is the distinguished location that you can walk to go to anywhere.And the interior design is excellent,too.But a freezer did not function and hot water did not flow very much.I felt uneasy about cushions having been sweaty.I was disappointed.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It was very convinient place to enjoy Waikiki. Room was larger than I excepted, althought it was located the center of Waikiki. But bath is very unique. Water for bathtub came from ceilling! The sound of falling water may be loud.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent Hotel, much quieter than the Mega Resort. A great Hotel for the 40+ with Adult or late teen children. Off the Beach by only 2 blocks with an amazing small roof top pool. The roof top cabana has to be one of the best features ever experienced at a Hotel

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Website directions are wrong and there are no signs at this well hidden hotel in a busy area. Great location, but lots of small details are lacking. Free DVDs but no one can tell you how to operate the DVD player (x box). Clogged sinks and no cold water in bathroom sinks. No water pressure in sinks. Parking is $35 per day but valet team is excellent.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed for 8 nights in November 2014. I believe this facility opened January 2014. The parking lot is hard to find, I knew about it from reading someone's review. We arrived from another island early, but wasn't allowed to check in until 4pm, yet our bags and groceries were taken to our room 2 hours earlier. This 1 bedroom unit is small compared to its sister site at Hilton Hawaiian village on Oahu. The ceilings are low: I am 5'4" tall and I could touch the ceiling! Refrigerator too small, not full size as in their other properties. I accidentally spilled my water upon arrival on the wood floors, used paper towel to dry it up. I was thoroughly disgusted when I saw the filth on the paper towel! I thought, We waited for almost 4 hours for them to clean the room and it is apparent that housekeeping hadn't used a wet mop with soap and water on that floor probably since they opened! I wanted to go out and sit on the balcony....what balcony, my hubby and I could stand out there and that was about it, we couldn't hear each other talk, and we had a view of the stucco of the building next door. Believe me, we did hear the delivery trucks and the garbage pick up, and the men on these trucks yelling at each other! The ice machine in the freezer drawer didn't work so they had to bring us bags of ice ( and this place wasn't a year old yet! What about warranties on equipment). The best part of the room was the Bidet toilet! Seriously, they shoved too many rooms into this building. Our 1 bedroom was the size of a studio. And that small little pool, what a waste! I have been a HGVG timeshare owner for 14 years and have never been this dissatisfiedWith a facility, especially a new facility. I know I will never stay here again! It seems like they cater to the. Japanese.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location, beautiful hotel, spacious 1 bedroom plus room. Since it's brand-new, they didn't have a restaurant open. Very friendly staff in hotel. The bell desk and valet (only) parking was very good, too.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We find this hotel is very clean and well appointed, location is key for us as it is on the end of the main tourist stretch but still surrounded by plenty of bars, restaurants & retail shopping with the beach a short stroll. Being a member of the Grand Hilton Vacations Club also helps..The bus line pick up points are all nearby and are easy to access. We found that our room this trip was on the noisy side, next time I will book a room on the opposite side, that's my only slightly negative comment.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I love the Hilton Resorts. Always makes me feel like I'm in the rich and famous club!! I am already planning my vacation for next year because I know that the secret is out and guests are coming from all over the world.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Had a wonderful family staycation at this gorgeous hotel -- valet, reception, and room service staff were all wonderful -- our room was spacious and immaculately clean; we felt absolutely comfortable as if we were right at home!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Beautiful resort!! Prime location close to all the action in Waikiki. The staff was professional and provided excellent service. I have no complaints. Looking forward to our next visit to Oahu and staying here again.
