hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This Hilton Grand Vacations property is in an excellent location. You can walk to almost anything you wish to do. Shopping is all around the property and several good restaurants. Night life is also available. The beach is very good and scenery excellent. Parking is convenient and the lodging valet service is excellent, making it very easy. Rooms are a little small, but that is typical in downtown locations. Overall service and cleanliness is excellent.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I don't want to oversell this hotel, but it was the best hotel I've ever been to. I'm not going to add photos as the ones already shown reflect what it looks like. The rooms are not massive at all but somehow are very functional so the rooms feel bigger than they are. Every single item you need will be there, from kitchen ware, to microwave, to beach towels. There was nothing that I needed that wasn't provided.The bathroom was the best I've seen since Ceasar's Palace, rain shower, tub that fills from the ceiling, T.V. in the vanity mirror... not on or attached -- in.Top floor views are amazing, get a high floor on the corner to overlook the streets and see parts the ocean.The parking is pretty steep so be weary, we walked and took the bus everywhere. Don't let anyone sway you from the bus, it was like extremely cheap compared to the packages people try to sell you ($2.50 one way plus 4 hour transfer).For a shuttle look at Hawaii23.com I was able to get a $23 shuttle each way to and from the airport for me and my girlfriend. Not $23 for each of us but $23 collectively for the two of us each way.Absolutely loved the hotel, the friendly staff (Tony) and the overall vibe of the city.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at Hokulani because we could not get into one of the HGVC properties at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. We were pleasantly surprised by the wonderful, central location! Great dining and shops just steps away and only a short walk out to the beach. The rooms and décor were wonderful...and very high tech. We'd definitely stay again!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great newly built hotel excellent rooms we had a one bedroom suite. Plenty of space and the bathrooms had the best shower and tub of any hotels we have stayed in. The staff was excellent and the surrounding area around the hotel had every shop and restaurant that we needed Great time really enjoyed the stay

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I spend over 100-nights per year in hotels and find myself all too often a critic. I've also been to Honolulu many times before. After researching this property (we had purchased a 7-nt stay during a HGV tour) and seeing the exterior picture I was quite frankly worried but as soon as I saw the lobby I have to say it was all uphill. I loved this property and quite frankly would consider staying there as my top choice when back in Honolulu. Yes, the pool is not spectacular and its a few blocks to the beach but the room and staff more than made up for these shortcomings. The valet parking staff was always helpful & excellent customer service. While no one likes to pay $35/night to park I have to say in the end it was a bargain due to convenience. The front desk crew also deserves a call out as they were always eager to help and go beyond what I've experienced at other properties.What impressed us was the quality of the room's furnishings and size. Perfect for 2 and not a bother if your party is 4. This is one of the few places I've stayed that felt as if the designer actually understood the customer. Kitchenette was super convenient and efficient. The laundry facility on each floor was a big bonus.The walk to the beach--was again not the bother I'd stressed about prior to our arrival. It was very easy walk and with the ABC stores nearby every little need was within arm's reach. All the restaurants and shopping were equally easy and another surprise upon arrival. I highly recommend this property if you don't need an ocean front room.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Personaluse hotel.It is different space from another Waikiki Hotels. It is just MODERN CITY HOTEL. Next viviting Waikiki,I choose this again. Because of Hawaian Villege is too far from Waikiki. But only one bet room.For familyuse it is little small.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is fairly new and very modern in style. The people are super friendly, and the hotel is super clean. The pool and bar are located on the top floor with amazing views of the city/ocean. We had an awesome time and would gladly stay there again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is an outstanding property in the heart of Waikiki! The hotel staff is friendly and helpful! Concierge, bell staff in front and front desk were wonderful, friendly and helpful! Rooms are clean and spacious. A block off the sand, but in the heart of shopping and restaurants just outside your front door. Easy travel to the rest of the island, airport and other sights. Very useful rooftop lounge and wading pool for sunning.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are Hilton elite premier members and have stayed at all the HGVC buildings in Waikiki. This new resort is wonderful. It feels very like the 57th st resort in NYC, urban, clean and contemporary. We really really liked it. Importantly though its not really a family spot, its not near the beach, the pool on the roof is not a play pool. However, if you are a couple, looking for a spectacular, upmarket, quiet place to enjoy shopping and restaurants with a short walk to the beach you will not do better in Waikiki. My only concern (and this is just for HGVC owners) is that the open season is only 6 months in the future...

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you are willing to shell out extra money for a suite while staying in this area, I would recommend this unit. I only stayed for one night, but I would return. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was extremely nice. I felt spoiled with the large shower, separate soaking tub and fancy Japanese toilet. Both the bedroom and living areas were good-sized and the TVs were quite large. It was a great place to relax after my trip in from Sydney before traveling back to the mainland U.S. I chose it because I knew I'd be spending the entire day/night in my room and not exploring the area, as I had been here before but was only here on a stopover this trip. I also really appreciated the availability of free self-service laundry on each floor. The location is right in the heart of the Waikiki area, easy walk to shops, restaurants and the beach. I would take off half a star for the lack of a view of any kind from my unit (307) which overlooked a lower roof and a side of a building (with no windows so it was private). But honestly, a view isn't that important to me for one night, or even several if the price is right.The heating/AC was noticeably noisy, and ran constantly. But, I didn't mind the white noise and I always bring earplugs with me when traveling. Otherwise, the room was very quiet.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The entire staff was outstanding. Accommodations and location of this facility very good. I would have given an excellent rating but for the fact that this hotel does not have any kind of recycle program. All of the other HGVC establishments where I have stayed do, and one needs to be instituted here.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great property, perfect location, well-designed, very helpful and friendly staff. I will definitely return and spend more time at the property itself - this was a busy trip and I was unable to spend as much time as I had hoped at the hotel. I love the area of Waikiki that this property is located in. Great shopping, dining and vacation atmosphere. Valet parking was easy to deal with and staff was very accommodating. Only downside is poor connectivity to wi-fi from guest room.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: What a great deal of fun it was being in Hokulani Waikiki by HI on our recent trip to Honolulu! The environment of hotel made the occasion very special to us, and have our stay happy and comfortable. Thank you!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel house keeping and room itself is really nice. but for certain room, there is no view at all.. I was not lucky one.. and they told me i should pay more for better view.. But this is just marketing campaign rate, i didnt know there is such a bad view, if i know this at first, i didnt choose this hotel...

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Small boutique like hotel.People in the front desk are so nice and able to help you. Valet parking convenient and efficient. Rooms are so nice with a kitchenette sofa bed and a separate room with big bathroom. Nice gym and there is no really pool but you don't need it.Everything works perfect an efficient and you are so close to a lot of nice stores, one block from beach, nice restaurants for breakfast, lunch or dinner.I was not sure when I made my reservations but ones I was there I am sure was the best option. I went to other hotels with some friends and they were crazy check inns and crazy time in the valet parking plus in the hokulani rooms look like if there were new.I recommend 100% and congratulations to all the staff.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The location couldn't have been better, in the center of Waikiki and one block to the beach. Hotel room was very modern and clean but small for 1 BR with no view, in front of a building. The hotel staff is very impersonal and no helpful. The rooftop pool is cold and small with lots of children. We'll probably not stay here again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: good location of center of WaIkiki just mext to Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center. it's best for those who loves shopping, dine-out and night life. But as timeshare room, it's very small and can't fit more than 2 adults. Not suitable for family. small pool on rooftop, but it was closed when we stayed.If you have family with kids wo like to play at pool or beach, choose a property in HHV which has bigger suite and close to breach.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We were so impressed with the beautiful contemporary design and luxurious upscale nature of the facilty. Very roomy, clean, spacious, one bedroom suite with up to date latest technology, all natural wooden floors and doors. There is a rooftop bar, rooftop cabanas, hot tub and lap pool with great views of city of Honolulu. The spacious hotel lobby areas has pleanty of seating and extensive use of fountains especially effective with flames at night. The staff was exceptionally friendlly and helpful. The facility is in the heart of Waikiki steps from restaurants and upscale shopping, five minutes to the beach. The only downside was a hot tub with only luke warm water which is not what we usually expect. nd

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: By Hilton's time-share, we enjoyd Waikiki in the first time.In spite of the surprising pother in the town, it was very quiet in the room. Therefore we could spend the time which was slowly. We was satisfied in 99%

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I wasn't disappointed the first time nor was I this time. The team there makes you feel so at home. From the bell boys to the maids everyone is so friendly. Love the Asian inspired rooms so clean and relaxing.

Valley Center, United States

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We loved this spot! Location couldn't have been better! We loved being where the action is--overlooking the beautiful, upscale Beachwalk shopping and restaurant district on Lewers. We could easily walk a long block to the beach,and many restaurants in various price ranges were nearby. We liked going to Cheeseburger, Cheeseburger right outside the hotel door for excellent pancakes in the morning. Hardrock was on the next street over. Rooms are one bedroom suites. They were quiet, modern, beautifully redone recently, influenced by Japanese styling, even if they were a bit compact. Kitchenette had a microwave, small fridge, and two burner stove (no oven). But after all, this is Waikiki and no one expects a lot of space or to be spending much time in the room. Bathroom mirror had a tv in it (picture was fair, but we enjoyed it being high tech.) In addition to the walk-in shower, there is a soaker tub. Water fills from the ceiling, which looks cool but splashes all over the wall and floor. (Not impressed.) My husband and I shared one suite, two grown sons the other. We would all love to return to this wonderful location and this wonderful accommodation.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at this hotel because it was the only one available for open season as a club member. We stayed as a Staycation. Hotel room was very modern, TV in the bathroom was a hit with our children. Hotel room was a little too small for our family, we were trying to stay at the Hilton Hawn Village due to the beach/lagoon nearby, paddleboarding, etc however this location also worked because of the restaurants and shopping downstairs. The Jacuzzi was too tepid, not hot enough, the pool was small. This hotel is mostly for business and couples, not families with young children but then again, you don't spend too much time inside the hotel when all the exciting things to do is outdoors!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Located in the center of Waikiki and good to go around for meals, shopping etc. Beach is also close. Stayed in 1BR type which is big enough for 3 people, 2 adults and 1 kids. Room is relatively new and clean. Totally satisfied with the hotel.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I do not believe your could ask for better room for comfort. Big living and kitchenette area, large king size bed/bedroom, and very large bathroom with two closets etc. Quite, peaceful and secure! Completely nonsmoking .

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: An outstanding location and room! The parking staff, front desk, the general staff were excellent! We had to wait an exceptionally long time to meet with a concierge. There was only one concierge, a man. He met with a couple for over an hour and never acknowledged our presents. Finally, a female concierge came and said she'd been on break, and that know one notified her that we were waiting! The oriental concierge was excellent!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a timeshare property and as such is quite different from a hotel. There is cleaning once every 4 days, but shampoo, soap, conditioner, lotion, fresh towels are available if you ask. Before staying here, you need to be okay with this. Stayed 12 nights here and loved the location and the amenities in the room. The staff was so helpful and friendly. By the second day they knew me by name and when they did not see me for 2 days, they were concerned enough to see if I was okay (unfortunately had food poisoning). Cleaning personnel asked us each day in the hall if we needed anything.As others have mentioned this is more of a boutique timeshare than one such as the Hilton Hawaiian Village timeshares. There are only 1 bedroom suites. At first, I expected to have 2 friends join me, but was glad that only one decided to come with me. There were 2 beds in the bedroom as I had requested, but it would have been tight in space to have another adult on the sofa bed. It would take most of the space in the living room to open it and 3 using the bathroom would have required much more time to get ready in the mornings. The kitchen was also small with a microwave, 2 burners, ice machine (when it worked), very small refrigerator, toaster, rice maker, plates, silverware, dishwasher, and knife block. Since we did not plan to make meals it worked fine for us. The living room had a sofa, small table with 2 chairs, and a tv. Under the tv was a storage area that could be used for clothes. There was a closet with hangers. In the bedroom was a chest with 6 drawers. One of the drawers contained the safe. There was a closet in the bedroom with hangers. We were able to store our suitcases in the 2 closets.We were on the 10th floor and had a partial view of the ocean. The lanai was very small - no chairs on it so we did not use it.Since others have commented on the bathroom I will not review it except to say it is a very nice bathroom and I really liked the shower. The location is why I stayed here. So close to the trolley stops, restaurants, stores, and the beach. The ABC store is right next to the hotel on the lower level. It was handy to buy water, soda, and snacks and not have to carry them very far. It's surprising how much water weighs when you buy the larger containers and have to carry them for any distance.It's too bad that the small cafe closed inside the hotel. Would have been nice to be able to have a pastry in the morning there, but there are so many places very close that it was not that difficult to go out for breakfast. The Cheeseburger place had a breakfast special for $5.99 and many places within walking distance had breakfast for $3.99 and $4.99.My major disappointment was the pool. It really cannot be called a pool. It is very narrow and only 3 foot deep. It is split in the middle so you could not even swim a lap. It is fine for cooling off while sunning. We really enjoyed the pool area, especially the cabanas. We were able to use one every day. They had a couch, table and two chairs, a refrigerator, and tv. I was glad that no one used the tv's since that would have spoiled the atmosphere of the area. Hawaiian music was played. Water was available at the bar. On the days that the bar was open, prices were reasonable at $2 per coke and $9 per tropical drink. Happy Hour prices were about $7. Another positive was that the pool area was never crowded since only guests were able to access it. Security is very good with only those with a room key were able to use the elevators. Plus since the staff knew everyone, it would be difficult for anyone else to access the property.Would I stay here again? If an agreement was reached with the HHV to use their pools, I would definitely stay here again (there is such an agreement on the Big Island where people staying at Kingsland can use the pool at the Hilton Hotel). I really liked the staff so much more than at the HHV timeshares. They are much more customer service oriented. So for a trip where I want a nice pool and grounds - more of a resort, then this is not the place. Where I want convenience and customer service then this is a good match.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Right next to Hawaiian Shopping center, on street level bank and ABC store for orange juice to sunblock, conveniently located downstairs and next to the lobby, my husband found a very reasonably priced breakfast restaurant. Night view from roof top pool area was wonderful. I enjoyed the deep bath where hot water pours from ceiling.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Had wonderful time at this hotel site. Staff very friendly and helpful. Excellent location with easy access to shopping, and just one and a half block walk to the beach. Be aware that it is not easy to find the first time you look for it, but afterwards, it couldn't be easier to go in and out.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Wonderful technology. Televisions embedded into the bathroom mirrors, bathtub faucets cascading from the ceiling. A beautiful outdoor penthouse swimming pool with a view of the city and beach, but this hotel is not tailored for the English community. The cost for one night stay is $460 USA which does not include parking and they will not accommodate any late check out past noon or check-ins prior to 4:00 pm.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location for everything in Honolulu, right in the middle of everything! Close to Waikiki Beach, restaurants and shopping. Short trip to the airport. Great boutique hotel. Very quiet and intimate location.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights in February 2015, room1007. Excellent location in the heart of Waikiki about one block from the beach. Hotel is about 18 months old and is very nicely decorated. Close to shops, restaurants, buses, beach etc.Staff friendly and efficient, who also phoned to check on a few of our day trips. Porters were also very helpful with directions, taxis etc. Close to the Aloha Landing in the Sheraton Hotel where most tours leave from. Rooms were large, clean and comfortable, with a separate toilet. The best thing is that they have 2 washers and dryers on every floor free of charge and complimentary washing powder as well.Breakfast is not available at the hotel but there is a Starbucks across the road and the Cheeseburger restaurant which both serve breakfast. The is also an ABC store where you can pick up milk, snacks, clothing and souvenirs etc.Pool is not large but I loved the spa (nice and hot) and both are very clean and pool furniture is is great condition.Would thoroughly recommend this hotel for its location and the fact that is is new. Would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: super nice condo hotel - best location in all Waikiki If you are here on Vacation or business a must stay! Very slick and modern with the travelers in Mind. Try the roof top pool and Bar Lounge. The entire hotel staff is very freindly and very helpful with all your needs

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Pros: Location, room size (5+ stars by Honolulu standards), relatively new and contemporaryCons: Rooms cleaned and basic bath and bed linens/supplies replaced only weekly unless you call front desk. East Asian orientation of hotel staff highly inhibits the spirit of aloha.Very clean and modern hotel. Yes a 4 or maybe even 4 1/2 star property overall. This review will focus mainly on shortcomings and areas for potential improvement. Parking is pricey at ~$35/day valet, with no self-parking option. (I did not rent and park a car here for that reason, so I cannot comment on the valet service.) The property is in a location that is difficult to beat in terms of access to shopping and dining, but the views are lacking apart from a magnificent view down the length of Kalakaua Ave from the rooftop hot tub. The location is about a 5-10 minute walk from Waikiki Beach (accessible via the Sheraton or Royal Hawaiian hotels.) This is not a hotel that is meant to appeal to children, which worked wonderfully for me as it was just my wife and I visiting. For instance, the rooftop pool is 3 ft deep X 5 ft wide by 30 ft (my best-guess approximation) so it's not really a "play pool" shape or size. The rooms are large, modern, and of a high standard overall, including the kitchen and bathroom kit. The bath amenities were of a decent quality but very low quantity, especially considering that you must go out of your way to request additional soap, shampoo, etc directly from the staff. When did shampoo become such a pricey commodity that they can't give you a few ounces? The Gevalia coffee pod machine produced horrible, weak, American muddy water diner coffee that was not nearly strong or tasty enough for my liking, and I'm not really a coffee snob. The in-room safes accommodate a laptop and little more as they are shallow. My wife's purse is only a few inches thick and the safe's lid would barely shut.The staff are polite and courteous, yet a bit cold, especially by Hawaiian standards. They need to hire more locals and demonstrate some real aloha spirit rather than the generic form of hospitality one could expect to find in any hotel of this standard. I made few requests which were mostly dealt with efficiently, though my check-in experience was akin to dealing with a robot regurgitating information and would not truly hear my request. Again, more of a local touch would be sufficient to right this issue. To be fair, the vast majority of the clientele are Japanese so understandably the staff need to be bilingual/bi-cultural.To summarize, a great property overall and you will enjoy your stay as long as you book with an awareness of the above limitations affecting your stay.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I can't say enough about this property and highly recommend it. The location is great, middle of Waikiki. They staff knew me by name the whole stay and could not have been more accommodating. The rooms are beautiful, well supplied and clean. My THUMBS UP to Hilton Grand Vacations Club for this property. If you are looking to be on the beach though, this property is about a block from it.

Honolulu, United States

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The rooms here are very nice. The staff is great but don't stay here if you plan to sleep or relax. It's noisy all day and night long. The pool area is nice but there really is no pool to speak of its a water feature. It's great if you want to shop and party but no relaxing and enjoying the beauty of Hawaii.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: To begin, we are owners at HGVC, and we decided to leave HHV to try out their new property--Hokulani.Our group consisted of 3 adults and 1 toddler. We booked a 1 bedroom suite---meant to accommodate 4 adults. Here are our pros and cons:1. Room was simply too small and cramped for us. We were given a corner suite, but it was not very big. No place to really put out our suitcases. Kitchen was small--and, once you actually added food to the counter space, it became very close! We were always bumping into each other. Or, sitting on the floor as the sitting space became housing for suitcases and beach equipment.2. You had to access the bathroom through the master bedroom. Ok during the day, but difficult to walk through a quiet bedroom at night.3. The shower was really lovely. Rain shower and wand. But, unfortunately, it smelled of mildew Perhaps poor drainage.4. Bathtub, with water falling from above, was awesome. Very fun and novel.5. Separate toilet within the bathroom area. Nice.6. Poor view. We looked at a building and the road...we weren't expecting an ocean view, but our view tended to be a bit noisy and dull.7. Rooftop pool was great. Wonderful view. Nice hot tub. Good loungers. Plunge pool was fine for our child---and the other children that we saw using it.8. Elevator system was confusing at first, but once we got used to it, it worked well.9. Great location! Easy to get around on foot! Good bus access from Kuhio.10. Staff was pleasant and personable.11. The hot water tap in the kitchen made noise all night. Creaking and tapping. It consistently woke up the people sleeping on the sofa bed in the living room.12. When the cab driver and the bellman were loading our luggage into the taxi, their heavy swinging/packing broke a piece off of our suitcase!!!! We were NOT happy! And, both laughed about it! No apology! Not a pleasant way to end our stay at the Hokulani. Overall, the hotel was decent. We will probably not stay here again. It may be better for a different traveller.We decided, though, to cut our stay at Hokulani and to head back to the HHV. The Grand Waikikian has big, comfortable rooms (2 bedroom/2 bathroom), and an ocean view. We are enjoying our last few days overlooking the ocean!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Beautiful property in the midst of the best shopping in Waikiki. Contemporary furnishings provide everything you would want. Would suggest regular coffee pots instead of pods. Bar at pool closed two weekdays and other days doesn't open until 4pm which is too late.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Perfect location and perfect stay. As being someone who has traveled to numerous hotels this place Rocks!!!! The rooms are the best I have seen. The amenities are many. Two Big screen one small screen in the bathroom. Playstation, free DVD's and a toilet that keeps you cleaner than you thought could be possible. In recent reviews the pool on the roof appeared to be an issue. The pool and lounge area on the roof top ruled. Yes the pool resembles a lap pool but it really works. The staff!! The staff are so friendly and willing to make you feel like royalty. I can assure you of one thing I will return and I will Love it.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location...many places to eat right out the door. Awesome staff. Walking distance to the beach. Room technology very modern, newly renovated, very comfortable beds. Small only 4 1 bedroom units per floor, very quiet. free laundry facilities on every floor . Recommend for a couple or with small children.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very nice hotel one block from the beach. it is surrounded by restaurants - from high to middle end; shops and is just off luxury row. this is very high end shopping and awakens in the evening.. beach access is easy and convenient, a very short walk. this is a great bargain.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed here for a week in a 1 bedroom unit via an RCI exchange.This property has an excellent location, at the corner of Kalakaua and Lewers, in the heart of the action, and as a result can be noisy through the night with the nearby nightclubs.The suites are new, with contemporary and modern design to them. The 1 bedroom unit was well laid out, with spacious bathroom, sleeping area separated from living area by sliding doors, and a small balcony. There was a kitchenette, with supply of dishes and cutlery, and small appliances including ice-maker. Storage, in particular, drawer space for clothing, was a little tight. Washer and dryer were available near the elevators.Roof top pool and patio were superb, with awesome views of Waikiki, the ocean, and inland to the mountains. There were cabanas with TVs, and lounge chairs and umbrellas, but the pool was only of limited size. There is a bar there, but drinks were on the expensive side, even at happy hour.The property has excellent security, including elevators that require your room key to gain access. Staff were very accommodating to our needs, and customer service was excellent.Check out Bills Sydney around the corner on Beach Walk, for excellent cappuccinos and baking in the morning, and meals served upstairs.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This property deviates from the standard Hilton Hawaiian experience moving to this location at the North end of famous Waikiki Beach Walk. This is the entertainment, shopping, and dining district, just a brief walk from the famed beaches of Waikiki. This high rise opened as a Hilton brand while we were visiting Honolulu in December of 2013. This unique property also features Na Lani Sky Lounge – an exclusive rooftop deck with pool lounge with private cabanas and vast views of Waikiki. The rooms were a little smaller than typical HGVC, but are well appointed. No need to worry about security, the high tech elevator system takes a little time to master, but is only available to residents and staff.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This in no way feels like a resort the way the Hilton Hawaiian Village or the Sheraton does, but it's a nice hotel. You are centrally located to all of the best shopping and close to the beach. None of our tours picked up from the hotel, but the Sheraton is a 2 minute walk away and we were always picked up there. The staff is very helpful and friendly, the rooms are nice. The pool is not a real pool, it's only about 3 feet deep I think, which was a disappointment for us but not a total loss. Overall, definitely one of the better stays I've had at a Hilton lately.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: After two weeks in the excellent Grand Waikikian in the Hilton Hawaiian Village with our children, their spouses and our grandchildren, my wife and I decided to try the Hokulani one-bedroom apartments we had seen it being built on our last visit to Honolulu. If you are expecting all the trappings of a traditional resort then you are better off at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. However, if you want to be in the heart of all the action - shopping, restaurants, bars and the like - and are willing to walk 5 or 6 minutes to the beach then you should try the Hokulani. Likewise if you prefer to lie by the pool working on your tan, then the Hokulani rooftop "dipping" pool might be the go for you. The apartments are comfortably furnished with a modern decor and have rooms with generous proportions. They also feature modern technology such as a television screen built into the bathroom mirror and conveniently located charging plugs for iPads and iPhones.We were on the Lewers Street side of the building on the 15th floor and had expansive views over Waikiki including the beach and Diamond Head. The staff were all very professional, friendly and helpful. We had no complaints whatsoever and would happily return.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Cant speak more highly of the Hokulani. We stayed here for our Honeymoon in August 2014 and it was amazing. All the staff were so wonderful and helpful, location was great and the rooms were so nicely decorated, morden, fresh and clean. The pool is small and fills up fast but I knew this prior to arriving and the beach is only a 5 minute walk. Cannot fault this hotel! Looking forward to coming back in 2015.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We did our research beforehand so we knew the hotel had no restaurant, had a $35 valet fee and a somewhat full kitchen, we didn't get a car for the first 3 days and just went on excursions which picked you up from the hotel or bus station opposite, a car was not necessary for the entire time, We took a bus for $2.50 to the airport and picked up a car for our last 2 days, this also meant we had a ride back to the airport for our flight! We had no intention of cooking in the hotel more grabbing a quick breakfast before heading out for the day. It was the Christmas holiday period so you expect it to be a bit pricey but it was pretty steep at over $500 a night, but the hotel is in a great location, plenty of restaurants nearby and a few minutes walk to the beach. We asked to be moved to a higher floor on day 2 as our view was rubbish, they took care of it straight away, floor 8 was a lot better. Clean and new accommodation with a separate living space with a sofa bed for our teenage son, and a playstation. He loved it. View from the pool area on the roof is fantastic, there was always an available sun lounger and the pool is just for a dip, not a swim - the cabanas are first come first serve and they are perfect for a snooze, they even have a flat screen tv and fridge. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, there is a Starbucks over the road but coffee pods/machine in the room, the laundry room on each floor is free to use. I left with a suitcase full of clean clothes. Nice. Be under no illusion, Waikiki is expensive - stay a few days and get out of town to the more beautiful (and cheaper) rural areas.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Complete dissappointment, basically a disgrace to the Hilton Resort name. Had minimal ammenities for a basic hotel but NOT by any standards a resort! Without warning we were told there is a $35 per day charge for parking, $10 -$15 higher per day than any other garage in the area. Not sure about you but we didnt plan on an extra $280 cash for the week to park a car. After our first 4 in-room coffee cups we were told we had to pay $1.00 per cup after that! Yes the below average in room coffee that is free everywhere you stay they had nerve enough to charge for. Awful fitness room, subpar for a cheap hotel let alone a Hilton resort. We were told we had a full kitchen but found that there was NO oven during check in, unfortunatley, already went grocery shopping for the week. I could go on but I'm sure you get the idea. Alot of little problems that built up to disappoint with NO resolve just excuses.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This place is the best - service was wonderful the staff couldn't do enough for you. Very central to everything in Waikiki, food, entertainment, beach. The bar and pool area was wonderful - private cabanas at no extra cost. Can't wait to return.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is one of HGVC's newest resorts in Waikiki. It's so nicely decorated, and comfortable. The location is very convenient as it is walking distance to shops, restaurants, beach, and everything else. No restaurant on site but you don't really need one since it's so close to all of the shops. The bathroom is awesome with the water spouting out of the ceiling. Laundry is not inside the room but conveniently located near the elevator of each floor. The rooftop dipping pool was a little cold, but the jacuzzi and cabanas were great. I would definitely stay here again. The only complaint I have is that the street noise from the people partying downstairs could be heard from our room on the 4th floor. Otherwise it was a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was my first visit to Hukalani. I was really wanting to stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, however, there was no availability. I was pleasantly surprised and satisfied with this property. As a brand new hotel, it was up-to-date with all modern technology and amenities, including elevators controlled by room key cards and a tv in bathroom mirror. The location was totally convenient, just off the main drag of Kalakaua. Tons of bars, restaurants and shopping are steps away and the beach was about two blocks away. The room I stayed in was a double suite. It was spacious enough for two people, but a third may fit comfortably as the couch turns into a bed. In addition to the aforementioned tv in the bathroom mirror, there was a 42-inch screen in the bedroom and another in the living room as well. The sliding door was practically an entire wall, which was nice allowing the ocean breeze in the room. Although small, the refrigerator and freezer held enough food for the week in an otherwise fully supplied kitchen. We rented a car from the airport (Hertz allowed in-town returns at no charge) and stopped at a Safeway (Kroger/Von's) to pick up drinks and snacks. There was not a washing and drying machine in the room, but each floor has two each that are free to use; the downside was the night before checkout all were in use; we had to go up a few floors before we were able to find vacant machines. The wood floors and bright light throughout were a nice change from carpeted and dimly lit rooms from a traditional hotel. The pool is on the roof and is a joke. I was told it's not a swimming pool, but rather a dipping pool. There's a hot tub too, which was equally small. The coolest thing about the roof were the free cabanas (first come first served) which feature comfortable chairs and couches and had a 42-inch tv plus storage and a safe too. A full-service bar is located up there too. Whenever I went to check it all out, regardless of time, no one was really up there, which was shame because it really was nice and peaceful up there. I'd suggest this property for couples or single friends. I would not suggest kids; it's too metropolitan (a high rise in the middle of town with no pool, beach or in-room laundry). Families should go to the much more kid friendly Hilton Hawaiian Village, which is only a few minutes away. Other relatives were also visiting, but stayed at another timeshare and were totally envious of our modern and spacious room and said multiple times they wished they were staying at Hukalani. As much as I love the Hilton Hawaiian Village, if I have to stay at Hukalani for whatever reason, that would be fine by me.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Only 1 block from the beach the pool is not very big but is fine to cool off. There is no restaurant at the hotel but as soon as you walk outside they are everywhere. One block from the beach. The premium room has full kitchen and a laundry on the floor which you do not pay for. We usually stay at embassy suites but this seems old this will be the hotel we stay at from now on. You can organize a cab to the airport it is $29 use + tip. Works out same as shuttle. On a Monday they have managers drinks which you get 2 drinks and the have food. this hotel is very Japanese inspired which is nice and the people are nice.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: New HGVC property. Lots of new features from electronics to the Toilet seat. The one bedroom unit was very comfortable and well furnished. Total of three TVs including one embedded in the mirror in the bathroom. Thoroughly enjoyed the rain shower and spacious stall. However, the property is a little short on the bathroom amenities. Also, they only replenished the coffee disks once during our stay of nine nights. You have to purchase a set of eight if you need the caffeine. Property is within walking distance to Malls, Food Courts, Waikiki Beach and lots of shops and surrounded by ABC stores. I found the one on Lewer at Imperial Hotel, the best. Be prepared for the high cost of almost everything. The pool on the 16th floor is very small. More of a lap pool.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I couldn't rave on about this hotel more! We stayed at this hotel because of the great reviews and for the fact that it wasn't a big chain hotel . It was a gorgeous & peaceful hotel! The service was amazing! They clean your hotel room EVERY day so you always feel clean and you don't feel like your in a 'hotel' . I loved the roof top pool it's exactly what you need for an adult holiday yes there were a few kids which is totally fine but I'd prefer that then to the big hotels where you have about 100 kids and family's screaming everywhere! The location is 2 min walk to the beach you can see the sea/beach from the rooftop! You are surrounded by shops and restaurants so perfect ! Across the road is Starbucks :) so every morning I would wake up grab a coffee and head to the roof top for some relaxation! Great restaurants surrounding this hotel . I recommend PF changs (Asian) , aroncino on beach walk (Italian) and for breakfast I highly recommend going to heavenly! We did a tour around the island that was so worth it and a good day out! One last advice if you're buying souvenirs for family etc go to Walmart as it is so much cheaper there and you can get all things from keyings - tshirts! Also if your in a group I would taxi it to alo Moana shopping centre because the 'pink trolley ' takes forever and the cab gets you there in 10mins for around $10 ! Stay at this hotel if you want 5 star service and luxury at a decent price!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: When we arrived, valet parking was a little bit awkward because they are at an ordinary street and entrance to the hotel was on a second floor, we have to use the escalator. When we enter our room, it was a WOW feeling. Dark floor, kitchenette has everything! including rice cooker (if you need one). Bathroom is big, has shower and tub and TV, but my favorite is the commode with the toilet seat warmer. If you bring wet stuff from the beach, you can dry it in the dryer for free. I'm glad we're staying there for 5 nights. Service was great from the front desk, valet and bell boys. Location is great too! This will be our hotel in Waikiki from now on!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My wife and I found the Hokulani to be a little gem in paradise......just a little overpriced(in our opinion) Having said that.....we were impressed with the rooms and comfort level of this hotel....I guess being new has it's advantages! On all levels we enjoyed our stay. We did however have a mix up with the booking......our 3 night stay through booking .com included breakfast-only to find out on arrival the hotel does not offer a breakfast menu......confusion reigns! we ended up at "Cheeseburgers" next door and enjoyed a nice brekkie there......kept receipts and booking.com will reimberse.....too easy!If you can afford it-stay! you won't be dissappointed!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Chose this hotel because the Hilton Hawaiian Village (HHV) was not available. I am very happy that I stayed here instead of the HHV. This is a new Hilton property that opened earlier this year. To start, the rooms are designed with dark woods, earth tone tile designs and stainless steel accents. Not your traditional tropical Hawaiian style decor, but this hotel seems to be geared more towards adults rather than families with children. Location is great--directly across the street from the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center and Starbucks, and only several hundred feet from Kalakaua Ave, the main street in Waikiki. The hotel has a small cafe that is open till 1 pm and has coffee and breakfast and sandwiches available. As you step out the lobby area, there is a shopping area with a few restaurants, bars, and souvenir/convenience store? Warning--there is no self parking available at this hotel, only valet parking which is $35/day.The hotel staff was friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. From the front desk, the concierge, bellman, valets, housekeeping--you name it, everyone was great to deal with! On checkout, I wasn't flying till late at night and everyone was so helpful. From the front desk staff who helped to store my bag while I was out during the day and later gave me access to the pool restrooms so I could change my clothes and clean up before heading to the airport, to the valet staff who had a taxi ready for me at my requested time. This staff was excellent in every way!Since this was a "girls only" vacation, I was appreciative of the fact that you need your hotel room key to gain access to the elevators. This made it a little inconvenient for friends who came to visit me--I had to go down to meet them in the lobby to bring them upstairs to the room, but this extra level of security made me and my friends feel safe.As mentioned in other reviews, this hotel has pool and bar located on the roof. The pool is a small lap pool with a hot tub located at one end. This is not really designed for a lot of kids to play in. There are cabanas with TV's available. Evenings were nice and cool, a good place to relax and enjoy a cool drink with our feet dipped in the pool while we planned the following days activities.This is not your typical Hilton timeshare--space is at a minimum here. There is no washer and dryer in the unit. Each floor has a laundry room with two washers and two dryers. We stayed at this hotel for a week and did several loads of laundry with no problem. The kitchen area is stylish but compact. We had a one bedroom unit with a small kitchen area, a two burner stove, small fridge, separate ice maker, and all the usual dishes, silverware, glassware, pots and pans and all the necessary utensils needed. The glassware was stored in a cool pull out cabinet that cleverly rolled out and displayed all the available items in a stainless rack, but when closed, stylishly hid the cabinet from view.The bathroom was the highlight for my roommates! Lol! It had a large double sink area with a large screen TV in the mirror. There was a large shower stall with a large rainfall shower head. It had a large oval designer tub with no faucet, only the hit and cold handles. We looked up and on the ceiling there was a shiny silver disk with a hole in it. We turned the cold water handle and sure enough, the water came down from the ceiling, into the tub in one long smooth stream. Since we don't see these kind of luxuries every day, we were fascinated :) And then there was the fancy commode, complete with toilet seat warmer and bidet! My friends said they wanted to live in the bathroom with all of these amenities!All in all, I would definitely stay at this hotel again! Over the years, between my friends and I, we have all stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village on previous trips, and we definitely enjoyed the intimacy and personal attention of the Hokulani experience much more than staying at the larger impersonal experience of the Hilton Hawaiian Village.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We were not supposed to be in Waikiki on our way home from the Big Island, but hurricane Iselle had a different plan. We ended up having to cut our visit short and head to Waikiki two days early. The staff at the HGV hotels were great. Our folks on the Big Island allowed us to stay until our departure time and the folks at the Hokulani Waikiki were able to fit us in with only the owners daily rate charged. When we got here by taxi we found the hotel reception is on the second floor, and the only notice is a small sign beside an arrivals desk on the sidewalk. If you are self driving look for it just after the turn on the right hand side. Great hotel, everything is first class and brand new. They looked after us and kept us all updated as the hurricane went by. There is a downside to timeshare ownership, but the Hilton Grand Vacations group is definitely is the top of the tops. Thanks again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We have family reunion trip to Hawaii. The location of the hotel is great, walking distance to beach, shopping and dining. The only drawback is the very small pool at the top of the building. It is crowded and impossible to swim. Not sure kids will have fun in there, either. We didn't even bring kids to the pool while we stay.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel was immaculate. I loved it. Centrally located, all the bells and whistles you could possibly want in a room. My kids loved it as well. The pool wasn't very big but was big enough for my 9 and 10 year old to really enjoy themselves. I wish we had more time. The staff there was first class and seemed to really enjoy what they do.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is in east of waikiki. So we can walk to waikiki beach a few minutes. And we can go shopping center easily.There are Royal shopping center and DFS in front of this hotel. And this area is safe location, so we can go restaurant or bar until mid-night.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very Clean and up to date rooms. My teenagers loved it! Family friendly. Close to restaurants and shopping. If you don't mind a little walk to the beach, this is for you.If you want beach side hotel try the other Hilton Waikiki Village Awesome hotel too! I love HGVC!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: In downtown Waikiki so shopping was easy within walking distance. -Close to good food and entertainment. -Small pool on top floor (called a plunge pool) that is only 3 ft deep. -$35 a day for valet parking. Valet services were great though as it is unlimited in/out and the guys had our car ready within 3 minutes every time. -Rooms do not have full kitchens an not much room for storage of foods that you bring in. -100% aimed at Asian customers but done with class. -Property was great but is intended for more adults than kids. -Overall, as usual, an excellent property with A+ services from all staff.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This property is clean, fresh and safe. Everyone is friendly and helpful no matter what your needs are. You are right in the middle of shopping and restaurants, and a quick walk to the beach. The suites are so nice you may never want to leave.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at this hotel on the last leg of our honeymoon. Having stayed in Hilton Waikiki beach for the first four days, the diference between the two hotels is pretty obvious the Hokulani is based on the timeshare system where emphasis is not based in my opinion on personal service to customers as i suppose you are left to your own devices. All in all a good hotel, though won't be staying here in the future as the resort facility is a bit inadequate.Pros:*Near shopping*Beach approximately 3minutes walk : If you know your bearing*Fully kitted kitchen, free movie rental, self service washing and drying facilities*Bathroom and toilet facility very modernCons:*Service not personal enough when compared to Doubletree or conventional hilton hotels*Can be quite noisy due to location of hotel*Check in / Check out time *Swimming pool laughable size*Hotel though right in the middle of Ala moana - is very difficult to locate as the signage is almost non existent.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very nice facility ,well located and accessible to all Waikiki amenities. Would stay there again. Staff was very accommodating but could not resolve the reservation issue that was made through Hilton Grand vacation club central reservations.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Location. The Hokulani Hilton is literally at the crossroads of the most significant shopping in Waikiki: Beachwalk (a nicely landscaped two level shopping arcade that extends about 200 meters to the path leading to Waikiki beach, hence the name), the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center, DFS Duty Free Mall and Luxury Row. At night, the area is festive, bright and celebratory. The lobby of the hotel is up the glass canopied escalator which is a part of the two level Beach Walk. One level above the busy intersection, the lobby is private and serene. An outdoor water landscape with waterfalls and torches at dusk and lounge area extends beyond the lobby. Just off the lobby is a nice "pick and go" cafe with an indoor/outdoor seating area that looks onto the busy intersection below. However, the selection of cold sandwiches is weak and it was iffy as to whether someone was staffing this area or not. Guests migrated over there for the complementary chilled lemon water. My guess is that the management still needs to figure out how best to use this facility. It's a pity cause this area is so nice and sorely underused. Previous review written in February 2014 said that they provided alcohol till 6PM. Did not see that on our week long stay. Seems to be part of the resort opening shake out. Agree with previous owner that a bar or a breakfast concept would be great here, too underused and desolate. The rooftop lounge is well done. The previous reviewer said that the cabanas were rented out at $200/day in February 2014, by the time we got here in July, the cabanas were free and well used. The sun deck has plush and comfortable chaises. But it was curious to me as to why there were no sun umbrellas. Again, the previous reviewer mentioned that there were staff to help set you up with towels and umbrellas. There were no staff or umbrellas on our visit. Guests were lying with their heads underneath the chaise tables for shade, a sad site. The plunge pool was good enough for what it was. We though it was unfortunate that the length of the pool which could've easily been design as a lap pool was literally divided into halves by a raised portion in the middle, very odd. We were sold on the property and became owners primarily because of the one bedroom suites. The interior design is well done with sleek modern appointment that still manages to be warm and luxurious. Kudos to the interior designer, well done. The bathroom is gorgeous. Take a look at the jaw dropping stand alone tub that doubles as sculpture. The water literally falls from the ceiling. Turn on the in mirror tv as you sit at the vanity - wow. The bedroom and living room furniture and appointment is elegant. We appreciated the ample closet space during our week long stay as we were able to properly put away our luggage. The living room has an electronics, mp3 and radio gadget which is a bit subpar to the overall high quality of the unit, very weak speakers. The unit has multiple outlets to recharge all your different phones which was appreciated. Nice to have though. The kitchen concept is "adult themed" rather than family friendly. We loved staying at the nearby Grand Waikikian because of its full kitchen which sometimes felt too large and a bit too suburban. The Hokulani managed to tame it a bit in a more sophisticated rendition of a kitchenette. However, our complaints are thus: 1. Fridge though pretty with the transparent front is too small. For families like us who stay for a week and cook a lot, a half fridge is a wee bit tight. 2. The stainless steel freezer broke during our stay. Also, because it is set into the bottom of the cabinetry, the drawers above were very warm from the freezer motor. It's nice to have an in suite ice maker, too bad ours did not work. Called the house engineers three times. 3. Rather than having a standard coffee maker, capsule coffee makers are provided. They give you 3 caf and 3 decaf. The rest you have to buy downstairs at the cafe. We could not find the appropriate capsules at the market.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed here for a week early July and at first was a bit hesitant of the location of not being right on the beach, but after entering the room and admiring the quality and inclusions it didn”t become an issue as we were only 5 minutes walk to any part of the beach. As its right in the middle of all the shopping centre and restaurants, it turned out the best location. We were on a high floor and wasn”t too noisy with the doors closed and AC cranking. Very quiet AC by the way. Bus terminal just across the road at the Sheraton.We had a kitchen with stove, sink, dishwasher, microwave, all fitted out nicely. Separate bedroom with 2 queen beds and still enough room to get around them. 2nd TV and adequate storage for 3 bags and a safe included. Bathroom had a deep bath and big shower with the rose coming from the ceiling, luxury fittings throughout. Even a TV in the mirror and a bidet on the toilet. The main living area had a comfy lounge and chair, Widescreen TV with PS3. There were even an array of phone charging cables to suit most phones. Outside our room was a laundry with 2 washers and 2 dryers, all brand new. Great free WiFi that didn’t drop out.Staff were very good and could book your tours or give good advice on the area.Great security with the elevators and even though there was only a plunge pool on the roof, there were private cabanas complete with, TV”s, refrigerators, lounges, a safe and shelving.Hilton has recently purchased this complex and spent a ton of money renovating with quality inclusions. For me, if staying on the beach with a water view isn”t your highest priority, then this place is for you. It met all my expectations of a great Hilton.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This place was nice! Very clean (new) and the staff was friendly. I can usually find something to complain about :o) but not with this place. I hope it stays kept up as well as it is now and that it doesn't become run down like many places do. Very modern and spacious rooms. Would most definitely recommend to others & would stay there again. Lobby is impressive and relaxing. Parking was $30 a day, which was a bummer, but they retrieved your car quickly each time and I assume most places will charge to park (or its built in the room charge, but either way you pay for it).

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This hotel is one of the best my family and I have stayed in. The location is perfect -- not too far away from the beach and everything else. Our room had a full kitchen -- stove, sink, dishwasher. The bathroom has a TV in the mirror and a bidet on the toilet. TV's in the bedroom and living room, and a PS3 (perfect for the kids).We didn't think much of the swimming pool at first. But after all the surfing and sunbathing we did on the beach and all over the island, it was really nice just being able to relax on the rooftop pool. Although it's a little small, the time we went up there was hardly anyone utilizing the facilities. There are good-sized cabanas available at a first-come-first-serve basis which each has a flat-screen TV, refrigerator, and a safe for your belongings.We would like to commend Castle and Yoko at the front desk who took extra special care of us, providing us with so much info about must-see places in the area. Unfortunately, we don't remember his name, but we'd also like to thank the guest services manager for his extraordinary service. Mahalo nui loa!!!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It was our first stay at the Hokurani Wikiki. I was surprised at kitchen there are many good facilities. And we were relieved, when we found a washret in the rest room. Location is good,we could use the trolley buses everyday. Security is good, especially I like those elevators. Those were pretty comfortable to use. Cleanliness is good. The saffs are very kind and speak Japanese very well. I was saved very much. We'd like to visit this hotel again. Especialy, "Welcome party on the roof"was great. Thank you.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I stayed in three people of the 2-year-old child and couple for five days. I arrived at the hotel at past 8:00 a.m. The check-in was 16:00, but I had you confirm whether I could check in when I heard a story towards a concierge (Japanese) and checked in immediately. I just arrived at Hawaii, and both child and I drew breath in the early thing that I was able to check in at in a room and bathed in a shower and I refreshed it and was able to go out. I really thank for this correspondence. I was able to spend the stay without inconvenience comfortably really.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It is the best location for shopping and access. Because there is some distance to the beach, I do not have any problem if it is the which goes to the beach several times while I stay. Because it is the service of the Hilton brand, I am reliable.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Location is specially good because of middle of waikiki. I usually use going to aramoana shopping center , food market,waikiki beach and waikiki street. Concierge wass very kindnes . I sometimes swich off the airconditioner in the room because it was too cold.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Let me start off by saying, I am a very picky person when it comes to hotels. This hotel exceeded my standards in everyway. It was super clean. I tried, but I could not find dirt anywhere. It was super modern. There was a TV in the bathroom mirror. Location was terrific. It was right in the middle of great restaurants, shopping, and very close to the beach. Free rental of current DVD. Yes, the pool was small, but it served its purpose. The free use of cabanas with a TV more than made up for this. Loved it, loved it, loved it. I would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It has great location just across Royal Hawaiian center which is a big shopping center. There are lots of things to enjoy. Kitchen was amazing. You can make anything you want. Staffs are very kind. I will visit again in the near future.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Opened only six months, this hotel is ultra modern and in the heart of Waikiki. The beach is an easy walk half a block away and you at the doorstep of what bustling Waikiki has to offer (shopping, restaurants, galleries, nite life).

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Extremely helpful staff. Parking is very expensive ($35/day) but typical for Honolulu. Room was well furnished and very comfortable. Location is very good for shopping and good restaurants. Hotel felt more like a boutique hotel, as opposed to many of the "big" ones.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Had a wonderful time and stay at the Hokulani. The front desk staff, Susan, as well as concierge services were fantastic. Everything was new and modern. The lobby has a very relaxing ambiance. My only complaint was the parking--valet and expensive. I ended up parking a mile away but got tired of walking everyday back and forth just to get the car for the family. I would have appreciated a discounted parking option for guests. It is also a bit noisy because it is located in a busy corridor. All in all, it met our expectations very well.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are Hilton timeshare owners. We stayed 4 nights at Grand Waikikian and 3 at Hokulani. The Hokulani is very modern. The pool was never busy and had free use of cabanas. The pool was a lap pool, but the kids in our group liked it. The lounges are padded and there is a nice bar. The view from the rooftop pool was amazing. It was great to stay at the Hokulani to get away from the busy Waikiki beach. I would not recommend staying there a whole week with kids, as it is less kid-oriented than the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The staff at Hokulani were excellent. The rooms make excellent use of space, especially the kitchen. The balconies are tiny, no room to enjoy the outside. Bathrooms are large. Bed was very comfortable.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Front desk,bell,coffee shop and concierge,All staff had very good feeling. There was only one disappointing thing,it is that the pool was small. I want you prepare the coffee only one cup of 1st during a stay if possible.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hokulani is a small boutique hotel recently added to the HGV family in Waikiki. It is NOT part of Hilton Hawaiian Village, so this is NOT close to Grand Waikikian, HGV Lagoon or Kalia tower and you can NOT use the super pools at HHV if you stay at Hokulani. We stayed 3 nights using HGV points. LOCATION: Centrally located in Waikiki on the corner of Lewers/Kalakaua above Quicksilver. It used to be the "Ohana Islander Waikiki" before it remained vacant for years prior to this remodel. You'll never find it unless you are looking for it from the street because there is no "store front", no signs, no awning, just an escalator behind a little wooden kiosk for the valet.VALET: $35/day. There is no self parking available. Again, there is no grand entrance, driveway, turnaround or signage. From Kalakaua, turn right onto Lewers, stay in the right lane and just after Quicksilver (and right at the bottom of the escalators) you will see the valet. Just stop in the right lane and back up traffic like everyone else. I thought it was very dangerous to be dropping kids off with luggage etc in the middle of the road.Once you've found the right place, there are escalators or elevators that can take you up to the lobby. If it's raining, take the elevators. The escalators get very slippery and my 6yr old slipped and fell backwards right as she tried to get on the escalator.LOBBY/AMBIANCE: modern and chic. This place is more for adults, not really families with children. There was only 1 guy checking people in and 1 concierge when we arrived. ROOMS: High tech but on the smaller side compared to HGV Lagoon or Grand Waikikian. Beds are comfy. The BATHROOM is the biggest and best selling point here. Toto toilets with rear and front cleansing shooters FTW! Magic TV in the bathroom mirror. Stand alone bathtub fills from the ceiling faucet (which will make a splashy mess when your kids try to touch it)! Waterfall shower in a separate stand alone huge shower stall that could fit at least 4 people! KITCHEN: Small. The kitchen is not a full kitchen like the ones in Grand Waikikian or Lagoon tower, or any of the other HGV properties we've seen. There was a mini fridge, 2 countertop burners, and microwave to do minimal cooking but no oven. There is an ice maker but this deserves it's own category.ICE MAKER: Loud. if you have sleepers on the living room sofa bed, turn off your ice maker, or it will make crashing sounds in the middle of the night which will scare the crap out of your deep slumber. SOFABED: Very uncomfortable to sleep on to begin with, turn that ice maker off or you'll be up all night. Our sliding door to the balcony DID NOT LOCK, which another reviewer also mentioned. I don't think anyone could come in from the balcony but I'm more worried about my kids going out on the balcony while I'm on the fabulous toilet.VIEW: No ocean view. This is not on the beach or even within view of the beach. If you have kids, it's a 8-10min walk past businesses and through another hotel to get to the beach. Kind of a big deal. If it's just adults, it's a quick 5min walk past shops and through a narrow public access (between Halekulani and Outrigger) to the beach. Not a big deal. POOL: it could be mistaken for a koi pond. The rooftop pool area has great cabanas with TVs and there are lots of lounge chairs to catch some rays but the pool itself is long and narrow like a lap pool.This place is absolutely fantastic if you want to be close to shopping, restaurants, and nightlife in Waikiki. However, if you are traveling with kids and want to play in the pool, go down water slides, rent paddle boards in the lagoon and come back to make your own lunch or dinner in your full kitchen, this is not the place for you. At this stage in my life, I'm always traveling with kids so for me, I'd rather stay at HGV Grand Waikikian or Lagoon tower which have larger rooms and more resort type activities available for kids. Hokulani would be best for: honeymooners, DINKS (double income no kids), or business related trips.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Awesome location, shops and food connected to building. The room was perfect size and really quiet. The staff was amazing. Just a short walk to the beach and other amazing restaurants, great place for couples!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Aloha......This hotel was very accomodating and convenient. It was not necessary to rent a car because you could walk anywhere. If you like to shop this is definitely the place to stay. The people at the hotel were very friendly and helpful and the openness of the lobby area was great. The hotel staff went above and beyond in our opinion.

Richmond Hill, United States

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location...great staff...great rooms...central to everything...definitely number one on my hotel list for Hawaii...thoroughly enjoyed the experience of the hotel... a pleasant change to have friendly staff that are helpful and willing to assist

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The Hokulani has obviously recently been renovated. Lobby is nice. It is located on the corner of Ala Moana and Lewers which makes it a great hotel if you like to shop - if you want the beach - look elsewhere!!!!! There are no signs outside, just the escalator and bellboys eager to assist. The hotel is 2-1/2 blocks from the beach including walking thru an amazing hotel (wondered why we were not there). Most hotels on the beach don't want to rent chairs etc to you. It is also about a 6 block walk to the other Grand Vacations hotels which are exactly what you expect for a Hawaiian Beach Vacation. The Hokulani roof top bartenders are great! The hottub is nice and there is a nice wading pool - about 20' long 3' deep with sitting spot in the middle - good for kids. Nice cabanas. We had an ADA room. The Living/Kitchen area is fairly small, couch/hide-a-bed and small table chairs. Balcony is only good to pull the drapes/windows wide open and enjoy the breeze - you can put a chair on them sideways but that's it. The bedroom is large. The bathroom was bigger than the bedroom - it included two closets, roll-in shower, in-mirror tv and heated bidet type toilet. We sure would have liked the extra space to be living room! If you are there with Grand Vacations and need to take a tour - watch out for Dave. We had been given bad information multiple times prior to arriving in Hawaii, our chat with Dave only made what was supposed to be a great 2nd Honeymoon into an ok time.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Stayed here just a couple weeks ago for business. The hotel location is perfect and within walking distance to everything in Waikiki, including shopping and many, many awesome restaurants. The only downside is there's no rooms with a real ocean-facing room, but if you get a room facing Lewers St, you can look to the right and catch a glimpse of it. The front entrance to the hotel is actually on Lewers Street. So don't circle the block a few times like I did to find it. You should see the valet stand outside.

Alexandria, VA, United States

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Loved the hotel. Great location especially if you like to shop and/or dine out. Close to the beach if you don't mind a little walk. Disappointed in the pool. Very small. Loved the idea but poor execution. Would have used a regular size pool.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My three daughters and I had a wonderful experience at this resort. Everyone was friendly, welcoming, and made us feel like that they truly cared about our experience. I ant to give a special thanks to John, Devon and especially Susan. Susan is a gem and was so kind to my girls. She gave them little homemade trinkets that they really appreciated. I wish I could remember everyone's name because they each deserve a special thanks. If I didn't mention your name, please forgive me as I did appreciate each and every person who assisted us or just gave us a warm smile.The rooms were modern, spotless, and smartly appointed. It was plenty of space for us girls in a 1 bedroom suite with 2 double beds and a sleeper sofa. The kitchen is a great amenity so that we could store left overs and cut down on costs. Others have lamented about the size of the kitchen, but I thought it fit with the design scheme and had everything that we needed. The bathroom was to die for with four ladies getting ready in the mornings as there was plenty of space and options to bathe. Love the soaking tub. Doubly loved the bidet that I didn't know I wanted until now. The café by the lobby is only open half day, but we utilized it every single day. The options were varied, food fresh, and prices were reasonable to me. I expected it to be very expensive, but I thought the price was right for everything. We had fruit cups, bagels, strawberry shortcake, caesar salads, sushi bento, drinks, etc. My only real complaint is that it isn't open all day, but I understand if business flow doesn't warrant longer hours. Many various food options nearby, plenty of shopping, maybe a 5 minute walk to the beach. The rooms have beach towels in the closet if you've forgotten yours. There are free washer and dryers on the floor. Nice! It allowed us to pack clean, dry clothes in our luggage vs sand bags. Wish I could comment more on the rooftop pool/bar, but we really didn't spend much time up there. The bartender was friendly, but we chose to venture out to the beach. The view is nice up there, however. It is also a great relaxation spot to get some peace from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.We love this hotel and we will certainly be back. A beautiful experience all the way around. My girls and I take vacations all over the place multiple times per year and this is one of our absolute best experiences.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: the hokulani was a beautiful place to stay. the only major issue we had was finding the entrance to the place and figuring out parking. we were given no instructions prior that the entrance was on the second floor of an outdoor mall that you can not see from the street much less when its pouring rain. we managed to find the bell/valet desk outside by the curb only after circling the block 3 times all the while calling the hokulani front desk asking directions as we circled the block the last time. it would've been helpful to know that we were supposed to be looking for a small podium type desk next to an escalator and a surf shop rather than a front door with a well marked sign with the name of the hotel. although the valet staff was very efficient and amazing, its seems that there should be some kind of fair warning as well that the only parking available is valet only at $35/day. thank goodness we were only there 3 days. if we had been there for a traditional vacation, that would've cost a fortune. but with no other options in the immediate area to park they kind of have you on the hook for that one. it would be nice to know that you will be paying this chunk of change if you plan on renting AND PARKING your car.
