honolulu waikiki, United States

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The only thing I would have changed about this room was that it was not ocean front, however, the beach was just a short block away, so not a problem. Restaurant choices were excellent nearby: Ruth's Chris, PF Chang's, etc. The room was fantastic and a really nice experience in way of furnishings, appliances and setup. Wonderful!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hokulani Waikiki was opened 4 months ago by HGVC and what a pleasant surprise. IThe facility, the location and the staff are exceptional. Having been to HGVC in Vegas and Orlando, on The Big Island and at the Hilton Village the amenities, the nearness to the ocean and the upscale ness of facility and area are a welcome opportunity. Compact efficiency within the rooms with surprises such as the built in TV in the bathroom mirror are an added treat. Each of the staff regardless of position is very accommodating and courteous. Walking out the front door is Cheeseburger in Paradise serving breakfast, lunch, dinner and all in between. Coffee houses, upscale restaurants such as Roy's or Ruth Chris and local eateries are doors away. The pool is a cooling pool. There are canvas covered lanais and deck chairs. Waikiki beach a short walking distance. Loved it all!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you are looking for an easy access to the beach, I would not recommend this place. However, this is one of the more modern and beautiful place I have stayed at. The room, the bathroom, and the kitchen was so modern and very nice. The view from the balcony was very disappointing, but we didn't spend too much time in the room so it was tolerable. The bathroom was so awesome; the kids loved the tub and how the water fell from the top. It is located near the shopping area and the other attraction, but not the beach. We had to take a cab to hang out at the beach, but it wasn't too bad. There are a lot of places to eat around here so you are not dependent on the room service, which was nice. The kids enjoyed the rooms and the lobby pool area. There is a decent breakfast area literally right outside of the hotel, super cool.The valet guys remembered us (may be we tipped with ridiculous $$$?) and was very polite and respectful.I would come back here for a couples weekend, but for a family trip, I would not recommend it. I prefer to stay at the Lagoon Tower which is a walking distance from the beach. However, if you are planning other tours (Polynesian tours, etc) this place is a walking distance from the bus stop and very easy to traverse around the island.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The location is great close to shopping,beach, and transportation. Resort is top quality from lobby to the roof pool and bar area. Rooms are large with top off line furnishings. Large tub with TV in the bathroom mirror. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Lila and Cassel front desk were always ready to help with any questions. Cheeseburger Beachwalk is right outside the resort great for all well priced meals. Breakfast was $5.99 and best cheeseburger in Hawaii.Would highly recommend this resort ask for high floor room with ocean view. Great location enjoyable from start to finish.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Things we did not like: Unhelpful / unwelcoming / unprofessional front desk service. Kid size pool. Small rooms. NOT a resort: basic, basic, basic hotel. In a shopping district. Restaurant was a Starbucks open from 8am - 1pm. Things we did like: bartenders at the pool. Wonderful Valet and Bell staff.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Location for shopping and eating is best . Free transportation to/from Hilton Hawaiian Village is desirable. Furnitures and facilities(e.g. bath-tab) should be modified. Poor swimming pool facility was disapponitment.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excelent service and location of Waikiki area. Good for shopping, sightseeing, and relaxing. Needed to use UV cream otherwise getting sunburn on your skin. For good for Japanese people because there are some Japanese speaking staff.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Excellent one bedroom apartments with modern new facilities. The location of this hotel was suburb in the heart of Waikiki and walking distance to the shops, beach and restaurants. The hotel is only 6 months young and beautifully decorated with an impressive bathroom. This hotel is for every type of trip from couples, family to friends sharing.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I stayed at this hotel on my last trip to Hawaii. The hotel is basically brand new and right in the heart of Waikiki. The staff is friendly and if you forgot something like a tooth brush and toothpaste - they will gladly bring one right up to you.I stayed in a suite with a two double beds and the decor was beautiful. Dark wood and flat screen TV's in in the living room and bedroom; a wonderful shower with a rain faucet which I LOVED and a separate bath tub which was nice and deep to soak in. There was a TV in the mirror which was lovely and decent closet space with another closet in the living room. The beds were amazing and the room was very clean as was the entire hotel.The kitchen area had a stove top and a small fridge and I loved the modern drawers which shut themselves and the slide out wall cupboard to hold dishes etc.They give you a free DVD rental when you check in that you can play on your Playstation that they provide in your room for the children.The only thing that I didn't like about this hotel was the cost of parking. It is completely valet and cost $35.00 a night, but the hotel was so beautiful and convenient, that it didn't bother me all that much.Great place to stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone ~

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Aloha! My wife and I had an amazingly great time. Everyone was super friendly. We chanted "Everything is Awesome!" (Lego Movie) as we crossed the lobby and said Hi to everyone. My only qualm: Room service would not restock the coffee in the room. We ran out of coffee on day 3 of an 8 day trip (Epic Fail) I suggest the Hotel sell the Kuereg like containers or provide complimentary-and make those packets of caffeinated bliss rain from heaven because HGVC loves their customers. "Coffee needs to rain from Heaven!" (Wife is chanting in the background). We'll be back, but with our OWN coffee machine (Sad Face)....

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Best kep secret and I want it to stay that way. Very elegant and romantic at the same time. The night life is within walking distance so are the local dinning experience. Will visit again!! Best part is that there is valet service and it's a great way not to be hassled with parking the rental car.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed at the Hilton Hokulani Waikiki (HGVC) resort for a week in early April 2014. As with all Hilton properties, customer service is their mission. Every person we met and interacted with, from the greeters, to front desk staff, valets, consierge, recreation/facility staff and the pool/deck lounge people were fantastic! They really go out of their way to make evrything as easy and comfortable as possible for you. The response to questions and any issues was immediate and thorough. Then, there was the follow-through to make sure evrything was perfect for us. We had a great time and would love to go back!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed for our honeymoon! WOW factor was in effect! Loved the rooms! Its like being in New York City but having the beach less than a block away. You can step right out to any restaurant without having to pay high resort fees. Sean, Mrs. Richards and the reservation people are great. Loved it. Will be back.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We are HGVC owners at Hokulani and Grand Waikikian. We had a corner room on the tenth floor and the suites are beautiful. Pros: central location, King sized bed very comfy, 5 min walk to the beach, the best ABC store with a deli right across the road, elevator security system, very friendly and helpful hotel staff. Other reviewers have commented on the distance to the beach - i don't know what route you took for it to be > 5 min walk. And as for the "complicated" elevator system another reviewer commented on - all you have to do is place your room card on the sensor and enter your floor - nothing complicated.Cons: no luggage shuttle between Hokulani and Grand Waikikian - this needs to change for HGVC owners. the HGVC speedy shuttle stops by the hotel often enough and it is a no brainer to offer this convenience to owners. Street noise is a problem - could hear the party revellers to the street fights in the early hours. Need double glazing. We have stayed on some of the busiest streets in the world and could not hear the street noise. The sofa bed mattress is about 3 inches thick and is lumpy and uncomfortable. Cafe on site is a beautiful space but was always empty. Prices are reasonable but food looked stale. and with the made to order ABC deli across the road (that accept phone orders for take out!) you wouldn't eat at the cafe. Has a rooftop lounge area with private cabanas that you see on cruise ships - nice enough space but more of an adult space than kid friendly pool.being a new hotel - i was surprised that there was no feedback card. even we checked out - no one asked how our stay was. very surprising for a hilton.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: You can miss the entrance from the street (Lewers street) easily. Look for a valet kiosk next to the ABC store and what appears to be an unmarked driveway. Right behind the kiosk are escalators that bring you up to "Cheeseburger" restaurant which is right next to the entrance to the hotel lobby. You have to stop at the kiosk to drop your car off. The valets will take your keys, count your bags and give you a ticket. When you check in at the front desk upstairs, give the receptionist the ticket, and they will have your bags brought to your room. They only have valet parking for $35/day, but if you want to save a few dollars, you can park your car at the post office a couple of blocks over on Saratoga street for $20/24 hrs. It's about a 5 to 7 minute walk.The elevators are very high tech and take some getting used to. You have to scan your room card to a sensor on the wall (outside the elevator), then type the number of the floor you want to go to. Then you get into the elevator and press the "close door" button. There are no floor buttons inside the elevator, just close door/open door. You wouldn't be able to tell how many floors are in the building with this interface, or make any last minute decisions to go to the rooftop. I find that it makes it rather difficult when multiple persons staying on different floors need to use the same elevator at once. I was behind a lady one morning, that by the time I finished typing in my floor, she was in the elevator and the doors closed. I had to take the next one. So I guess you could say that the elevators are made so that you take them up by yourself. The other plus side to this is, your snot-nosed little brats can't push all the elevator buttons, forcing you to take the "scenic route" by stoping at each floor up or down. Which by the way, happens to me quite often.The bathroom. Huge and Luxurious. Waterfall shower with optional hand shower. Nice big free-standing tub. Two sinks, plenty of towels, space-aged television built into the giant mirror; something straight out of Star Trek. The bathroom is about as big as the bedroom. There are two closets for your clothes. You could probably have a small party in there. And speaking of party, I feel this next item is of the utmost importance to your experience. The toilet is in its own little room. It's not an ordinary toilet, it's got an electronically operated bidet. Oh yes, much like those fancy massage chairs that you can control the settings to, the bidet can be set to give your "bat cave" an oscillating cleansing massage. I must have sat there an extra ten minutes of guilty pleasure adjusting the flow pressure, temperature and oscillation.The kitchenette. Not really ideal for cooking full multi-course meals, but sufficient enough for maybe breakfast and meals that require little preparation. No oven but there is a microwave. Also at your convenience are a heated drawer with plates and utensils, pantry containing lots of glasses, rice cooker and ice bucket and toaster. There's a nice little refrigerator with see-through door, pull out freezer with ice maker and a single cup coffee maker. You need to read the illustrated instructions for the coffee machine. It's not exactly a Keurig. Got dirty laundry? There are free washers and dryers on every floor.The suite is configured to where you can compartmentalize the bedroom or open up the whole space to the outside with all of the sliding doors. That's probably why the balcony is kind of small. You get another 2 TVs in addition to the one in the bathroom and also a Playstation 3. They'll give you a DVD withdrawal card where you can go to the business center and checkout DVD's one at a time for free. (They are actually Blue ray discs)The rooftop pool is more for sitting in and ordering drinks and they do have a hot tub, but the beach is like a block away if you really want to have fun in the water or just relax on the cool sand. If you have the fundage, the cabanas on the roof cost around $175 for the day.Hotel service was great. The valets were very helpful with bags and such, like how to operate the equipment in the room and the front staff were very accommodating. They let us check out at 12 and even offered to store our bags and use the rooftop showers later in the day if we wanted. The location is convenient to a lot of shopping, food, massage, and the beach. It was really awesome staying here.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is my 1st time in Hawaii. I came out here with my whole family to celebrate my 30th Birthday. I was a little nervous about checking into this hotel b/c of the reviews I read. But after checking in I was impressed. The check in lady was absolutely great. She was very kind and courteous and the bell guy Mike was very knowledgeable about the town. The kitchen is bit small as stated in previous reviews but all in all it's a great room. At that moment, I was definitely happy and excited I was able to book this hotel. And then it all went downhill when I went to get my car from Valet. This is my first time ever reviewing a hotel, but I did it b/c I feel that what happened to me and the hotel's Valet is a MAJOR CONCERN. It makes me question on the hotel b/c of who they trust to do business with. I would hate for what happened to me, to happen to anyone else. This alone would make me not want to stay here again, especially if you pay the price it costs to stay here. The Valet is horrible. First off, they want to charge you $35/day. With that price, I would expect them to take better care of my car, even if it is just a rental. I left my car downstairs with the Valet so I can check in and unpack my belongings. The Valet attendant said he would take my car to the garage while I settle in, and pull it out when I come back. After about 45mins I came back out and they gave me my car. When I was about to get in, I noticed that there was a HUGE scratch from the back of the car, to the front of the car. It was about 8 feet long. I calmly asked the Valet attendant what happened to my car and he said that it was there when we dropped it off. I tried to be calm about it b/c I didn't want to get worked up and ruin my trip. Anyway, I told the Valet guy that the car was not like that when I dropped it off and asked what are we going to do about it. He still continued to go on about how it was there when we dropped it off, and how the other Valet attendant told him it was there when we dropped it off. Meaning he didn't see that it was there when we dropped it off with his own eyes, he took some other guy's word for it and made it his own. When we asked to speak with the other Valet attendant who pointed it out to him, he said he was already off. Then he said that "oh the bell guy who took the luggage even saw it." So we asked to speak with the bell guy and continued to ask him what are we going to do about it. Instead of trying to offer a solution or some type of protocol on what to do in these incidents, he immediately went into defense mode and starting accusing us of trying to put the blame of the scratch on them and continued to say "It was there when you guys dropped it off and all I did was back it up to the garage and pulled it out when you came back." It was like a broken record. I pointed out that scratch was new b/c the car is maroon and the scratch is BRIGHT WHITE. AND there were still car particles from the scratch falling from the paint. It's a rental car so of course there are little scratches here and there, but you could tell that those scratches are old b/c they are faded. But this scratch was BRAND NEW. Any one who saw it could tell it was a fresh scratch b/c we were still about to wipe off the access residual from the scratch off the car. From the 45mins I took to check in and settle into my room, to the time I came downstairs to leave, there was a huge scratch that was put on my car, and I said I needed to know what happened to it while I left it in their hands. Not only did he continue to say it was there when we dropped it off, he said "WELL IT'S YOUR WORD, AGAINST MINE!!" Now what type of customer service is this?!?!?! I expect more from this hotel. That right there made me not only want to scream but it just ruined my entire day and possibly my trip. I asked him for his supervisor and he said he was the supervisor. By that time Mike (the bell guy) came down. He didn't say he noticed the scratch (meaning the valet "supervisor" probably lied) and the first thing Mike did was apologize that we have to go through this. And it wasn't until Mike came that we were able to go through the process of possibly resolving the issue. Then Mike got the actual supervisor for the Valet to come out and introduced us to him. At the end of this, I spent about a good 2 hrs from the time I came down to pick up my car, to the time I finished arguing with the Valet attendant, filing an incident report, and filing a police report. And of course, b/c this hotel is located right in the heart of Waikiki, I had to do this in front of everyone to watch. Not only was it draining but it was absolutely embarrassing. I came to my brother's hotel b/c I had to get away from the whole scene. And to top it off, when I got to my brother's hotel, I noticed that the rear view mirror of my driver side is missing a piece. Meaning this is something else that they probably messed up. I was so caught up on the huge scratch on the car, I didn't even think to walk around it again and see if there was anything else wrong. I'm just at the point to where I don't even want to deal with having to go back and tell them that I have something else messed up on my car. I already have to spend my evening calling the rental car company and my insurance to make sure this is covered. This is not how I wanted to spend my first Saturday night in Hawaii. Not only that, now I have to go find somewhere else to park my car, b/c I refuse to go through their valet again. I'd rather park my own car after this. I'm hoping one of the neighboring hotels will let me pay to park in their garages. Not only will it probably be cheaper, but it'll probably be safer as well. Heck I'll probably just stay here at my brother's hotel tonight so I don't have to deal with having to find somewhere to park tonight. And to think I have try to figure out where to park until I check out on March 28th. UGGGHHH! If you were able to read through this long review, hopefully it was useful and hopefully you won't have to deal with what I just dealt with. Definitely ruined my Hawaiian island experience. If after reading this, and you still trust to park your car here, make sure you do a walk around when you drop it off and again when you pick it up. Or better yet, just tell them that you'd prefer to ride shot gun while they park your car. I wish I would've booked a different hotel after this incident.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed in a 1-BR suite at the Hokulani 4 nights using HGVC club points, so some policies may be different for cash customers.PROS:-my wife loved the suite feel and design with wooden floors and muted Asian colors (probably a Japanese designer was used). It felt like a small modern apartment with kitchen and large bathroom with a fully functional Japanese Toto toilet. Not a noisy room even though we were just two floors above Lewers near Kalakaua Avenue. -very central Waikiki location across the street from the Sheraton Center and a block away from the Kuhio-Lewers bus stop where practically any bus you need will stop.CONS:-early checkout. We were told to checkout by 10am, but got an extension to noon.-no beach. This is a city location, and no privileges to the Hilton Hawaiian Village beach and facilities were made available.-no housekeeping during our stay, but this may only apply to HGVC members.-could not figure out the AC control, so it was turned off at night. -Concierge staff not very helpful (competent), e.g., promised restaurant reservations were not made, and seemed to rotate with the Hilton Hawaiian Village.-no restaurant on site, but plenty of selection at the Sheraton Center across the street.CONFUSION:-physical entrance is by escalator on Lewers Street, but the hotel address is Kalakaua Avenue.-parking entrance is on Kalahaua Avenue, but it's not obvious.-we found it cheaper and less stressful to use the bus and taxis instead of renting a car.CONCLUSION. We would stay here again and recommend it to friends. Key selling points are the room decor/design and location. The hotel was not officially open until around February 2014, so hopefully service problems encountered by earlier reviewers have been solved. For those using HGVC points, this property costs at least twice as much as the Hilton Hawaiian Village.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I am at the hotel until the 12 of March, after going around the block about 10 times I finally found the entrance. Valet is not present at this hotel. After reviewing it on trip advisor, I was not sure however I already paid in advanced and could not change the hotel. Now I understand the problems that are mentioned on trip advisor. First off I missed my flight to go to Muai for 2 days because their was no Valet person at 5:30 am to get my car. It took the front desk 25 minutes to find them. Luckily I flew with Hawaiian Air line and they put me on a flight a hour after mine. Second the noise from the sliding doors is so noticeable, I downloaded a app for my phone to check decimals, at the bed its 23. The problem is that the sound is not constant, a lot of road noise, the sliding doors don't function because their are issues with the design. This is evident because the locks don't work and they comprised with a hook and a pin. After reading the reviews one of them mentioned about amenity's, they are all true. The gym is a bench with a few pounds, the room size is 14 by 12 feet. No place to stay after dawn, they close the roof top pool, only option is to go on your Balcony that is 2 feet wide, you can't even put a chair outside. hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I was wondering before we visited why there are a number of less than glowing reviews of this new Hilton property, and having stayed there, I now understand. The emphasis here is not on the hotel and guest services, but on the time share properties. If you have elite status (diamond or gold with the Hilton), do not expect to see any of the usual loyalty benefits: breakfast, water, a welcome drink, or even attention to your room preferences. If those things are important to you, this isn't the property for you, as other reviewers have noted. We were disappointed to arrive after a long flight and to be told that--although we'd asked for a quiet room on a higher floor--the only available rooms were an "accessible" room with no bath tub and an open transfer shower (great if that is what you've ordered--but it wasn't what we had requested and paid $300 a night for), or one on the first floor of rooms, right on the noisy restaurant, just above street, level, with a lanai door that does not open. A lot of the reason that I try to maintain loyalty is that I got tired of the experience of having to argue my way out of the room in the elevator shaft. We took the accessible room, which faced the backside of the hotel, as it was on floor eight. We could still hear a good deal of traffic noise, and forget sleeping through the early morning garbage pick up. We also heard a lot of banging that night, whether from a room above or beside us, we couldn't tell. In the morning, a sales person first thing tried to get us to sign up for the two-hour time-share info session.We were, though, able to change rooms the next day. We found Cassel, who worked at the desk, very friendly and helpful (not so much our experience checking in the first evening). We were in a lovely room on the 15th floor for the rest of our stay, and were quite happy. We loved having a kitchen, and it's a very nice little one, with good pots and pans, a good toaster, even a little dishwasher. The kitchen is probably the most unique and pleasant thing about the units. We had no problems with noise on that high floor. it's great to have access to a washer and dryer, and the suite itself was altogether comfortable, with a dining table and small living room area. The bath tub is interesting, with the water pouring from the ceiling into the pipe-free tub. That seems more like a gimmick than a convenience, though--it's a bit awkward to run water while you're in the tub. As others have said, this is a city/ condo experience, rather than a resort experience. The roof top pool is a plunge pool--about a lane wide, with a barrier in the middle. Nice view of the ocean from the roof! The hotel is smack in the middle of the city, surrounded by shops.Oh--we thought that the coffee machine pod coffee was pretty much undrinkable, so I'd recommend taking along some coffee and a drip cone.If I knew I could reserve a quiet room on a high floor, I'd stay here again without question. But given the whole experience, I'll try one of the other Hilton's, aimed at the hotel guest rather than the Time Share crowd, next time.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: It's in the center of Waikiki, Beach Walk. Everything is within reach. Very nice staff, kind and helpful. You can enjoy its excellent hospitality behind a secret door at Kalakaua. Will be very happy to stay again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I am reviewing the Hokulani during the week of my stay (Feb. 22-28).. In my opinion, this location is ideal for the business traveler or a couples getaway. The size and the amenities are ideal for singles and couples. The ambience here caters to adults and less to families with children.The previous reviewer and I do agree the excessive daily valet parking fee is a bit much.The rooftop pool and jacuzzi is wonderful. It is a good place for sun and relaxation without the crowds and sand at the beach.Stores, shopping, and restaurants are abundant in the area. hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: If you are looking for a quiet, beach destination, this hotel is NOT for you. If you are looking for a location near the upscale shopping scene or trendy nightclub venues, this is the place for you.The staff at the hotel cannot be beat. They are friendly, helpful and professionalOn the plus side for the hotel: The rooms were clean and spacious. The bathroom is HUGE and unique. (but with no tub shower curtain and a see-through shower stall there isn't any privacy) The plunge pool and lounge area on the roof were great and there is a great view from the roof.There is a small balcony in the unit but most of the view is of the backside of other buildings. There is an ABC store located downstairs and restaurants, bars and shopping within walking distance.There is free-wi-fi and free computer use. They also offer free DVD rental. On the negative side: While the bedroom beds were very comfortable, the couch pull-out bed was NOT. It was very uncomfortable. The hotel is NOT in a quiet area. There is constant traffic, constant noise and there is about a ten minute walk to get to the beach.Since it is a time-share location, housekeeping service is only every third day.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: My stay at the Hokulani HGVC was outstanding. The accommodations were amazing and I was very pleased at the resort. The bathroom was a amazing. It had a beautiful large glass shower. The bathroom mirror had a TV in it. The picture was stunning. The living room and bedroom were small. But the place was cozy, quiet and pleasant to stay. I would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: As usual, this Hilton property is lovely and has all the bells and whistles you would expect including a tv in the bathroom mirror. Location is right at one end of the Waikiki Beach Walk so many restaurants, shops are convenient. The one bedroom with king bed was very comfortable for 2, but privacy could be an issue if you intend to use the sofa bed in the living area for other guests. There are only sliding doors between living room and bed room.There is no parking other than valet which runs $35 per day. We bought a pass for the parking lot at Fort Derussy 2 blocks away and spent less.The kitchenette is more than adequate for easy meals however, I would like to know how they expect you to make coffee when you run out of the few prepackaged cartridges for the fancy coffee maker. When I asked (after 4 days) for a few more of the coffee cartridges I was informed by housekeeping that they are only provided only upon check in, which leaves you no way to make coffee once you run out of the cartridges. There is Starbucks right across the street. From what we could tell, there are really no great views from the rooms in this hotel. We were on the 15th floor but still saw only the building right next door. There may be some peeks of mountain or city but no ocean views. The properties at Hilton Hawaiian village would be more desirable view wise.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Location - great (once you find it.)Valet only - guys were all great.Rooms - small but clean, new, nice design & fully stocked kitchen. Room suggestion: They say room is good for 4 people (1 bedroom with 2 full size beds & pull out sofa.) Room is very small. We were miserable. 2 of my kids chose to stay in the college dorm instead of hotel at night.Smaller hotel, boutique feel. 16 floors, not overwhelming like the village (but the village has it's upside.)No restaurant but the location is in the middle of multiple restaurants. There is an attached burger spot that serves breakfast, lunch & dinner. No room service.Not on the beach.Tiny rooftop pool & hot tub. Lots of nice lounge chairs and bar. But entire rooftop closes at sunset. Pool & time was a huge disappointment for my family.Overall, I recommend this location for a business trip or quick weekend trip. I recommend the Hilton Village for families.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We loved the Hokulani. Great location and terrific suites. The rooftop is wonderful and Kevin is a TERRIFIC bartender. He made our trip very special. Make sure you look him up when you go!!!The location was very good for going to the beach, catching tour busses, dining, and shopping. We did not need to rent a car because everything was so close.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Hokulani Waikiki is an incredible new hotel from Hilton Grand Vacations. It's located in the Waikiki Beach Walk, at the corner of Kalakaua & Lewers. This is right in the heart of Waikiki, convenient to many great shops, restaurants, and only a short walk to the beach. Some don't like Waikiki but for me, it is the perfect mix of big city amenities along with a nice beach and being an easy drive away from some idyllic beaches.The rooms at Hokulani are all beautiful suites with vast living space with a small galley kitchen, a private bedroom area, and a large bathroom with rainfall shower and a gorgeous bathtub that fills from the ceiling. There is a TV integrated into the mirror, so you can watch while getting ready at the sink or while soaking in the tub.All of the furnishings are of high quality. There is a luxurious feel to the entire property without the intrusive service you find at Halekulani for instance. I found the employees to be very friendly and helpful. They were there for me when I needed them but were discreet when not. Housekeeping was great-- my suite was kept very clean.Parking is valet only. Wait times aren't terrible and the valets are mostly quite good. The fee is a bit steep at $35 but you are in the heart of busy Waikiki. The valet area is a bit hard to find initially-- look for the umbrella on the Lewers side of the hotel.The lobby is on the second floor and is gorgeous. Great water and fire features along with nice seating. The business center is a nice, complimentary self-serve area just off the lobby. The rooftop pooldeck is gorgeous, with beautiful views of Waikiki, the ocean, Diamondhead, mountains, etc. There is a pool bar and friendly staff. Unfortunately, the pool itself is just a little soaking pool. There is also a small jacuzzi available.Hokulani is my new favorite Waikiki hotel. I look forward to my next visit.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel is very luxurious and has very nice amenities but it is somewhat small in size. Besides that the hotel staff is very friendly and accomodating. The only REAL complaint I have is their valet services. Not only do you HAVE TO valet, they charge $35.00 per day to park your car there only to have their attendants take our cars for joy rides. I haven't caught anyone joy riding my car but I overheard the managers at Hokulani speak of a Elite Staff member taking our cars out for joy rides!!! It looks as though it isn't Hilton's employees hired to manage our cars but a vendor company named ELITE PARKING SERVICES which I didn't find very comforting.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: From the minute the shuttle dropped us off, this hotel blew every expectation I had out of the water. The entrance to the lobby is on the second floor of the Waikiki Beach Walk shopping area. When you walk through the doors you automatically feel like you've entered a world of exclusivity. There is a seating area to the right of the lobby that is wonderful, especially at night when the fire bowls are lit and the water sparkles. During the day, this is a fantastic place to sit with your morning Starbucks (right across the street) and enjoy the morning sun. I was told that the lobby bar serves alcohol during the day, but they close at 6 or 7. According to the pool bartender this is because they don't have enough bar staff to sustain additional hours, but it was something that probably wouldn't last much longer. Hopefully he is correct, because they are wasting a great opportunity to make money by serving drinks in this area after dark. All of the rooms at this resort feature one bedroom and are meticulously decorated with a mix of modern contemporary, Asian and Hawaiian. Floors are a beautiful dark hardwood, as are the cabinets, some of the furniture and the bed. The kitchen is amazing. Whomever designed the layout deserves some kind of recognition because they managed to provide every convenience in such a small space. The stove has two burners, the refrigerator is big enough to keep drinks and a few small items cold. Place settings for four are tucked away in a cabinet that is tucked into the wall. There is also a microwave, coffee maker and in-room ice machine. There are also four beach towels tucked away in the closet. If I had to pick something to gripe about it would be that there is only one luggage stand. I would expect in a unit that technically sleeps four, that there would be two. I'm sure if you called and asked for an extra they would bring it without a problem. Also, the safe is located in the bottom right drawer of the bedroom dresser. The bathroom is probably my favorite feature of this place. For starters there is a television integrated into the mirror. So cool. The only other place I have experienced this was at the Venetian in Las Vegas. Be sure to check out the bathtub. The water COMES OUT OF THE CEILING. I didn't take a bath but had a blast watching the tub fill up. Each unit also comes with a Romeo & Juliet lanai. This means there is little room to sit, let alone stand. You are also located about a block from the beach so unless you are on one of the highest floors and facing the ocean, you won't have an ocean view. Odds are your view will be of the city and/or the mountains. The pool is also not to be missed, especially if you are a couple traveling without kids, and like us, aren't particularly fond of them. Lounge chairs are super soft and comfortable. Each come with a set of throw pillows. The pool attendant will give you as many towels as you want, let you pick your spot, and set up an umbrella for you. It is a nice service they provide so tips are appreciated. I didn't realize there would be a pool attendant so I didn't bring cash. Had to go back down to the room to grab a few bucks. The pool is small. Like really small. It's basically a plunge pool, hence my comment about being great for couples who don't like kids screaming and splashing in the water. It isn't kid friendly at all so anyone traveling with kids will likely hit the beach instead. That isn't to say there won't be kids there. We had a few, but they were too small to be obnoxious. The bar serves great drinks and features happy hour starting at 2. Prices aren't cheap, even at happy hour, but you can room charge, which is very convenient. They are lacking food service though. Again, not sure if this is because they are still new and understaffed. I didn't ask. I did ask about hours, and the pool bar, like the lobby bar, closes at 6. Also a shame because the view from up there is fantastic at night with the lights of Waikiki. There are cabanas for rent, each equipped with a television. Was curious about the going rate and was told it was $200 per day. That's a bit expensive. I think others felt the same way because no one rented a cabana during our entire stay. Like all Waikiki hotels (HHV included) you are going to have to pay for parking. The rate at the Hokulani is $35 per day, valet only. The elevators are also a bit tricky and will take some getting used to. In the lobby you flash your room key in front of the sensor then enter the floor number you want. The display will then tell you which elevator to get into. If you are waiting with a group of people make sure you don't just hop on the next elevator that comes by because it won't stop on your floor unless you put the request into the display. You don't need to flash your key to move between floors (i.e. to get to the pool or lobby from your room) but you will need to enter your floor request into the keypad. It might seem like a pain at first, but it is kind of cool, and once you get the hang of it, you'll think nothing of it. Overall this is a perfect choice for Waikiki. I will most certainly be back. We are HGVC owners so I am optimistic that it will be easy for us to return. If you are also an owner and are debating between here and the HHV, you need to keep in mind a couple of things. First, this resort is not on the beach and you won't likely have an ocean view. That said, you are in the heart of Waikiki. Restaurants, shopping, people watching are literally at your doorstep. The beach is a short one block walk away. The HHV is on the beach, however you are far removed from the center of Waikiki. It is a good 10-15 minute walk, which isn't terrible, but if you are looking to be near the center of all the action (and Waikiki is about action), then I would give the Hokulani serious consideration.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Lovely accommodations, though you need to be aware of check-in times. The island is lovely, drive everywhere you can. The gym needs to have a fan, but otherwise it's better than average. Do your hop around the island plans before you get there; concierge didn't have much to offer. Try the cruise around the islands, it's the one thing we missed. But Oahu has plenty to do in and of itself. Climbed Diamond Head (it's long!), went to beach and to a botanical park in the north where several movies were filmed. Gorgeous!

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This was my first time in Hawaii and I really liked this hotel. The suite was huge and the technology in the rooms was great. There was a TV built into the mirror of the bathroom. The roof top pool is very nice and not busy at all. I would recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: This is a new resort..essentially timeshare, but part of the Hilton Family. It has all the most recent 'bells and whistles' and super eco-friendly. The staff are so, so helpful and the resort itself is right in the middle of Waikiki. There is a neat snack bar on the Lobby level and a super skyline lounge on the roof with the ultimate views over Honolulu. 'On a clear day...you can see forever'.I defy anyone to say they would not like this place. Why only 4 stars, then. Two small 'caveats'...There is no swimming pool. The rooftop has a plunge pool, which everone seemed to enjoy. Help you cool off in the sun. The resort, though, is only a block from the beach, so avid swimmers are not too adversly affected. The last point concerns parking. There is only valet and it is expensive ($35 per day!!!) This however, is in common with all cities and the Waikiki hotels so we can't shout too much. Like me, though, you might do without a car and use the money for all the nearby shops and restaurants....Believe me, you will enjoy here.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Pros: great location if looking to stay in Waikiki, central to shops, restaurants and everything Waikiki has to offer; all suites; brand new; awesome large bathroom with vanity, dual sinks, high tech toilet, rain shower, tub that has water coming down from the ceiling (a little odd, but get they are trying to be different and high tech); secure access to your floor with key card; free laundry machines on each floor; clean and spacious suites with fully stocked kitchenettes; nice views; nice friendly staff and valet; great for families and small children; quiet and couldn't hear other rooms through the walls which is always a plusCons: small pool, but we never used it so it didn't affect our stay; can hear street traffic at all hours, but wasn't so bad it was a deal breaker- you are, after all in central bustling Waikiki; no room service or restaurant- but they have a kitchenette in every suite; not the largest suite but great use of space and floor plan; check out time is 10 am; no frills hotel but it's new with luxurious bathroom; valet parking is steep for this type of hotel in my opinion but there isn't any other choice ($35 per day); not much of a balcony if you're into thatOverall, we had a great stay and would stay again and recommend to others. It's a new hotel so it was a lot quieter than Sheraton or other nearby hotels which we preferred. Our toddler enjoyed her stay and was very comfortable. Great location close to everything in Waikiki. We've stayed at the Sheraton, Royal Hawaiian, Hyatt and for the price, prefer this hotel. Especially if you like privacy and quiet. Tips: grab breakfast at Island Vintage Coffee in the am- great coffee, smoothies, breakfast plates and acai bowls! Also those with little kids, there is a little water spray area outside hotel near the Beach Walk :)

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Brand new club in the heart of Waikiki ! Excellent location and staff was great. Room was small but the use of space was excellent. Technology is evident in this hotel as amenties included a TV inside the bathroom mirror and a fully electronic toilet. This reminds me of a Japanese hotel.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Very nice property, everything was in perfect condition, fairly close to the beach and extremely close to shopping and restaurants. Ruths Chris, PF Changs, Cheeseburger in Paradise and Yardhouse all in the same complex. Parking is $35 per night valet only so might be better renting from one of the many car rental offices close by unless you need the car each day. Would definitely use this place again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Great location, walking distance to the beach, shopping and dinning. The facility is beautiful, but the the housekeeping is poor. Our room was only cleaned one time on the 2nd morning,I arrived Thurs. night and Sun. morning it was cleaned and I and to have an argument with the housekeeping manager to get shampoo by the next Thursday, 7 days later. That was the day that we had a cockroach in our bed and when we talked to the Manager, he said, "I guess one got away." I guess I will never stay at this place again.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We were very satisfied with the suite on 14th floor. Everything you need is available. Next time we would go for the king bed instead of 2 doubles since there is only little space in the bedroom. That is partly because of the big and amazing bathroom. Kitchen is also very handy and fully equiped. Lanai is only to stand there and have a look at the surrondings, you cannot sit there together in the evening. Wifi is free as is self laundry which is nice. Parking is valet only and with 35$ per day not a real steal.Although we had a prepaid reservation they blocked more than 2000$ on our credit card without saying a word. We complained, they said it was a mistake and 3 days later we got the money back. But they did not really apologize for that... Positive: we got a 2 hour late check out at no cost which was nice.Overall really a great stay, without the credit card blocking it would have been 5 stars.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: December 2013We checked in to our two rooms at the designated time. We did not get into one of our rooms until 8pm, because the high-tech digital door malfunctioned. The front desk had to get outside technicians to try to fix our door. Meanwhile, we got sent to the roof-top pool which was kind of boring. The hotel just opened, had no liquor license, so there was limited items on the menu. Secondly, the pool was a small plunging pool, so one can't really swim in it. Lastly, it was so windy that we were afraid that our belongings would fly away. We had to complain so many times about the door problem and finally the hotel gave us late check-out on the last day. In conclusion, the rates they charged were too high for a brand new property that was not fully operating yet. It was obvious that the staff was not fully ready either. Communication was slow between different departments (front desk, tech, valet etc.). A property with high potential in general, but just need to get its kinks ironed out.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We were pleasantly surprised by this new property. It offers a great location just 2 blocks from the Waikiki beach and in the middle of great shopping and numerous restaurants. It's so easy to get around by walking or public transportation, no car was needed. We had a 1 bedroom condo on the 11th floor overlooking the Waikiki area with Diamond Head in the distance. It was beautifully furnished and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful and always seemed to be happy we were guests.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The front desk messed up my resevation and I had to literally fight to keep my room. Ihave the highest status with the Hilton Chain, they still treated me as If I were unimportant to them. Wake up calls were not made, intene kept going out. The fire alarm would go off at 5 Am. And check out is at 10 AM, even though check in is at 4 PM. Do they really need 6 hours to clean the room? This place has a lot to learn. This is coing from a very seasoned traveler..

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: We stayed here due to an advertizement received as Hilton Rewards customers. We usually go to Maui but since we had not been to Oahu for several years we took a chance. From the minute we arrived we were treated well and staff was very friendly and helpful. The newly-remodeled suite was better than our expectations and the free Wi-Fi worked very well. The kitchen, bathroom and simply everything was of the best type and condition. We took a suite on the 6th floor with a view from the small balcony of Lewers Street below and we were satisfied in that we really didn't hear a lot of noise. Very convient also to a bunch of restaurants right outside the door plus an ABC store on the lower floor where we bought our daily bananas and misc. as we returned to our room each evening. Excellent experience and within walking distance to everything including public transportation and the Waikiki Trolley. Don't bother getting a rental car as it is not needed and you don't want to pay the very high "valet parking only" fees.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The room is excellent and the bathroom is a treat. The staff are very helpful and kind. It was very nicely located. The only thing I think it needs to improve is the bar - need more choice of drinks and wine, should allow to bring drinks to room, also open the roof top bar longer (current closes at 6 PM).

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: Bathroom is very big, with tub, big shower, and two closets. Two sinks. And a room for toilet. Maybe the bathroom is too big. If you like really fancy bathrooms, you will like this hotel. Staff was very nice. There is no restaurant in this hotel.

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: The hotel is on the corner of Kalakaua and Lewers across from the Royal Hawaiian shopping center. My family loved the spacious master and living rooms, fully stocked kitchen, large and modern bathroom, access to laundry facilities on each floor, and HD TV (with PS3).

hotel_name: Hokulani Waikiki by Hilton Grand Vacations
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 13 nights over Christmas with my husband and adult daughter, it had just opened 2 days before our arrival. The staff are excellent, friendly extremely helpful and any request we had was dealt with quickly. The hotel is on the second level of Lewers Road a very attractive street with 2 ABC stores, gift shops and a number of good restaurants. Each afternoon at 4 there was entertainment outside the shops. The hotel is tucked away on the second level and feels as if you are entering a calming oasis, the lobby is beautifully decorated with a hugh water feature and an attractive bar area. We loved our room 1208 which was at the front of the hotel and we could see the sea. It had all mod cons eg instant boiling water for tea or coffee, an ice maker 2 hugh flat screen tvs and a play station. The beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom amazing with a tv built into the mirror. The shower was huge and the toilet was also a state of the art bidet. A small kitchen was really useful and there are washers and dryers on each floor. Air-con is efficient,and a small balcony is really only for decoration. The roof top area had a small pool only really suitable for cooling off and a separate jacuzzi. This area was relaxing as the loungers were very comfortable and if it got too warm relief could be found in the cabanas which included tvs. There is a panoramic view of Waikiki from the roof, The hotel is small new modern clean and the perfect place to come back to each evening. Its situation is perfect for shopping and is just a 5 minute walk to the beach. A wonderful introduction to Hawaii!
